story:
Welcome to my campaign corner!

My name is Klaudia Rychlicka and I live in Toronto, Canada. I have been passionate about singing for as long as I can remember and in the last few years I discovered a new passion in songwriting. Last spring, I got the opportunity to  sign with a wildly talented production team  duo @thelostboysproductions based in Montreal, Canada to make my dream EP album "Anxious Love" a reality! 

I travelled between Toronto and Montreal within a span of six months to co-write, co-produce and record an album that I have poured my heart into along with some sweat blood and tears. I have worked very hard to make  these songs come to life and cannot wait to share this music with you all!   It is a privilege when you can express your thoughts, worries, fears and joys in such a beautiful art form and if they can speak to at least one person, well then I am a happy camper.

I have been able to cover the cost of  recording, producing as well as travel but in order to create  an album of songs with radio quality, well you can imagine, the  costs add up quick. This campaign can give us a unique opportunity to collaborate and make great art together!

Your donation will cover costs of my project:

  • Mixing and mastering with Sterling Sounds audio mastering studio : each track will get mixed to create the right balance between the instruments, textures, and colours that make up a track. As a final step, the album will be mastered from beginning to end, so the listening experience is cohesive and carefully choreographed from start to finish.

***The material is ready for release! This campaign is the final step towards the finish line in creating my  professionally produced studio  EP album and I cannot be more excited!

How much I appreciate it:

I have always thought of music as a universal language, a language of the soul and it’s been a constant outlet, passion and extension of who I am. Although  it’s not always easy to share such a big part of yourself. However, for the first time in a long while, I feel really ready to give back and offer what I love in hopes that others will be able to relate to it too!

What you will get for your generosity and support? 

I am beyond grateful for any support you can lend to this campaign. In exchange for your generosity, I’ve put together a really exciting group of gifts that are available exclusively through your participation in this campaign!

**If you’re ready to contribute, select your favourite perk or just clink the  “Back it” button on the top right of this page and write in any amount you’d like to donate. Every little bit counts and again I cannot express how much I appreciate all of your support!

 

Thank you for contributing,

Love,

Klaudia

story:
What’s the scoop, and who is Anyan Dévery?

Anyan Dévery (pronounced “any and every”), is short for anything, everything, anyone, and everyone.  Our style ranges from alternative rock to funk to jazz fusion with influences including Snarky Puppy, Radiohead, & Jacob Collier.  The band is comprised of Dave Hamar on drums, Daniel Navarro on bass, Stephen Dornfeld on keys, Joe Coyle on keys, and Will Thomas Scecina on guitar and vocals (all former members of band "Us Four").

What We Need & What You Get

We'd love to have two things:

1) an awesome live studio audience - that includes you!

2) to give you a copy of our concert... and maybe even a copy of our first CD

Since we are doing both a concert and recording, we will be brining in people to help us and also rent sound and recording equipment to make this happen.

Our budget is $2,000 and that should cover the cost of everything from start to finish - sound for the performance, professionally recording the performance, mixing and mastering the recording, and finally, distributing it digitally.

That means you, our audience, are an integral part of this. The ticket cost covers the venue's expenses and this campaign will cover our operating expenses.

We just want to share our music with you and the world and be a part of the excitement of the local music scene in St. Petersburg.

What if I want to see the show but I can't donate right now?

That's alright! If you can't contribute, please come anyway and tell your friends about it so they can come too. Just having you (and maybe your friends) there will make us happy.

Please use any of the share tools here to spread the word... and thanks!

With Love,

Anyan Dévery

 

P.S. Get tickets here:
http://www.thestudioat620.org/ticket-sales

story:
My Story (brief)

Since becoming a follower of Yeshua/Jesus back in 2004, I've dedicated my songwriting and guitar playing to Him and His Glory. Through the years I've written and recorded over 200 demos and I've posted a few on my youtube channel, which has over 2000+ subscribers and over 1,000,000 views! My desire is to continue to release these demos and any new songs as high quality recordings and make them available for download or release them as videos. With a new high powered computer and recording equipment I will be able to continue to release new content that will strengthen and edify the body of Yeshua. So please contribute, share, comment and pray that this project will be used for the glory of God and King Yeshua!

The Money

Here's where your money will go:

  • Apple iMac 27" with Retina 5K Display, Quad Core 3.2GHz Intel core i5, 8GB RAM, 1TB HDD, AMD R9 M390, English - $2599 + $200 Apple Care
  • Logic Pro X Recording Software - $279.99
  • Final Cut Pro Video Editing Software - $399.99
  • Fader - $189
  • Midi Controller - $139

Studio Rack

  • Mic Pre-amp - $589
  • Power Conditioner - $99
  • Headphone Amp $230
  • Audio Interface $549
  • Monitor Management System $879
  • Rack $267
  • Power Back up $66
  • Direct Box $21.90

Distribution

  • Online and Physical Distribution of music $600

GST and Indiegogo fees    $700

Why Crowd Funding?

I haven't released a new video or song since 2014. A big part of that is being married and having kids, working and just not having a lot of extra time to devote to projects. Another reason is I don't feel I have the tools to produce quality songs or videos that can meet the standard of quality that is out there today. With a new workstation and recording equipment I will be releasing songs and videos I've wanted to share for a long time but just haven't had the means to do so.

For example, one of my songs, "The Lamb That Was Slain" was written after hearing the inspiring story of the two brave Moravian missionaries who sold themselves into slavery just to spread the Gospel of Jesus to an isolated island. I would love to re-record this song with drums, guitars and great backing vocals and put it to a video that shows the story of the two Moravians. This is just one of many projects that I'd love to complete someday.

    Who is WOOT?

    The Word of Our Testimony is a collective of artists who desire to see Yeshua exalted through song and video. At the core of WOOT would be myself, Scott Ogden. After becoming a follower of Yeshua/Jesus I began writing songs that would glorify Him and have continued to do so for 13 years. I posted my first video on Youtube in 2009 and have posted 61 videos since. Mostly lyric videos, the Messianic Hebrew Worship videos have received the most views with the video, "Shir Ahava" reaching 600,000+ views. Occasionally I will post a video of me or someone I know performing an original composition. I've enjoyed sharing the Hebrew worship songs I learned while in Israel, as the language itself is so beautiful and I pray many Israelis come to know Yeshua by possibly stumbling onto one of these videos.

    Our core values could be summed up in 3 points:

    • Exalting Yeshua/Jesus through song and video.
    • Encouraging Believers in Yeshua to Worship Him.
    • Encouraging Non-Believers to believe in Yeshua and Worship Him.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute to WOOT Studio you can:

    • Help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign through Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Snapchat, etc.
    • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
    • Pray with us and for us!

Pray with us and for us!

story:
Who are we

Asian Improv aRts is a 501(c)(3) non-profit community based organization committed to producing, promoting, and presenting artistic works representing Asian American experiences. For 30 years we have brought to the community countless works by dozens of accomplished artists dedicated to a vision of compassion and social justice.

Francis Wong (Asian Improv aRts co-founder and creative director) is teaming up with longtime collaborator Tatsu Aoki (Asian Improv aRts Midwest founder and artistic director) to create Asian Improv Nation. It is a national gathering of artists from San Francisco, Chicago, Los Angeles, and Tokyo coming together to collaborate and create a special musical ensemble at the Asian Art Museum on May 20th, 2017.

These artists include:

San Francisco

  • Francis Wong (saxophone)
  • Yangqin Zhao (hammered dulcimer)
  • Melody Takata (taiko)
  • Deszon X. Claiborne (trapset drummer)

LA

  • William Roper (tuba)

Tokyo

  • Chizuru Kineya (shamisen grandmaster)

Chicago

  • Tatsu Aoki (bass)
  • Kioto Aoki (taiko)
  • Mwata Bowden (woodwind)
  • Edward Wilkerson Jr. (woodwind)

Why support this project

This gathering of artists reflects our 30 years’ work borne out of progressive movements by people of color in the 1980s. We stood for affirmative action, immigration reform, the justice for Vincent Chin, redress and reparations for the mass incarceration of Japanese Americans in World War II, and Jesse Jackson’s Rainbow Coalition. These movements and issues are reflected in our musical work in the stylings of jazz improvisation, Black musical culture, Japanese and Chinese instruments, and experimental music traditions.

Here’s a sample of our work:

Premiere performance of Miyoshi Sketches

 Shadow to Shadow

When we started Asian Improv it was out of a need to bring something positive during a bleak time in America. Decades later we are still going strong, with the goal of continuing to create meaningful music in the face of what is to come in these trying times.

We need your help raising $10,000 in 30 days!

Your participation in our project is crucial. In non-profit organizations, fundraising is always a big challenge so we are turning to Indiegogo for help. In wanting to bring high quality artistic work to the public, your donations will go towards paying our artists and staff and supporting production expenses. We humbly accept contributions from individuals like you as well as the organizations and companies that you are a part of. We also offer perks for your generosity: limited edition commemorative “Asian Improv Nation” jacket, shirt, hat, plus these very special perks: Glenn Horiuchi vinyl LPs and Asian Improv aRts CDs.

Spread the word

If you believe that music can bring people together, provide healing and empower communities, please spread the word! Share our campaign on social media and emails, tell your family and friends.  We hope that you can make a contribution; any dollar amount will go a long way.

Thank you for your generosity, and we hope to see you soon!

story:
GREETING EARTHLINGS

I'm Tom Larsen, a singer-songwriter, musician, producer with a new band The Vistanauts (me, Stephanie Selcho, Kent Rytting, Anton Nielsen, Jerod Stutsman) ready to record a debut lp of all new, all original songs.   

IN THE BEGINNING

I started writing songs at 7 (I remember the first, heh: "It's God's Fault") and started home recording them in various contexts beginning at 13 

and on through the years, playing keyboards, then guitar, then singing (see above--me with "Steve-O" of "SLC Punk" movie) in bands I formed or joined, composed for film and video and eventually went solo at 22.   

At 24 I was offered a recording contract from a top UK label, while in talks with legendary producer Ken Scott (Bowie, Beatles, Supertramp, Lou Reed)--but had to walk away from it all.  I had 3 young sons at the time--2 with special needs and realized my young family that needed my full attention (I had vowed early on that I would not allow my personal "dream" to supersede the needs of my family commitments.)  

It crushed me inside--to put that creative drive/compulsion on hold--but I've never doubted it was the right thing to do. And I did still manage to continue writing songs and find ways to record them throughout the intervening years, occasionally performing when opportunities arose.

On a lark of sorts, I applied and got accepted into law school, graduating in the early 2000s.  But it was not my cup of tea (okay, I hated it) and so I went back to my "day job"--housepainting, where I was mostly left alone to continue creating . . . in my mind at the very least, when unable to record or perform my latest new song.

INFLUENCES AND HISTORY

 But rewind a bit: I was turned on to Bowie around age 12, in '74, relating instantly to his "strangeness", his "otherness".  I myself always felt and usually was the outsider.  Neither right nor left . . . and definitely not center; burying myself in anything creative, especially music, writing and art.  Bowie became my main muse--my "mainman", but I also explored all kinds of music, such as Stevie Wonder, Frank Zappa, Todd Rundgren, ENO, Yes, ELP, Kansas, CSN&Y,  Sinatra, Stones, Sly . . . Waylon & Willie, Bacharach and  Prince, to name but a few.

But it was Bowie who predominated my musical studies overall, and so, when, on the day after he died in 2016, my youngest son (also a musician) called me to ask if I'd join his band in a tribute that night singing "Heroes".  I, of course, happily accepted and it turned out to be an impactful performance for all--not many dry eyes that night at the packed venue.

I had already been pondering putting together a "Bowie" cover band and/or a new originals' band--my boys now having grown up--and with my wife, decided "why not?", and "let's just go for it."

And so I did, first forming Major Tom & The Moonboys--a  fantastic band dedicated to the music of David Bowie . . . and then--with the creative fires now reignited, I found myself writing all new material; and so formed this "original's band", The Vistanauts.

WHERE IT ALL STANDS

It's not been easy, but it has been fun and exhilarating to be writing, performing and now soon to be recording once more.  My 2 sons (of 4) with the special needs--while indeed are "grown up"--still live at home and yet need help and resources . . . hence my request for help here to make this--at long last--debut album.  They are 100% supportive and excited for this venture which has brought new excitement and hope to the whole household.

WHERE THE MONEY GOES

Age has its perks (combined with pent-up creative energy) and because of this I will be able to record a full-length album of the highest quality, all new songs, complete with a string section and choir (where needed:) for $9,000.00,   This will also include a commissioned custom art piece for the album cover rendered by renowned local artist Cody Chamberlain

This budget will also go towards a run of cd's and a batch of Ltd. Edition vinyl versions of the Lp (I'm still hopelessly old-school in many ways), and include the usual costs of musicians, mixing and mastering and costs associated with related publishing and promotion, plus Tee-Shirts, posters and hats.  

THE PAYOFF

I know I'm not alone in having passed on dreams only to want to revive them again and trust that this project--The Vistanauts Debut Album "Apollo Down" will be an inspiration to dreamers and "outsiders" young and old where'er they may be as well as provide some much needed (some would say) excellent new music!

Thank you! for reading this and for WHATEVER you feel led to do to help the cause, whether it be through donations or passing along the story. . . .

story:
RAFA premier album :"Guentena"

Ramcess et Défa sont deux jeunes chanteuses originaires de Saint Louis du Sénégal.

En 2014, elles sont découvertes lors de leur participation au festival Métissons de saint-Louis ou elles sont invitées sur scène par Maréma (grand prix RFI 2014). Le président du festival leur propose de devenir leur agent.Elles prennent alors le nom de RAFA et un orchestre est composé pour les accompagner. Elles se produisent pour la première fois sur scène en février 2015. Leur réputation grandit alors rapidement (près de 100 concert la première année) et les contraint à s'installer dans la capitale, Dakar, pour répondre à la demande.

Deux singles sont enregistrés ("réthiou" et "Mandela"qui sont leurs propres compositions  arrangées par dimitri réverchon, ex wock qui fut grand prix Rfi dans les années 90-disponible en streaming, tapez sur google "rafa boukan"). Les médias nationaux commencent à s'intéresser à elles ainsi qu'une importante compagnie agricole de la vallée du fleuve, la CASL, qui leur propose de promouvoir l'autosuffisance alimentaire au sénégal.

Elles partagent aussi la scène avec des artistes nationaux (souleymane Faye,Maréma, Carlou.D, Fata, Viviane, Pape Niang, Takeifa, Viviane...) qui ne tarissent pas d'éloges sur elles. C'est aussi Youri Lenquette, le légendaire photographe de la presse musicale (qui obtint le sinistre "coup" de photographier Kurt Cobain un pistolet sur la tempe!) qui, les découvrant sur scène, leur proposa une séance de shouting. Vous pouvez admirer le résultat sur cette page.

En 2015, elles retrouvent le festival Métissons et rencontrent Jimi M'Baye ( Youssou N'Dour, Peter Gabriel, Carlos Santana...) qui leur rend un hommage touchant sur scène.

Jimi accepte de réaliser ensuite leur premier album dans son propre studio (à un tarif plus qu'"amical") et promet meme d'assurer quelques parties de guitare.

"Guenteuna" ("j'ai fais un reve" en wolof) est l'album qui contiendra les premières compositions de RAFA plus deux inédits. L'enregistrement se fera dans les conditions du "live", plus adapté à l'esprit de Rafa.

Le financement.

Rafa a choisi d'auto-produire ce premier album. Une partie du financement est déjà disponible grace aux produits des concerts et du mécénat de certains fans. Cependant, malgré les conditions "amicales" concédées par Jimi M'Baye, 2500 USD sont encore à trouver pour finaliser le projet.

Le budget

Studio (enregistrement-mixage-mastering) : 3000 USD

Musiciens (4) 1000 USD

premier tirage 2000 cd avec pochettes(pour ventes concerts et contreparties indiegogo et mécènes): 2000 USD

TOTAL -6000 USD

Nous sommes en mesure aujourd'hui de financer le projet à hauteur de 3500 USD

Nous vous sollicitons pour la partie restante, soit 2500 USD

Les contreparties que nous vous proposons contiennent entre autres (cd, album numérique...) des vidéo conférences, car nous aimons échanger avec ceux qui nous aiment et nous soutiennent. Vous pouvez d'ailleurs le faire dès à présent et en savoir plus sur notre actualité en allant sur notre page facebook ou notre chaine you tube: rafa boukan.

Le petit mot de Rafa

"Votre participation est la dernière étape nécessaire à la réussite de ce projet. Nous travaillons dur depuis nos débuts à Saint-Louis et, si les encouragements et les moments de joie n'ont pas manqué, les obstacles ont parfois été difficiles à surmonter pour nous, jeunes chanteuses africaines, qui ont cependant toujours tout sacrifier à notre métier. Partagez cette campagne ou parlez de nous autour de vous... celà aussi contribuera à notre réussite"

(Ramcess et Défa).

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

Alle Songs sind geschrieben und bei Konzerten live getestet. Die Band: Björn Stasch (Gesang, Gitarre), Johannes Pfund (Gitarre, Gesang, Percussion), Maurice Hüsni (Orgel, Gesang), Bodo Martin (Kontrabass) und Tony Ramenda (Schlagzeug, Gesang).  

  • Die Aufnahmen finden bei Johannes Hautop (Dresden) und Sonic Music (Chemnitz) statt. Abgemischt wird im Proton Studio in Leipzig von Torsten Schroth, einem ausgewiesenen Reggae-Produzenten und selbst langjährigen Reggae-Musiker (Ten Colours, Yellow Umbrella) mit vielen einschlägigen Referenzen (u.a. Julian Marley, Fettes Brot, Ronny Trettmann, Yellow Umbrella). Das Mastering erfolgt im dafür prädistinierten Echolux Studio (Leipzig).

Bitte mehrReggae!!

  • Angesichts der deutschen Musiklandschaft wird es unserer Meinung nach höchste Zeit für den guten alten Reggae & Rocksteady mit anspruchsvollen deutschen Texten. Und ja: wir wollen unsere Songs im Radio hören und im nächsten Jahr natürlich gemeinsam mit Euch auf den Festivals dieser Republik feiern - nicht 'nur' den Reggaefestivals. Deshalb ist eine professionelle Produktion unumgänglich. Durch den Totalverlust unseres Bandbusses durch einen Brand auf dem Weg zu einem Konzert sind wir leider auf fremde Hilfe hierfür angewiesen.
  • Unser Mann am Bass (Bodo Martin) hat bereits 2013 erfolgreich das Reggae-Album '1st' mit der Offbeat Foundation (Band des ehem. Yellow Umbrella - Sängers und Songschreibers Enrico Mildner in Dresden) veröffentlicht und mit dieser CD im Gepäck über 40  Konzerte gespielt, u.a. einen Suppost-Gig für die legendären Skatalites im Yaam Berlin, verfügt also über die entsprechende Erfahrung und das Know How für so eine Produktion. Die Platte erschien bei 'rain records', dem Label von Yellow Umbrella, auch unser Erstling wird dort gelistet sein. Darüber hinaus spielt er Bass bei Band 'RAT RACE - Tribute to Bob Marley & The Wailers' und sorgt mit seinem Booking-Netzwerk bereits jetzt für Konzertanfragen - allen voran natürlich unser Release-Konzert am 18.11. im Werk 2 (Leipzig). Denn an diesem Abend veröffentlichen auch Yellow Umbrella dort ihr neues Album 'hooligans of love'. Produziert übrigens ebenfalls im Proton-Studio Leipzig.

story:
D(eMarko) E(ileen) A(braham) and R(yan) are coming back together for the DEAR Project. Abraham's debut album is dropping in January and includes one of DEAR's songs, Waves. Coming back together after over a year-long hiatus, we are going to professionally record our old music as well as new ones into a full-length DEAR Project album. We are also making a music video for Waves, one of our more hearty and wholesome songs. We are excited to jump in on this soon and start production on everything in the next month, but we need to raise funds to get this all done. So we are hoping that you, our loving and sweet friends, family, and fans, will help us achieve this. We've got some great things waiting for you.

To hear more of our music (from our first serendipitous album), visit http://dearthebandmusic.bandcamp.com

story:
Click for private listen to Elijah Rock's single 'Gershwin For My Soul' on SOUNDCLOUD!  

 

ELIJAH ROCK FEATURED ON:

 

Click Image Above to Read Article:

AND 

Click to Image Above to Read Article:

The Lowdown

This Album was made possible by the support of my fans, friends and family via the success of my 1st Indiegogo Campaign almost a year ago! RECORDING, MIXING & MASTERING "GERSHWIN FOR MY SOUL"  was a tremendous success! Now the rubber hits the ROAD! By releasing the album independently on JANUARY 17th, 2017, produce a Music Video and hire a Public Relations, Social Media and Marketing Team to get the word out! YOUR SUPPORT COUNTS!!!  THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!

What We Need 

  • MUSIC VIDEO 
  • DIGITAL MARKETING/ SOCIAL MEDIA 
  • PUBLIC RELATIONS 
  • TOUR/BAND SUPPORT

What You Get- PERKS! PERKS! PERKS!

       

      

 

IMPORTANCE OF SCOTT THOMPSON- PUBLICIST

Thompson served as Assistant Director of Public Relations for Jazz at Lincoln Center for almost a decade. He was brought in to help launch the organization's new facilities in the Time Warner Center at Columbus Circle in 2004. He was also Publicist for Dizzy's Club Coca-Cola. During that time, he established himself as a leading publicist in the entertainment field, garnering praise from peers and music professionals alike.

SOCIAL MEDIA/DIGITAL MARKETING

Miles High Productions (MHP) was created to bridge the gap of companies working directly with music artists and entertainment based projects who are in need of additional marketing support.  MHP’s goal is to elevate your product or artist to a higher ground in an expedient timeframe by exposing them to new and existing online audiences. MHP also focuses on taking our campaigns one step further by cross-promoting all traditional methods of marketing with online opportunities for further outreach.

UPCOMING NEWS!!!

I will be featured in the WINTER/DECEMBER 2016 Edition of

#1 JAZZIZ Magazine - The Authoritative Voice in Jazz!

"GERSHWIN FOR MY SOUL" LP

Few are called and fewer still are able to keenly rekindle the starlight from golden eras gone by. While said eras harbor timeless treasure chests of standards, those songs are often performed as museum pieces by well-meaning torchbearers instead of moving, living things with miles to go before they sleep. Singer/dancer/actor Elijah Rock has the triple threat skills and blood-pumping heart to breathe life into classic music as he proved on stage as ‘Crooner’ in the musical “Words By Ira Gershwin.” Now he has taken that more traditionalist template and, along with producer/arranger/pianist Kevin Toney, prepared a contemporary and decidedly African American twist to the music of George & Ira Gershwin (and a couple of Ira’s other collaborators) with the innovative recording Gershwin For My Soul.

Gershwin For My Soul represents a full circle journey for Cleveland-born baritone Elijah Rock. He began singing at age 13 and stepped up to his first Gershwin songs at 16 in “Porgy & Bess” at the Cleveland Institute of Music. No less than the great Freddy Cole once told him, “Learn a standard a day and you’ll be alright!” Along with the Great American Songbook, show tunes, art songs and other classics that colored him Broadway-bound, Elijah always returned to Gershwin. It was while doing “Words By Ira Gershwin” that he learned how brothers George & Ira were godfather geniuses of Tin Pan Alley in the early 20th century. Reading Michael Feinstein’s book “The Gershwins and Me” sealed the deal.

Carrying this art forward, Elijah Rock dove into this project with relish and the trio of producer/arranger/pianist Kevin Toney, bassist John B. Williams and drummer Greg Paul, plus guitarist Jacques Lesure in the west coast jazz sanctuary of Nolan Shaheed’s studio. The 12-song CD opens with “S’Wonderful,” a tender fitting contemporary take a la Al Jarreau. “Fascinating Rhythm” and “Our Love Is Here To Stay” are drenched in that punchy syncopated manner that most recalls their original era, the latter with some of Toney’s signature piano flourish. “I Can’t Get Started” swings and chugs with a four on the floor groove while the lovely “Long Ago and Far Away” floats on a slow hot wind bossa beat. Elijah milks the rarely heard extended introduction to “How Long Has This Been Goin’ On” before it falls like feathers into the brushed blues of its well known verses.

The second half of Gershwin For My Soul is where more chances are taken. The title track – the sole original penned by Rock and Toney – is a hip churchy blues where Elijah testifies his fascination with all things Gershwin. It’s followed boldly by “Tchaikovsky (And Other Russians),” a Hip Hop Swing interlude perfect post the Tonys-sweeping genre bending musical “Hamilton.” And Elijah brings his tap shoes in for solo and drum-dueling duties on the revival rave-up stomp “I Got Plenty O’ Nuttin’.” Most movingly, the focus becomes sheer aural nudity on a trio of ballads Elijah submerges into that showcase the full resonant beauty of his voice and his skills of interpretation from the acting world. They are the relaxed and romantic “Shall We Dance” (solely accompanied by the guitar of John Storie), the parlor song swoon of “Love Walked In” (featuring solo piano introduction and accompaniment by Toney), and the tour de force closer “Isn’t It a Pity,” a bluesy ballad wish of delicious diction and a heart-stopping dip into a cinematic so long.  

“Before this experience, I hadn’t really embraced the balladeer aspect of my gift,” Rock reflects. “It was about me being vulnerable enough to know I could do it. It’s been an interesting transformation…everything slowed down. There’s space for introspection and that moment to moment feeling of the lyric. I fell in love with the space between the notes and the simplicity of telling the story.”

Rock – whose resume boasts a decade and a half of acclaimed, across-the-board accomplishments in stage, film and television - found the perfect collaborator in Kevin Toney whose work as a keyboardist, composer, arranger, author, educator and co-founder of the `70s R&B-Jazz group The Blackbyrds provided the optimal springboard for Rock to bounce concepts off. “Kevin Toney is a virtuoso whose experience speaks for itself,” Rock says. “We brought our authentic creative selves to the material and, in that, it became uniquely ours.” Targeting performance arts centers and playhouses as well as traditional music venues, Elijah will bring a unique live presentation of this music with theatrical, staging, choreography and lighting elements that position the show as more than a stand-up vocal concert yet not quite a full-on musical. Directed by Saundra McClain (who helmed his NAACP Award-winning performance in “Breath and Imagination: The Story of Roland Hayes”), Elijah’s vision simply must be experienced to be fully understood and deeply appreciated.

Ultimately, Elijah Rock hopes to cultivate a younger audience for himself and this music with his all around showmanship, singing and paddle-n-roll style of tap dance - lost arts all that have found, in Rock, a tireless cultural savior. “I approach singing from a traditional perspective with a fresh twist,” Rock concludes. “Gershwin For My Soul not only represents America’s classical music, it gives me a platform to address other things about the culture and where we all stand today.”
-A. Scott Galloway 

"ROCK IS THE CROONER AND SINGS DELICIOUSLY" - LOS ANGELES DAILY NEWS 

“RICHLY EXPRESSIVE VOICE AND MAGNETIC STAGE PRESENCE."  - BOSTON GLOBE

ALBUM CREDITS:

Executive Producer: Elijah Rock

Produced & Arranged by Kevin Toney for K-Tone Productions
Recorded at Nolan Shaheed Studios | Engineered by Nolan Shaheed | Mixed by Paul Tavenner at Big City Recording Studios Mastered by Gavin Lurssen for Lurssen Mastering, Los Angeles, CA | Photography by Patricia De La Rosa
Art Direction by Elijah Rock | Graphic Design by Christopher Kornmann for Spit + Image | Additional Assistance by (HKIC) Helen Chong 

Recent Performances on my MINI Promo Tour

In preparation for the album release, I was able to perform in Sydney, Australia and meet with the #1 talent booking agency in the world- William Morris Endeavor (WME). Needles to say, things are looking up for future peformance opportunities in Australia and the Pacific region. I then headed to Bangkok, Thailand where I showcased at the top jazz venue-The Living Room!

The Basement- Sydney, Australia     William Morris Agency- Sydney        

           

Living Room- Bangkok, Thailand           Siam Super Club- Phuket, Thailand   

   

 

        CELEBRITY ENDORSEMENTS

"It is clear to me that we need more young entertainers like you who are passionate to carry on our tradition. You know how to vocally craft a lyric so each phrase carries depth and meaning. I know Ira would have been impressed had he had the opportunity to experience you LIVE on the stage in Burbank!

- Michael S. Strunsky, (Trustee, The Ira and Leonore Gershwin Trusts)                  

"The Great American Songbook is alive and well with the SUPREMELY TALENTED Elijah Rock- a triple threat entertainer, breathing new life into our rich tradition." 

- Bennie Maupin (Jazz Musician/Composer)

"Elijah Rock is a fine singer!"

- Robert Guillaume (Actor, Singer)

"Every once in a while, an Artist like Elijah Rock emerges and reminds you what great singing and showmanship really looks like."  

-Antwone Fisher (Writer, Director, Personality)

"His is an epic voice that can splendidly carry on the legacies of Billy Eckstine, Frank Sinatra, Johnny Hartman, Harry Connick, Jr and other great Jazz crooners."  

- Irma P. Hall (Actress)

"An incredibly talented singer and performer, better than almost anyone doing Standards today! " 

- Shadoe Stevens (Radio Host/TV Personality)

"It's clear we've found our next Superstar Entertainer in Elijah Rock!"

 -Bill Cobbs (Actor) 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word to your friends and family about this campaign!

For more information about Elijah go to the Elijah Rock Website

Facebook | Instagram | Twitter |Soundcloud

They are the relaxed and romantic “Shall We Dance” (solely accompanied by the guitar of John Storie), the parlor song swoon of “Love Walked In” (featuring solo piano introduction and accompaniment by Toney), and the tour de force closer “Isn’t It a Pity,” a bluesy ballad wish of delicious diction and a heart-stopping dip into a cinematic so long.  
“Before this experience, I hadn’t really embraced the balladeer aspect of my gift,” Rock reflects. “It was about me being vulnerable enough to know I could do it. It’s been an interesting transformation…everything slowed down. There’s space for introspection and that moment to moment feeling of the lyric. I fell in love with the space between the notes and the simplicity of telling the story.”
Rock – whose resume boasts a decade and a half of acclaimed, across-the-board accomplishments in stage, film and television - found the perfect collaborator in Kevin Toney whose work as a keyboardist, composer, arranger, author, educator and co-founder of the `70s R&B-Jazz group The Blackbyrds provided the optimal springboard for Rock to bounce concepts off. “Kevin Toney is a virtuoso whose experience speaks for itself,” Rock says. “We brought our authentic creative selves to the material and, in that, it became uniquely ours.” Targeting performance arts centers and playhouses as well as traditional music venues, Elijah will bring a unique live presentation of this music with theatrical, staging, choreography and lighting elements that position the show as more than a stand-up vocal concert yet not quite a full-on musical. Directed by Saundra McClain (who helmed his NAACP Award-winning performance in “Breath and Imagination: The Story of Roland Hayes”), Elijah’s vision simply must be experienced to be fully understood and deeply appreciated.
Ultimately, Elijah Rock hopes to cultivate a younger audience for himself and this music with his all around showmanship, singing and paddle-n-roll style of tap dance - lost arts all that have found, in Rock, a tireless cultural savior. “I approach singing from a traditional perspective with a fresh twist,” Rock concludes. “Gershwin For My Soul not only represents America’s classical music, it gives me a platform to address other things about the culture and where we all stand today.”-A. Scott Galloway 
"ROCK IS THE CROONER AND SINGS DELICIOUSLY" - LOS ANGELES DAILY NEWS 
“RICHLY EXPRESSIVE VOICE AND MAGNETIC STAGE PRESENCE."  - BOSTON GLOBE
ALBUM CREDITS:
Executive Producer: Elijah Rock
Produced & Arranged by Kevin Toney for K-Tone ProductionsRecorded at Nolan Shaheed Studios | Engineered by Nolan Shaheed | Mixed by Paul Tavenner at Big City Recording Studios Mastered by Gavin Lurssen for Lurssen Mastering, Los Angeles, CA | Photography by Patricia De La RosaArt Direction by Elijah Rock | Graphic Design by Christopher Kornmann for Spit + Image | Additional Assistance by (HKIC) Helen Chong 
Recent Performances on my MINI Promo Tour
In preparation for the album release, I was able to perform in Sydney, Australia and meet with the #1 talent booking agency in the world- William Morris Endeavor (WME). Needles to say, things are looking up for future peformance opportunities in Australia and the Pacific region. I then headed to Bangkok, Thailand where I showcased at the top jazz venue-The Living Room!
The Basement- Sydney, Australia     William Morris Agency- Sydney        
           
Living Room- Bangkok, Thailand           Siam Super Club- Phuket, Thailand   
   
 
        CELEBRITY ENDORSEMENTS
"It is clear to me that we need more young entertainers like you who are passionate to carry on our tradition. You know how to vocally craft a lyric so each phrase carries depth and meaning. I know Ira would have been impressed had he had the opportunity to experience you LIVE on the stage in Burbank!
- Michael S. Strunsky, (Trustee, The Ira and Leonore Gershwin Trusts)                  
"The Great American Songbook is alive and well with the SUPREMELY TALENTED Elijah Rock- a triple threat entertainer, breathing new life into our rich tradition." 
- Bennie Maupin (Jazz Musician/Composer)
"Elijah Rock is a fine singer!"
- Robert Guillaume (Actor, Singer)
"Every once in a while, an Artist like Elijah Rock emerges and reminds you what great singing and showmanship really looks like."  
-Antwone Fisher (Writer, Director, Personality)
"His is an epic voice that can splendidly carry on the legacies of Billy Eckstine, Frank Sinatra, Johnny Hartman, Harry Connick, Jr and other great Jazz crooners."  
- Irma P. Hall (Actress)
"An incredibly talented singer and performer, better than almost anyone doing Standards today! " 
- Shadoe Stevens (Radio Host/TV Personality)
"It's clear we've found our next Superstar Entertainer in Elijah Rock!"
 -Bill Cobbs (Actor) 
Other Ways You Can Help


Please spread the word to your friends and family about this campaign!
For more information about Elijah go to the Elijah Rock Website
Facebook | Instagram | Twitter |Soundcloud

story:
Short Summary

  • Hello!  I am Cat Parks.  Singer songwriter from Cincinnati Ohio, currently located in Nashville TN; Yes Whoowhoo Music City baby!  I am chasing all of my dreams, loving and living life to the fullest, while seeking to inspire others to do the same. With your help, we can get this project marketed in the right way so that my music can have a chance in the industry.
  •   I have been writing songs ever since I was 12 years old and this EP has been in the making for a couple years! I am so proud of the product and I feel this will truly be the first project that identifies who I am as an artist
  • I am beyond grateful for every contribution:  nothing is too small!

What We Need & What You Get

Where will the funding go?

  • Music video- We all know that good music is important! However,  Music Videos are important to deliver the content in an appealing way and to engage an audience. I've created a campaign to help fund distribution, as well as the music video for my top single, "FOOL."
  • Global distribution- With your help, my music can be made available and easily accessed World Wide on I Tunes, Spotify, as well as several other distribution partners.
  • Compensating Musicians - If I don't reach my goal I still will be so grateful because I can use whatever funds I receive  to compensate my band fairly who will be recording my album with me day in and day out!  I could not do what I do without them!  S/o Kindred Soul Crew:) ha-ha:)

The Impact

  • This campaign is so important to me because it is my mission to utilize my gifts to make a difference in the lives of others: spreading love, peace, and light.  My music is the outlet in which I get the opportunity to do so. 
  • My EP is valuable to the contributor because once my goal is reached, I will have the opportunity to utilize my music as the vehicle to pursue my philanthropic endeavors and to express myself in the most organic way I know how.

Other Ways You Can Help!

Some people can't contribute, and I totally understand that!  I would appreciate it if you share my campaign with others to get the word out!  Get everyone excited about its release!  This release is happening sooner than later!

story:
The Dark Rift LP (Guerrilla Alliance III)

 

VX: Heaven's Assassin & Mac the Rebel have been releasing underground hip-hop music for over a decade. "Guerrilla Warfare" and "Empire of Fear" LP's were both funded completely out of pocket by the artists.

The Dark Rift is the pinnacle of Planet X Releases featuring some of our favorite artists of all time.

The magnitude of help from contributors is nearly impossible to express, with crowd funding we can achieve the high quality standard of music and videos the fans deserve.

Funding & Perks

The amount we're asking is honestly a middle of the road figure, and less than half of what we've already spent on album production.

Studio fees from: www.aztecsound.com

  • Expert studio engineer Robert Pride has been our sound engineer since before "Guerrilla Warfare" LP here at PXR! With over 20 years in the business he is one of the best.
  • Since we pay $240 per track on average, even for the four singles we'e released so far that's already $960 not including feature verses!
  • Pressing & exclsive Artwork from Orgn will cost $300 + as well as digi release fees

We have some awesome perks!

Both digital & Hardcopies of PXR records as well as sticker/ posters & free swag!

Merchandise perks include: Brand new PXR Bandanas, G.A. T-Shirts, Beanies & more!

Production by Mac the Rebel's "Militiaman Productions", Mac can also be contacted for more beat packages at MacBlaze@Gmail.com

If we do not reach our entire goal, funds can still go to album production / release. Music video production, merchandise, promotion or touring budget.

We greatly appreciate our fans, and have gone over and above in the past to provide exclusive merchandise and order packages.

This campaign goes beyond The Dark Rift to supporting PXR as a whole. We have many more releases from new artists coming soon!

  • If you were a fan of our first two albums, then you already know what we are capable of. If you're a new fan donate now and get digital or hard copies of the original releases with you're order!
  • Take a look at the original "Empire of Fear" campaign, will hardly any crowd funding the album was still released in full with amazing quality!
  • Contact VX or Mac the Rebel with any questions you may have about this crowd funding or PXR in general.

Unlike past PXR projects the Dark Rift is nearly complete!

With several singles out already, it is clear we are not starting this album from scratch. That being said, any funding received can help us gain back from distribution fees from the album.

  • PXR is a brand you can trust with over 7 studio mastered albums released already
  • With Studio engineers like Robert Pride & Mac the Rebel we use studio time very efficiently!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute with monetary value, please help us share this campaign on social media!

  • If you have friend's in to underground hip-hop spread the word!
  • Use the share tools here, or spread the link online!

Great thanks from PXR!

story:
Short Summary

Hello music lovers! Welcome to my Indiegogo page!

My name is Emma Cava and I’ve been a professional musician since I immigrated to Toronto from the USA in 2010.  I'm raising funds so I can record and release what will be my debut recording: a collection of tunes inspired by living in Toronto as a 20-something woman, entitled Young Lady.

This 6-track EP will feature three of my original compositions, two modern jazz instrumentals with my own vocalese, and a swinging arrangement of a surprise pop cover.

I’ve known my purpose in life is to make music since I picked up the flute at 8 years old. The flute became a clarinet, then a a guitar. My parents were music lovers who always played Ella Fitzgerald and Blossom Dearie on the stereo. Eventually I started singing along. Within a few years I was taking singing lessons: first studying musical theatre, then opera, then classical art song. I found a home in church choirs and regional and state choir competitions.

I didn’t pursue jazz singing seriously until my mid-teens. My voice teachers turned me onto bebop vocalists like Sarah Vaughan, Sheila Jordan, Betty Carter, who inspire my singing and scatting to this day. During my undergrad at York University, I studied jazz voice in depth and explored my love of arranging and composing in and outside of the classroom.

Out of all the genres I work in as a musician, jazz remains my deepest love. I love how supported I feel when a great band is playing behind me. Scatting is my meditation. It's the one activity that centers me in the moment. I feel so focused, and so FREE! I feel that same freedom when I compose and write lyrics. Composing is the most honest way I know how to express myself. Jazz is a challenging language to learn, but a thrill to speak. Vocalese writers like Jon Hendricks, Mimi Perrin and Kurt Elling made jazz’s difficult vocabulary accessible for me as a young singer. When I write my own vocalese lyrics, I aim to do the same for the average listener. Sharing my music with the world allows me to be vulnerable and connect with others—all the while paying tribute to great artists in the jazz tradition.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's a breakdown of all the expenses needed to make this EP happen:

  • Recording $1800

  • Mixing $1800

  • Personnel $1000

  • Mastering $600

  • CD Manufacturing $700

  • Mechanical Rights $500

  • Equipment Rental $300

  • Promotions $300

Total funding needed: $7000

Recording will happen in early 2020. A CD release party will happen in the summer of 2020.

I am so grateful for any support you can give me. So grateful, that I'm calling my list of perks my Gratitude List. (Indiegogo won't let me change "list of perks" to "Gratitude List" (boo) but I'll roll with it until the phrase sticks!

In addition to the warm fuzzy feelings you'll get knowing you supported a young artist, here are some of the perks you get when you donate generously to this campaign!

  • Autographed CDs

  • Digital downloads--listen to the album before anyone else!

  • Guest star in one of Emma’s performances

  • Custom jazz arrangements

  • Choral writing collaborations

  • Private concerts in your home!

The Impact

Having a professional recording gives me credibility as an artist when applying to festivals, competitions, new and prestigious venues, residencies... the list goes on. I’ve been busking and playing at local venues for several years, and I'm ready to take my career to the next level. Your donation KICKSTARTS my career!

Risks & Challenges

It can feel risky to support a new artist. My take on it? This is your chance to support new, exciting, challenging Canadian music that otherwise won’t reach listening ears.

There is the risk I won’t reach my goal on Indiegogo. In addition to this campaign, I’m applying for TAC and federal arts grants. I'm not in the financial position to fund this project myself. Without external funding, this recording WON’T happen. So let’s reach, Toronto! Together this community can make Young Lady happen!

Other Ways You Can Help

Follow on Facebook at facebook.com/EmmaCavaMusic and visit my website, emmacava.com

Tell your friends! Tell your parents! Tell your boss! Tell your rich neighbours! Tell your bus driver!

and... share this page on social media!

story:
Short Summary

Firstly, thanks for checking out my campaign! I'm a musician and songwriter from Perth, Scotland and at the start of 2019, I started to focus on my own music, after years of being a part of other's projects. I LOVE music that's rooted in Rhythm and Soul which is exactly what this EP will be filled with!

Back in April, I self-funded and recorded my first single, 'The Good Times', which you can listen to here: https://youtu.be/DJ3Wt099v3k - Since then, I've been working on 5 songs that will make up the new EP. The songs are grounded in Rhythm & Blues but I explore the different sides of Soul and Jazz too. I've recorded the majority of the tracks myself, here in my home studio with the help of some of the most talented musicians in Scotland.

I'm all about positive relationships built on good energy, which I believe crowdfunding is a fantastic enabler of! Music is a healing medium and the idea that one of my songs could turn someone's day around fills me with such joy, which is why I wanted to embark on making this EP. And that's where you come in.

What I Need & What You Get

In short, to finish the EP, produce merchandise and fund a tour, I need £2,000.

For this campaign, I've decided to treat each of the following bullet points as a goal. If I reach the first, I can focus on the next one. If for instance, I only raise enough to mix and master the EP, I'll still be able to release something to the world. This way, it's not as much of a pressure to raise the full £2,000, though doing so will enable me to do a lot more!

Below, I've broken down my costs and where the funds will go:

• £800 - Mixing/Mastering Fees

Whilst I'm recording everything in my home studio, I need someone with the expertise to properly mix and master these songs.

• £600 - CD Production/Merchandise

Although CD players are quickly becoming a thing of the past, CD's are still a great thing to have at a show or when you meet people. I'll be doing a limited run of physical CD's along with some T-Shirts.

• £400 - Musicians Fees

I'm so lucky to know some of the most talented musicians in Scotland, and I think it's important that they're paid for their time.

• £200 - Tour Costs

As I'm planning to gig further away from home than I've been before, this will help with travel costs as well as room hire fees at certain venues.

_____________________________________

Total: Roughly £2,000

I'm mainly treating this campaign as a pre-order for the EP however there are some cool perks including a bundle of my previous releases and more tailored one's such as a unique acoustic recording.

The Impact

When I crowdfunded my first EP in 2016, I was really unsure if it was the right thing to do, however in the process of doing so, I made so many new meaningful connections with people through my music and the campaign! It was such an amazing feeling when I reached my target and being able to fulfil my goal to all the backers made all the stress worth while!

The impact this campaign will have will help me to really concentrate on my future as an artist and songwriter, with a focus on playing music with honesty, integrity and passion.

Risks & Challenges

Honesty and transparency are key. By staggering the £2,000 into the amounts mentioned above, I'm taking out the risk of an 'all or nothing' scenario. If I don't raise the full amount, I can still accomplish SOME of my goals.

By recording everything in my home studio, I'm removing the challenge of recording everything to a strict timescale such as those found in expensive recording studios. This gives me time to hone the sound and make it something that I'd be proud to let you all hear!

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can contribute financially, but you can still help.

Let as many people know about this campaign as possible. I love spreading joy and good times at my gigs and the same goes for online!

Even a £1 contribution gets me closer to my goal and believe me, it'll put the biggest grin on my face if you do!

And that's all there is to it! Thanks for your time and have an exceptionally wonderful day :)

Chris x

Not everyone can contribute financially, but you can still help.
Let as many people know about this campaign as possible. I love spreading joy and good times at my gigs and the same goes for online!
Even a £1 contribution gets me closer to my goal and believe me, it'll put the biggest grin on my face if you do!
And that's all there is to it! Thanks for your time and have an exceptionally wonderful day :)
Chris x

story:
Overview

The journey of making this record has been a slow, difficult, sometimes utterly ridiculous, but also incredibly inspiring, and beautiful.

When writing this music I was going through many new changes in my life. I had just moved to New York and began to undergo a shift in my perspective and goals. The experience of moving to New York and beginning a full-time career as a working musician has been incredibly brutal, and has thrown me in a tail-spin of doubt, insecurity, and constant self-assessment. But in that struggle I have discovered many beautiful things about myself, about what matters to me, about the people that matter to me, and becoming at peace with the process. This album is a reflection of that journey.

The writing for this record began in late 2015 and was finally recorded in September 2018. The album is centered around two different themes: Struggle with identity, and the struggle with morality, and living within that tension. Many of these compositions are inspired by the idea of super heroes. However noble or grandiose there alter egos are, a hero will at some point have to take off the mask and just live their live. They must embrace their flaws and compromise their relationships for a greater purpose. I am fascinated by what the day to day struggle is for someone with extraordinary abilities, but the same fragile moral compass as any of us. I think of how that is reflected my own life, and how I struggle with uncertainty, change, and what doing the right thing is. To me this album is a reflection of that struggle. To fight through uncertainty, to challenge your truths, and to believe in something incorruptible.

We are in the final stretch of this process, and my goal is to have this album out and in your hands by January or February of 2020. Every aspect of this record has been challenging, but incredibly fulfilling and impactful on my life. Funding it this much has caused major life changes has altered the way I perceive music and art. 

I have become SOOOOOOOOOO grateful to all of my friends and fans. I have never been more inspired to put out music, and to go all in on my music. This record is a thank you to everyone who has supported me thus far, and I know it will live up to it. 

As of now the record is almost done being mixed, I need $7000 to finish the next process:

  • Mixing and Mastering
  • CD pressing and digital distribution
  • Music Videos
  • Merch
  • Marketing

In todays world artists generally are working many different jobs within and outside of their career to make anything happen. At some point during the process of making this record I was working 4 different jobs and sometimes 15-20 hour days. Though I'm exhausted, I am even more HYPED to get this album out! In order for me to get this album into your hands by 2020 your contribution is ESSENTIAL.

 

What you get in Return

For backing "A Thoughtful Collapse," you will have access to exclusive content including: Signed CDs, Limited edition T-shirts, access to my life performance archive, Sheet music, Tutorial videos, stickers, Skype (or if you're in New York one on one!) Lessons, and some more fun stuff. This music is FOR YOU! If there is anything I've learned in these last 3 years, is that your support matters and has pushed me to go above and beyond to make music. Thank you!

What your contributions are really doing

Every cent you give me is helping me speed up the process in getting this music and other exclusive content out to you. This has been a tough decision to crowdfund because I wanted to be someone who could do it all. Work a million jobs, teach a million students, play a million gigs, and work on my own music! Now I know I need help. Your contribution goes directly to the making of this record. 

Mixing and Mastering (Making the sounds awesome): $2000
CD Pressing (Making the sounds physically awesome): $500
Music Video Content (face it.. We're in the age of video content... and to be honest I love it! Always been a dream of mine to make some awesome music videos, to create compelling visuals that match the musical journey.) $2000
Merch (creating all the lovely content for you guys!): $500
Marketing (as an independent artist I am in charge of my own marketing and there will be some trial and errors along this journey.. so a budget is required.): $2000

Every cent of what I'm asking is going to be used for this record, and if we're lucky enough to go past the $7000 mark, that is only going to be funneled further into the project.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are also an artist in the grind trying to make it one day at a time.. I totally get that and I understand, and if you ever need moral support or someone to grab a beer with shoot me a message. I also understand if you can't spare a dime right now.. Other ways you can support me is just by sharing this Indiegogo, or any content having to do with me in general. I appreciate you just taking the time to read this and notice!

story:
What is this album?

This is a contemporary classical music album with a myriad of voices and instruments. The music was composed by Emily Lau, brought to life through devising and deep listening by The Broken Consort, set to the poetry of Emily Dickinson, Xu Zhimo, Emily Lau, and St. Francis of Assisi. It is a soundscape about love, grief, passion, beliefs, and joy. This album is co-produced by all of the artists performing on the project and has everyone's fingerprints all over it. 

Who are we?

Emily Lau (composer, singer, director), Peter Lim (recorders, oboes, keyboard), Julie Bosworth (singer), Jessica Korotkin (cello), Justin Persichetti (percussion), Joel Nesvadba (voice), Nick Hogle (voice), Sacha Muller (engineer)

************

The Broken Consort is an American-based chamber music ensemble presenting thought-provoking and innovative programs since 2010. Our musical and project ideas cover over 1000 years of music and stories, and the ensemble is made up of subject matter experts who care passionately about revitalizing and creating new repertory and artistic experiences.

Emily Lau is an award-winning composer, singer, and performance artist who founded The Broken Consort in graduate school with some of her friends. Since then, the ensemble has performed in leading music festivals, universities, concert series, and developed organically into its current formation. Members of The Broken Consort hail from diverse backgrounds and interests, live all across North America, and are joined together by their consummate artistry and demonstrated commitment to collaboration and innovation. 

Our Method of Collaboration

TBC works exclusively in intensive residential setting, where project artists live, eat, breathe, dream, and work under the same roof, excluding outside distractions for 7-10 days. We did our project at Emily's home in Portland, OR and recorded the album at Dead Aunt Thelma's Studio with recording engineer Sacha Muller in June 2019. We laugh and cry daily from joy and frustration, and made a disc we are all in love with. 

Where We Are

The album is recorded, mixed, mastered, and designed. We would like to give our closest circle a chance to experience a more personal product, and share our first 300 albums via this campaign only. The proceeds will greatly help us recoup our sizable production cost ($15,000 so far, because we value paying our musicians and engineers), and make our public release more impactful. We made this music based on trust, love, and relationships; it would only make sense to share this music through trust, love, and relationship. 

The Impact

We do not have a lot of fancy promotional ideas, other than the beautiful music that we have made with our heart, and our attention to every artistic detail. Your support makes it clear to us that our back-breaking work brings joy to others, and that we should keep bringing new music and poetry, and our unique methods of working to the world.

story:
THE GOAL

To finish a full album of original music. We want to share our music with you. Let's start in where we left off 20 years ago.

In a nutshell:

All basic tracks are already completed (plus or minus 20 years ago!) drums, bass, acoustic & electric guitars. The goal is to capture where we were...but to also build these songs to a fresh completion. We are NOT starting over. We are trying for very minimal re-tracking and doing so without the luxury of preproduction.

This funding will be utilized for recording vocals (excited to say some industry professionals to be featured), some overdubs with keys & percussion, mixing, mastering and for manufacturing a small run of Cd’s and distribution to online music sites.

THE STORY

A little history on the project… Rewind to the last months of 1999 when we were all wondering if the world would really end on January 1st. Ok, maybe computer grids would crash at best.  My "old band" (well we were young then) Idle Society, started in on a follow up to our 1997 release “Farewell Sybil”. Tom, Dan, Aaron and myself loaded our gear and headed to Rohnert Park’s the Foundry recording studio. With the help of Joel Cortrite and Chris Rake behind the console we tracked 13 songs. A few of which were still being written as we recorded. Our chops a bit sharper at this point, Aaron laid down some killer drum takes. With the energy of Stewart Copeland, intricacies of Neil Peart and feel of Carter Beauford, the hardwood floors and vaulted ceilings in The Foundry captured an amazing drum sound. That room just had the mojo. I recorded with my trusty American Fender Jazz bass for the round but punchy low end. I gave another run at fretless bass on one of the tunes. One of my proudest performances. I reserved my (later to be stolen and now sadly missed) Ibanez Precision bass for two of the more syncopated tracks on which I used a pick. That’s usually not my method but it served the song (or maybe I just couldn’t play that fast with my fingers back then; I’ll go with the former). Dan, if I recall correctly, moved away from his Stratocaster in favor of the Satch Ibanez. He busted out the 12 string for a feature as well. I had recently picked up a PRS on which Dan played on one of the more driving songs. In fact, he even played my Dad’s banjo on the same track. Sonic ear candy! Tom Laid down some of the acoustic tracks using the alternate tuning DADGAD. They still sound fresh today. The engineers did a superb job of double tracking and capturing a pleasant acoustic sound. Tom was prepped to start in on vocals and then boom. The band was no more.

So, before the album was able to be finished guess what? Yea the band broke up. We tried to hold it together looking for a replacement for Tom but nothing seemed to pan out. Eventually we all found other paths and the next chapter of our musical journeys. Dan and Aaron and I eventually played together again backing up Brain Cline…and then that changed as well.

Fast forward 10 years. I got the itch to work on this recording and eventually went to Faultline studio in SF to transfer all the Adat media to a digital hard drive Protools session. Wow, now we are in the modern era. Hearing those tracks did make me nostalgic. What was there sounded pretty good. No one else in the band seemed to want to breathe life back into the project. Should I just let this thing die already!?

NO! Fast forward another decade. Here we are and I still have this strong drive to get this material out. I just can’t let it go! Why? We had fun writing it and I’m proud of what we all did collectively. More importantly music is meant to be heard and songs meant to be sung. You can help us achieve it. So, let’s do this!!!

-Jason

THE MUSIC

So, what will this sound like you ask? Well if you are into any popular rock that was put out over the last 50 years, sonically there will be a little something for everyone. Our musical peers might be the likes of  Vertical Horizon, Snow Patrol, Live, Dishwalla & Pearl Jam.

Dan is a creative guitarist. Rather than playing to serve the song (which he often does) it’s more frequent the song develops from his guitar lines. Aaron is what you call raw talent, somewhat unbridled in these recordings. As for me I tried to be the glue between the rhythm and melody without getting bored. Exactly the role bass is supposed to play. We have diverse backgrounds musically but had common influences that will shine throughout.

Not straying too far from the radio rock vein, you might hear some flavors of The Police & U2, splashes of Rush & Dave Matthews Band, pop sense of The Goo Goo Dolls and the grit of Stone Temple Pilots. Equal parts 90’s rock and 80’s gloss. Organic acoustic sounds as well as aggressive riff-based grooves. 3 cups straight up ROCK, 1 cup singer-songwriter, a spoonful of jazz, and a pinch of shred.

BUDGET

As a completely independent project with no funds coming in from gigs, it’s completely funded by me. The only way these songs will continue to develop towards completion is working with vocalists & some studio time. What can be done at home or remotely will be done at the best of our ability. As we all know vocals are the key ingredient and should be done without compromise.

The goal is $6,500 to finish the recordings (with featured industry vocalists). If the goal is exceeded that means more can be spent on hiring a pro mixing engineer to mix the “best few songs”.

Risks & Challenges

If I don't reach the entire goal, it will take longer to put out the album. It’s just not in the family budget and I will have to slowly save up funds. I am dedicated to finishing this project whether we get help or not. I promise if the goal is not met there will still be music released.  It may only be a few songs  and only digital download. At least for the time being.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Let your friends know about this campaign!

  • Make sure to share this post!

  • and most of all THANK YOU.

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Let your friends know about this campaign!
Make sure to share this post!
and most of all THANK YOU.

story:
Der Rhythmus mag jeweils unterschiedlich sein, aber die Botschaft ist immer die gleiche.

Und die kann das Leben verändern wie diese fantastischen Musiker gezeigt haben. Das brasilianische Straßenorchester "Orquestra de Rua" aus Rio de Janeiro und das "Ensemble Unterwegs" aus Essen stammen aus zwei komplett unterschiedlichen Kulturkreisen, aber verfolgen das gleiche gemeinsame Ziel: Ihre Kunst zu teilen und sie Allen zugänglich zu machen. Das Ensemble Unterwegs möchte einen kulturellen und musikalischen Austausch anstoßen und das Orquestra de Rua im Frühjahr 2020 für 2 Wochen nach Deutschland einladen. Wir zählen auf euch, dieses wundervolle musikalische Event möglich zu machen.

Das Orquestra de Rua ist vor zwei Jahren in den Favelas, also den brasilianischen Armenvierteln, von Rio entstanden. Dabei starteten die vier jungen Musiker ihr eigenes soziales Projekt, was den dort lebenden Kindern wieder Hoffnung geben soll, die eigenen Träume zu verwirklichen und zwar mithilfe der Musik. So geben sie seitdem den Kindern die Möglichkeit, das Spielen klassischer Instrumente und klassischer Musik zu erlernen.

Sie verbreiten ihre Musik, indem sie beispielsweise auf der Straße, in Straßenbahnen und Schulen spielen. Immer verbunden mit dem Ziel, Musik für jedermann zugänglich zu machen und zeitgemäße Rhythmen/Musik mit klassischen Instrumenten zu kombinieren.

Das Ensemble Unterwegs besteht aus einer Gruppe von Profi-Musikerinnen, die sich vor acht Jahren in Essen gegründet hat. Für einige Wochen im Jahr gehen sie auf "Walking Tour" in Europa und geben spontane Outdoor-Konzerte in Städten und Dörfern. Dabei sind sie auf die Gastfreundschaft der Ortsansässigen angewiesen. Als Zeichen der Dankbarkeit für die wundervollen Musikdarbietungen öffnen die Einheimischen ihre Türen für die Musikerinnen, um Ihnen Unterkunft und Verpflegung anzubieten.

Die Chance, nach Europa zu kommen, würde für die jungen Musiker des Orquestra de Rua einige wichtige Möglichkeiten eröffnen:

- Musikprojekte in beiden Ländern zu fördern, die Kindern aus benachteiligten Stadtteilen helfen 

- Europa als Geburtsstätte klassischer Musik kennenzulernen und direkten Zugang zur Klassik zu bekommen

- einen intensiven interkulturellen Austausch mit Ensemble Unterwegs und gemeinsames Musizieren mit ihnen

- an Proben mit diversen Gruppen der Kammermusik teilzunehmen

- rennomierte Institutionen und Musikhochschulen in NRW zu besuchen

- ihren eigenen Musikstil und ihre eigene Musikarbeit deutschen Musikstudenten zu präsentieren


Und es gibt natürlich noch viele Gründe mehr, weshalb wir euch bitten, diesen Traum und dieses wundervolle soziale Projekt wahr werden zu lassen!

Unser Ziel ist es, 5.000€ an Spenden vor dem 01.Februar 2020 zu sammeln. So könnten wir beide Gruppen für einen unglaublich schönen Austausch von Musik, Rhythmus und Sound in NRW zusammenbringen und ein wichtiges soziales Projekt unterstützen.


PS: Sollten eure Spenden 1.000€ überschreiten werden wir eine schöne Überraschung für euch haben als ein großes Dankeschön.

_______________________________________________

Links

Orquestra de Rua: https://www.facebook.com/orquestraderua/

https://www.instagram.com/orquestra_de_rua/

 

Ensemble Unterwegs: http://ensemble-unterwegs.de/

https://www.facebook.com/pages/category/Musician-Band/Ensemble-Unterwegs-542568119264687/

 

Interview with Orquestra de Rua by Gisele Rütter: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XndyKrMFyPw&t=8s

 

Vídeo by Gisele Rütter & Roberta de Lacerda Medina

_______

The rhythms might be different, but the message is still universal.  

And it can change your life, as these musicians have proven! The Orquestra de Rua (Street Orchestra - from Rio de Janeiro, Brazil) and the Ensemble Unterwegs (Ensemble On the Road - from Essen, Germany) come from two completely different continents and cultures, but they have the same goal: to share their art and make it accessible to everyone. They want to start a cultural and musical exchange for two weeks in the spring of 2020 by inviting the Orquestra de Rua to Germany. And we are counting on you to make this beautiful meeting happen!

The Orquestra de Rua was born two years ago in the favelas of Rio de Janeiro. These four young musicians started their own social projects that give children the opportunity to learn to play classical instruments and classical music - and help give them hope for achieving their dreams. Since then, they have spread their art by playing in the streets, subways and schools with the objective of combining contemporary rhythms and classical instruments – and of making music more accessible to everyone.

The Ensemble Unterwegs is a group of professional women musicians, founded eight years ago in Essen, Germany. For a few weeks every year they take their music on walking tours around Europe and present spontaneous concerts outdoors in towns and villages. They rely on the hospitality of the people they meet along the way, who open the doors of their homes and offer food and shelter to the artists as a way of thanking them for the gift of music.

The chance to come to Germany would give the young musicians in the Orquestra de Rua several outstanding opportunities:
*   to get to know firsthand one of the cradles of European classical music
*    to have an intensive exchange and to perform with the musicians in Ensemble Unterwegs
*   to take part in rehearsals with several other chamber music groups
*   to visit renowned musical institutions and universities in NRW
*   to present their own work to German music students
*   to compare music projects in both countries which are designed help children from disadvantaged neighborhoods.

These are some of the many reasons why we're asking for your help to make this dream come true!

 

Our goal is to get €5.000,00 before 01.02.2020 so that we can bring both groups face to face for an incredible exchange of sounds and rhythms around North Rhine-Westphalia - Germany

PS: If your donation is greater than €1.000,00 we will have a fantastic surprise for you as a way to thank you!
story_txt:
Der Rhythmus mag jeweils unterschiedlich sein, aber die Botschaft ist immer die gleiche.Und die kann das Leben verändern wie diese fantastischen Musiker gezeigt haben. Das brasilianische Straßenorchester "Orquestra de Rua" aus Rio de Janeiro und das "Ensemble Unterwegs" aus Essen stammen aus zwei komplett unterschiedlichen Kulturkreisen, aber verfolgen das gleiche gemeinsame Ziel: Ihre Kunst zu teilen und sie Allen zugänglich zu machen. Das Ensemble Unterwegs möchte einen kulturellen und musikalischen Austausch anstoßen und das Orquestra de Rua im Frühjahr 2020 für 2 Wochen nach Deutschland einladen. Wir zählen auf euch, dieses wundervolle musikalische Event möglich zu machen.
Das Orquestra de Rua ist vor zwei Jahren in den Favelas, also den brasilianischen Armenvierteln, von Rio entstanden. Dabei starteten die vier jungen Musiker ihr eigenes soziales Projekt, was den dort lebenden Kindern wieder Hoffnung geben soll, die eigenen Träume zu verwirklichen und zwar mithilfe der Musik. So geben sie seitdem den Kindern die Möglichkeit, das Spielen klassischer Instrumente und klassischer Musik zu erlernen.
Sie verbreiten ihre Musik, indem sie beispielsweise auf der Straße, in Straßenbahnen und Schulen spielen. Immer verbunden mit dem Ziel, Musik für jedermann zugänglich zu machen und zeitgemäße Rhythmen/Musik mit klassischen Instrumenten zu kombinieren.
Das Ensemble Unterwegs besteht aus einer Gruppe von Profi-Musikerinnen, die sich vor acht Jahren in Essen gegründet hat. Für einige Wochen im Jahr gehen sie auf "Walking Tour" in Europa und geben spontane Outdoor-Konzerte in Städten und Dörfern. Dabei sind sie auf die Gastfreundschaft der Ortsansässigen angewiesen. Als Zeichen der Dankbarkeit für die wundervollen Musikdarbietungen öffnen die Einheimischen ihre Türen für die Musikerinnen, um Ihnen Unterkunft und Verpflegung anzubieten.
Die Chance, nach Europa zu kommen, würde für die jungen Musiker des Orquestra de Rua einige wichtige Möglichkeiten eröffnen:
- Musikprojekte in beiden Ländern zu fördern, die Kindern aus benachteiligten Stadtteilen helfen 
- Europa als Geburtsstätte klassischer Musik kennenzulernen und direkten Zugang zur Klassik zu bekommen
- einen intensiven interkulturellen Austausch mit Ensemble Unterwegs und gemeinsames Musizieren mit ihnen
- an Proben mit diversen Gruppen der Kammermusik teilzunehmen
- rennomierte Institutionen und Musikhochschulen in NRW zu besuchen
- ihren eigenen Musikstil und ihre eigene Musikarbeit deutschen Musikstudenten zu präsentieren
Und es gibt natürlich noch viele Gründe mehr, weshalb wir euch bitten, diesen Traum und dieses wundervolle soziale Projekt wahr werden zu lassen!
Unser Ziel ist es, 5.000€ an Spenden vor dem 01.Februar 2020 zu sammeln. So könnten wir beide Gruppen für einen unglaublich schönen Austausch von Musik, Rhythmus und Sound in NRW zusammenbringen und ein wichtiges soziales Projekt unterstützen.
PS: Sollten eure Spenden 1.000€ überschreiten werden wir eine schöne Überraschung für euch haben als ein großes Dankeschön.
_______________________________________________
Links
Orquestra de Rua: https://www.facebook.com/orquestraderua/
https://www.instagram.com/orquestra_de_rua/
 
Ensemble Unterwegs: http://ensemble-unterwegs.de/
https://www.facebook.com/pages/category/Musician-Band/Ensemble-Unterwegs-542568119264687/
 
Interview with Orquestra de Rua by Gisele Rütter: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XndyKrMFyPw&t=8s
 
Vídeo by Gisele Rütter & Roberta de Lacerda Medina
_______
