story:
Whoo hoo.... let's go... 

I'm Cecilia Stalin and I'm a full-time artist, songwriter, educator and curator of a discussion event for creatives called The Fika Session. 

Over the past 13 years I have started a record label, written 3 albums, 3 ep's, a few singles and recorded for many artist like KOOP, Jazzanova and toured around the world as a backing singer for Cinematic Orchestra, The Streets, Alicia Dixon to teaching vocal master classes in Australia & China to working with some amazing institutions in London like Southbank Center, The Barbican and London Jazz Festival and of course Ronnie Scott's. What people don't seem to know about me is that I've done all this on my own, investing my own money write, rehearse, record & press my music - and it's been an amazing journey so far. 

This campaign is my first ever attempt to reach out to my family, friends and fans to ask for your help to take my vision to the next level. I've recorded a new album and I would love to be able to make a couple of music videos to deepen the connection with a visual to the music. I've never branched into visual with my songs so it would be an amazing creative challenge for me. 

Your help will not only make it possible financially for me to make the videos but also emotionally to feel your lovely support and moving my creative sphere upwards! 

Listen to the album here: https://ceciliastalin.bandcamp.com/album/i-am

 

Funding:

Soooo, I've got a surprise - I will be filming the videos in Brazil!!! This means that I can work with a smaller budget than in London so I will only be crowdfunding for £2500. I have over the last 2 years been going to Salvador da Bahia and I will be going back for a friends wedding and will take the opportunity to work with some local film makers. 

The money will be spent on renting different types of cameras, drones, hire film crew, make up artists, hair stylists, and a director with an understanding of my music and a beautiful vision. I will definitely be able to film 2 music videos and will make sure that we have someone on staff to keep my Indigogo page updated whilst we shoot. 

As I mentioned before, I invest my money back into my career and I've already made a decision to make a music video, so your money will definitely be very significant towards what I can do but not an end all. You'll just be able to see the full extent of my vision rather than a budget version ; ) 

NOW...... what about those perks...... I've really done some research on this but also taken into account what I would LOVE to (and have) to get myself - so there will be everything from the basic Signed Cd + download to vinyl collection bundle to having your name on the album to private gigs at your house to having a tea with me! Go and check them out!!! 

 

Behind the album...

I.Am is my 3rd full length album and it's my most honest one. Honesty and vulnerability is something looked as 'weakness' in many situations but I've grown to learn that for me – it's a strenght and a power. So in order to be as honest as I could I decided to return to the 'live' sound, strip back the band, write from my heart and tell my stories. 

I had noticed that I was focusing on what I didn't have, instead of all the great things I had done. When I looked at why, I quickly realised that I was comparing myself to the world around me and started to question why I wasn't 'doing as well'. Realising how much that disturbed my peace and work flow made me stop and really look at what I was doing to myself. 

I.Am is a result of that inner look and being true to yourself, and I've learnt that making music is a snapshot of where you are in that moment. It's a journey, it's full of different stories and we should really celebrate it as we travel along it. 


The album will take you through a groovy and uplifting journey from Released, a song about her relationship with herself to  a cheeky Didn't you know about how women secretly emotionally run relationships to Brave, a song about facing your failures and getting back up to try again to Blunt-ly, a song about not holding back but saying what you think. 

I have been working with a group of incredible musicians where the base is a trio featuring 
pianist Alex Bennett, a groove based musician who brings beautiful voicings and a lovely sensitivity, Tom Mason on electric bass who creates the solid foundation but has the most incredible harmonic understanding and wonderful timing and finally Laurie Lowe on drums who is the technical virtuoso but with soulfulness and incredible phrasing.

All songs are written by Cecilia Stalin but songs 6 & 7 are co-written with London based pianist Joe Armon-Jones and songs 2, 4 & 9 is co-written with Bennett/Lowe/Mason.  

 

Finally..... 

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out my story and I hope you can find something that suits you and to join me on my journey.  But if you cannot support me financially, then please support me by spreading the news, tell people, forward the Indigogo link to friends/family/music lovers through email, social media, text, wasssap... hearsay? :) 

 

Lots of love

Cecilia

story:
In December of 2016 I performed a solo recital for in honor of my mother and my aunt Yvonne, lovingly referred to as 'Auntie Mom' as it had been 10 years since they had seen me in recital.  In the summer of 2017, I began planning a Christmas recital as a tribute to my mom.  For the previous 3 Chrismases my mother and my aunt spent the holidays with me.  The plan was to share this recital with them, and others, over the 2017 Christmas holidays.  Well, my mom passed on Halloween of 2017.

With the encouragement of my vocal coach and pianist extraordinaire, I sang the recital with my aunts in attendance.  My aunt from Texas flew in to share this first Christmas sans Ma with us.  And so the seed was planted to create this CD in remembrance of Hortense; she LOVED the Christmas holidays.  Many of the songs recorded were some of her favorites.

This has been truly a labor of love in celebration of Hortense.  Love ya much Ma and miss you each and every day, hour, minute and second!

story:
OVERVIEW

I’m Knox Summerour, a musician here in Hollywood.  I've appeared on The Voice, American Idol, James Corden, & others.  For the past few years I’ve been performing Fred Rogers' songs Live, but now it’s time to record them!  They’re full of wonderful, life-affirming messages for all, and we believe they should be heard.

We’ve chosen the best 10 songs for a full-length album which will be recorded here in L.A. with 100% live musicians.  We’ve got some great L.A. Studio Musicians lined up to help us, including pianist Christian Jacob, Edwin Livingston on “bass violin,” & Bryan Taylor on drums.  (Plus, one very special 7-year-old guest!)

 

WHERE YOUR MONEY WILL GO

Meeting the goal will allow us to:

  • Extend a bonus to our musicians!
  • Produce a music video
  • Pay for Song Licensing
  • Distribute the album to Spotify, AppleMusic, iTunes, TikTok, & more
  • Design & Press CD's

 

PERKS INCLUDE:

  • Exclusive Access to LIveStream all Recording & Mixing Sessions
  • Admission for 2 to the invitation-only Album Release Show in L.A. (Limit 25)
  • Free Digital & Hard-copies of the Album
  • The opportunity for a Live Show in your home!

 

EVEN IF YOU CAN'T CONTRIBUTE:

You can still help by sharing this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Email, or by direct link.  Thanks for your help!

* The goal amount will be used only for this project!  If the goal is surpassed, the surplus amount will go toward future album projects (next up is my album of original songs!).  If full funding is not met, the first priority is compensating the musicians and producing the album.

story:
Short Summary

In June, 2019, a group of musicians and I got together in Julian, CA. to make a live worship album. It was an incredible experience and the music that was made was life changing. You can learn more at http://www.katehurley.com/live-from-julian,

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise an additional 3,500 dollars for mixing and promotion. 
  •  You can get great perks like previous albums, my book Cupid is a Procrastinator on prolonged singleness,  or even have a personalized  song written for you or a loved one! 

The Impact

  • We believe these songs will bring healing and hope to people. We believe that it will remind people of how deeply they are loved by God and will be a means to worship Him. 
  • Dozens of people have told me how much my past albums have impacted them, helping them through depressions, divorce and death. I believe this album will do the same. 

Risks & Challenges

We did an initial campaign which did well but I was planning on mixing the album myself. After we made the project I realized that it would be too difficult a challenge for me and that the music was so beautiful that we needed to get it professionally mixed and mastered. We are so grateful for this opportunity to finish our project. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you can't contribute, we would love you to share this campaign with your friends and churches!
  • There are tools on Indiegogo that make it easy for you to share. 
  • As always we would love your prayers

story:
We've put out a bunch of singles now, and we love singles - they give us a chance to show different sides of our musical inspiration and capture all kinds of different vibes from one song to the next - it's a ton of fun. But as we've worked more together (officially 2 years since the first song we ever created!), we’re starting to think bigger. We’re starting to understand what our sound is, and we’re starting to realize and embrace the story that we want to tell with our music. We know that the best way to tell that story is with a project that we can put 100% of ourselves into - and that’s why we’re creating this EP - we want to do something bigger and better than we’ve ever done before, an expression of who we are as artists and people, and a glimpse into the way we see and experience the world around us.

As independent artists, we take a lot of pride in doing everything ourselves. From producing and writing our music, to handling our social media content and performances, to engaging with our fans individually - it’s a ton of work but it’s also the most fun in the world - and there’s no substitute for having control over your artistry. We’ve come to terms with the fact that we have to put in the work for this, that there are no shortcuts; that sleep sometimes just isn’t in the cards; that sometimes we have to sacrifice time spent with people we love and care about (and any of you who really know us - trust us, we HATE doing that) - it’s all part of the journey that we choose to be on every day. But the truth is, it’s IMPOSSIBLE to do everything alone, no matter how hard that is to accept. And for something like this, something that we really want to get done the right way, we came to a very simple but inevitable conclusion - we need help!

And that's where you come in. At the end of the day, we make music for all of YOU, and this journey isn’t just ours. We want you there with us, as you have been so far, every step of the way - not just watching it, but feeling like you're a part of it. Because you are! We really believe in this EP and we want it to be as spectacular as possible for everyone who listens to it, and so we don't want to cut any corners. 

Take a look at the rewards. And if you don’t see anything there that you like, shoot us a message on Instagram or send us an email, and we’ll see what we can do to give you something special to you - to show that you’re special to us. 

A HUGE thank you for sticking with us and for believing in what we’re trying to do. This journey is a wild ride, and trust us there are ups and downs - but the appreciation we get from all of you and seeing the way that some of our music has impacted folks all over the world, even if only for a few minutes - it makes everything worth it. Whatever you can contribute, just know that we appreciate it. However this thing gets done, we can’t WAIT to share it with you. For more info on what you’ll be specifically funding, take a look below!

What we need help with:

Studio Time:

While we do most of our work out of our home studio, in order to record our songs at the high-quality, professional standard necessary for releases, we have to record our final versions at a professional studio (better space, better acoustics, better equipment, tech engineers, etc.). We’ve been recently working out of Mad Oak Studios in Allston (right by where we live in Cambridge) and will be recording the rest of the EP there! We love it there, and can’t wait to show you the things they’ve helped us create with their awesome team.

Collaborations:

As we mentioned, while we like to do things ourselves, that never would have been possible for a project like this - nor would it be what we wanted. With Spectra, we’ve assembled an amazing team. We worked with incredible photographers to create the visual art for the EP, we’ve worked with designers to help with our merch, a videographer for the ‘Lonely’ video, and we are also working with two female vocalists on a couple of songs we’re VERY excited about, which will mean paying for their studio time as well as any costs associated with facilitating the recording. We wanted to bring some more voices into this project, and we think you’ll LOVE what they’ve added.

Mixing and Mastering:

We produce and write everything ourselves, but we leave the mixing and mastering to people who are WAY better at it than we are. We have a particular engineer that we’ve worked with ever since the ‘Falling Down’ release (he also mixed ‘Lonely’!), and we’ve hired him to mix our entire EP so that all of the songs will build on the same cohesive sound and work together the way we want them to.

Marketing and Promotion:

Making the music is one thing, but sometimes the even harder part is getting other people to know it exists. While we know that many of you will listen and we can’t thank you enough for it, in order for us to continue to grow, we need to reach new ears! We believe in the project and, through it, want to connect with as many people as possible. Unfortunately, that can’t happen without putting some dedicated funding behind the songs themselves, from pitching them to editors and playlists to playing them on the road.

 

Open Your Door 

Rome + Red

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thekeymakers/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/WeAreTheKeymakers/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/_TheKeymakers_
story_txt: We've put out a bunch of singles now, and we love singles - they give us a chance to show different sides of our musical inspiration and capture all kinds of different vibes from one song to the next - it's a ton of fun. But as we've worked more together (officially 2 years since the first song we ever created!), we’re starting to think bigger. We’re starting to understand what our sound is, and we’re starting to realize and embrace the story that we want to tell with our music. We know that the best way to tell that story is with a project that we can put 100% of ourselves into - and that’s why we’re creating this EP - we want to do something bigger and better than we’ve ever done before, an expression of who we are as artists and people, and a glimpse into the way we see and experience the world around us.As independent artists, we take a lot of pride in doing everything ourselves. From producing and writing our music, to handling our social media content and performances, to engaging with our fans individually - it’s a ton of work but it’s also the most fun in the world - and there’s no substitute for having control over your artistry. We’ve come to terms with the fact that we have to put in the work for this, that there are no shortcuts; that sleep sometimes just isn’t in the cards; that sometimes we have to sacrifice time spent with people we love and care about (and any of you who really know us - trust us, we HATE doing that) - it’s all part of the journey that we choose to be on every day. But the truth is, it’s IMPOSSIBLE to do everything alone, no matter how hard that is to accept. And for something like this, something that we really want to get done the right way, we came to a very simple but inevitable conclusion - we need help!And that's where you come in. At the end of the day, we make music for all of YOU, and this journey isn’t just ours. We want you there with us, as you have been so far, every step of the way - not just watching it, but feeling like you're a part of it. Because you are! We really believe in this EP and we want it to be as spectacular as possible for everyone who listens to it, and so we don't want to cut any corners. Take a look at the rewards. And if you don’t see anything there that you like, shoot us a message on Instagram or send us an email, and we’ll see what we can do to give you something special to you - to show that you’re special to us. A HUGE thank you for sticking with us and for believing in what we’re trying to do. This journey is a wild ride, and trust us there are ups and downs - but the appreciation we get from all of you and seeing the way that some of our music has impacted folks all over the world, even if only for a few minutes - it makes everything worth it. Whatever you can contribute, just know that we appreciate it. However this thing gets done, we can’t WAIT to share it with you. For more info on what you’ll be specifically funding, take a look below!What we need help with:Studio Time:While we do most of our work out of our home studio, in order to record our songs at the high-quality, professional standard necessary for releases, we have to record our final versions at a professional studio (better space, better acoustics, better equipment, tech engineers, etc.). We’ve been recently working out of Mad Oak Studios in Allston (right by where we live in Cambridge) and will be recording the rest of the EP there! We love it there, and can’t wait to show you the things they’ve helped us create with their awesome team.Collaborations:As we mentioned, while we like to do things ourselves, that never would have been possible for a project like this - nor would it be what we wanted. With Spectra, we’ve assembled an amazing team. We worked with incredible photographers to create the visual art for the EP, we’ve worked with designers to help with our merch, a videographer for the ‘Lonely’ video, and we are also working with two female vocalists on a couple of songs we’re VERY excited about, which will mean paying for their studio time as well as any costs associated with facilitating the recording. We wanted to bring some more voices into this project, and we think you’ll LOVE what they’ve added.Mixing and Mastering:We produce and write everything ourselves, but we leave the mixing and mastering to people who are WAY better at it than we are. We have a particular engineer that we’ve worked with ever since the ‘Falling Down’ release (he also mixed ‘Lonely’!), and we’ve hired him to mix our entire EP so that all of the songs will build on the same cohesive sound and work together the way we want them to.Marketing and Promotion:Making the music is one thing, but sometimes the even harder part is getting other people to know it exists. While we know that many of you will listen and we can’t thank you enough for it, in order for us to continue to grow, we need to reach new ears! We believe in the project and, through it, want to connect with as many people as possible. Unfortunately, that can’t happen without putting some dedicated funding behind the songs themselves, from pitching them to editors and playlists to playing them on the road. Open Your Door Rome + RedInstagram: https://www.instagram.com/thekeymakers/Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/WeAreTheKeymakers/Twitter: https://twitter.com/_TheKeymakers_

story:
Lucky Louie Blues Co. Album Funding

Hey folks! About 3 months ago we hit the studio with our new producer Doug Grean.

( https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doug_Grean ) 

We are a little less than halfway done with what will be our first (and best) full length album and we need your help to finish it up. The musical sounds and ideas we hear in our heads are coming together wonderfully, however it takes time to fully develop these ideas. As many of you know, studio time is charged by the hour so the more detail we add, the more it costs us and THAT'S WHERE YOU COME IN. We are asking for contributions that will go directly towards studio time.  We have already spent over $2000 to bring our musical ideas to you, so we are looking for our fans, friends, and family to help match what we have contributed. 

At $60 an hour, every dollar contributed will give us another minute in the studio. For those of you who are like me and suck at numbers, here is a breakdown:

$15 = 15 Minutes

$30 = 30 Minutes

$60 = One Hour

$90 = 1.5 Hours

... and so on. 

The $2000+ we already spent could have been enough to finish the record, but we are making something special and we need your help. If you need any information as to exactly where your money will be going, don't hesitate to call or text on my personal number (914)-610-1560.

story:
Short Summary

  • We are a professional string ensemble based in Helsingborg, Sweden. Our repertoire covers everything from classical to contemporary and even crosses over into pop and jazz. 
  • During the pandemic, performance opportunities have all but disappeared with no chances to play for a live audience. We therefore decided to record a CD instead. 
  • CD recordings play a very important part in the promotional work of an ensemble, as well as a platform from which we can express our vision of music and repertoire. Since we are financing the many productions costs of this project ourselves, your contribution is vital for the upcoming release of this CD.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The costs involved in making this CD are: Editing, mixing, mastering, as well as cover design, release costs and distribution. In order to keep the expenses down we are doing a lot of the work ourselves. 
  • We are delighted to have been able to invite several of our best (musical!) friends to take part in this project, giving us the opportunity to record a unique mix of repertoire including first-time recordings and new arrangements. 
  • Your contribution will go towards the total cost of €4000 for the release of this CD. 

The Impact

  • Our CD will be a great way to reach new audiences around the world and will help to grab the attention of the press and reviewers.
  • The Little Venice Ensemble's first CD with Susanna Andersson reached #2 on British radio station Classic FM, as well as receiving 5 star reviews in both Sweden and the UK.
  • This will be the second CD in our musical exploration of the four seasons.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you cannot donate yourself or if you know of someone who might be interested in helping us with this release, please do share this campaign using the Indiegogo share tools!

Short Summary

We are a professional string ensemble based in Helsingborg, Sweden. Our repertoire covers everything from classical to contemporary and even crosses over into pop and jazz. 
During the pandemic, performance opportunities have all but disappeared with no chances to play for a live audience. We therefore decided to record a CD instead. 
CD recordings play a very important part in the promotional work of an ensemble, as well as a platform from which we can express our vision of music and repertoire. Since we are financing the many productions costs of this project ourselves, your contribution is vital for the upcoming release of this CD.


What We Need & What You Get

The costs involved in making this CD are: Editing, mixing, mastering, as well as cover design, release costs and distribution. In order to keep the expenses down we are doing a lot of the work ourselves. 
We are delighted to have been able to invite several of our best (musical!) friends to take part in this project, giving us the opportunity to record a unique mix of repertoire including first-time recordings and new arrangements. 
Your contribution will go towards the total cost of €4000 for the release of this CD. 


The Impact

Our CD will be a great way to reach new audiences around the world and will help to grab the attention of the press and reviewers.
The Little Venice Ensemble's first CD with Susanna Andersson reached #2 on British radio station Classic FM, as well as receiving 5 star reviews in both Sweden and the UK.
This will be the second CD in our musical exploration of the four seasons.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot donate yourself or if you know of someone who might be interested in helping us with this release, please do share this campaign using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
TemperMental needs your help!

We are TemperMental, and we are ready to share our music with the world. We have been offered the opportunity to complete our first album with a multi-platinum award winning production team, and record a live version & video at a world famous studio in London!

 "Please help us accomplish our goals and donate today!"

 

What You Get if you donate to our cause...

~ Every dollar helps, and with each dollar given you'll receive the feeling of fulfillment and the satisfaction in helping four young girls make their dreams come true! ;-} Gift levels 1-8 are accumulative - that means if you donate at level 4 you will also receive the gifts from levels 1, 2, & 3.               "Wow, amazing; right?!!!"

Level 1 donations $25.00 gift - you'll receive mailed to you a special TemperMental Fan package that consists of photos, stickers & buttons.

Level 2 donations $50.00 gift - you'll receive mailed to you an official TemperMental T-shirt (cumulative with Level 1)

Level 3 donations $75.00 gift - you'll receive mailed to you a signed 8 x 10 TemperMental photo (cumulative with Levels 1 & 2)

Level 4 donations $100.00 gift - 5 entries into our TemperMental signed Guitar raffle, this guitar is currently being used in the production of our album (cumulative with Levels 1-3)

Level 5 donations $250.00 gift - you'll receive mailed to you a TemperMental signed poster, and 15 more entries into the Guitar raffle (cumulative with Levels 1-4)

Level 6 donations $500.00 gift - you'll have the opportunity to have a private zoom call with us TemperMental (must be redeemed by September, 2022) & (cumulative with Levels 1-5)  

Level 7 donations $1,000.00 gift - you'll receive in the mail a signed copy of a hand written song from our new album (cumulative with Levels 1-6)

Level 8 donations $5,000.00 gift - You'll have the chance to appear in one of our upcoming music videos (you the contributor must be local to CA and/or have the ability to get to the filming location on your own) & you will also receive two free entry tickets to our live show in London (you the contributor also must get to the facility in London on your own, all travel and lodging expenses are the sole responsibility of the contributor, the band does not provide these for this level of contribution) (cumulative with Levels 1-7) 

Level 9 donations $10,000.00 gift - Contributor will receive Airfare and hotel stay for 1 person to London and free admission into the exclusive private VIP party, live album and video recording at the world famous studio in London, and a TemperMental SWAG bag.

Thank you, every dollar helps us!!!

*All gifts will be mailed and sent after campaign ends and all funds have cleared.  If your contribution for some reason does not clear, you forfeit your proposed Level gifts. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Please talk about us and share our fundraising event on your social media.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

Thank you so very much for all your help! 

Love,

TemperMental

Krissy, Ruby, Marilaine, & Jordan

story:
Dearest All

As some of you may know my mother died very suddenly in June 2020 and she was such a support of my music.  I wish to record my second album,  which is a dedication to her unconditional love as a mother and inspiring human being. The album is  called,  ‘ Queen in the Diamond Sky’.  I have written and composed  8 new original songs, which I wish to have recorded, mixed, and mastered.


This project will be recorded in Berlin with the help of Gerdus Oosthuizen who also works under the name of Bummela. I wish to be able to record over  7 days and have it produced and mastered in Germany. We aim to start recording this spring. 

These new songs weave a story that is relevant to our changing and unpredictable times. These songs carry with  them the spirit of my mother and speak about the themes of grief, joy, hope and the importance of our connection to Mother Earth. 

What You Get

 Pre-order my album now for however much you wish to contribute by selecting one of the perks listed to the right

(If you wish to pay use PayPal then please pay directly to Samantha@samantha-claire.com and tell me which perk you have chosen)

Album costs

The amount raised will cover the recording production and distribution costs which is.  

55, 220 DKK   =  € 7426 

The breakdown of these costs is as follows:

Recording/studio fees/production/mixing/editing/mastering  - £ 44000 DKK

Musician fees -  5200 DKK

Artwork and design –  3000 DKK

Other expenses, travel etc  –  3000 DKK

TIMELINE

Recording, editing and mixing - by end of June

Mastering and Artwork/design - July

ALBUM LAUNCH – SEPTEMBER 10th  ( My mom would have turned 70 years old ) 

I am deeply grateful to everyone who has supported me. 

So much love to you all. 

Biography

Samantha Claire is a mother, singer/songwriter, space-holder  and Life Coach. Originally from Cape Town,  South Africa, she has a background in the performing arts. She lived in London for 16 years where she worked in Physical Theatre. Over the past 20 years her journey has led her to study the practices of Kundalini Yoga Movement and Shamanism. She has been living in Copenhagen since 2017. 

Samantha has always had a love for music. Borrowing from various traditional medicine music communities across the world, as well as writing her own original songs, Samantha is a conduit of music that is honest, loving and healing for all audiences.

In 2017 she recorded her first album titled ‘Come Dance’

 

https://open.spotify.com/artist/7jo5x7EAhiVnAYC...


www.samantha-claire.com

story:
Thanks for stopping by.

I'm a New York City-based digital media content producer. I'm also a Disabled Military Veteran of the United States Marines and of Black and Queer identity. I'm producing a music video called "BLACK + BLUE". As a rap artist, I've made tons of videos at the different stages of my career. The more I produce that type of content, the more important it becomes because the way a song is contextualized can change people's minds.  It's important that people see the different ways blackness and queerness can be represented, so that others can see themselves living out their truth and fight for those struggling to find their own self-worth. I've seen a lot of change in the media accepting Black and Queer people, but until there is a day that a Black, Queer person can thrive without their survival on the line, or their rights threatened, or their equality questioned, then there is still work to do. I'm making this video to show young people a way to thrive being their most authentic self.

I need $10,000 to make this video look incredible and to pay the production team that will make that happen. The money goes towards ensuring the Director of Cinematography can access the best equipment and hire the best staff that will give the visual the best quality and professionalism. It will also go to the Creative Director and Production Manager to bring in a professional team such as a make-up artist, costume designer, set designer, plus book a versatile and top-notch location that makes videos come alive and make them memorable.

Everyone that donates will get credited in the video and as participant in the album-making process. This means that you will have the credit to your name officially and you can have an active role with the success of the album and the single. Whether I reach my entire goal or not, I will still produce the visual and it will still be released as planned and everyone credited accordingly. If I exceed the goal, I will make sure I donate some of the funds to an organization actively fighting for LGBTQ youth  (such as The Tyler Clementi Foundation) or for an organization involved with Queer and Black people in the arts.

Spreading good love.

The Director of Cinematography is Zen Zadih Pace. He and Imagine Studios produced a stunning documentary on me and another individual living in supportive housing, which aims to help formerly homeless people reach the goal of overcoming their struggles and finding suitable independent housing. In that documentary, I talk about the struggles I had being Black, Queer, homeless, suffering from depression and addiction, issues that together limit opportunities. The way he was able to help tell my story in a compelling way lets me know that he will give this visual to my song the dignity it deserves. The song itself is about resilience from all the things outlined in that documentary, so it follows that Zen knows the angles needed to follow up on that story.

Some of my past music videos delve into my personal struggles as well. 

"Till the Day I Die" (mental health)

"No Mention" (racial identity)

"Hunt Me Down" (Military readiness)

They all have the thread of being personal pieces that directly reflect my real life as a Black and Queer American.

More reward despite the risks.

Depending on the day we plan to produce, anything can go wrong, from malfunctioning equipment, wardrobe mishaps or any random accident. The pandemic could also directly affect the production. But the team has a robust communication plan that will allow them to work through the mishaps. They will also let me know anything they need from me to facilitate the production. I have full confidence that this project can work and all milestones will be met.

 

If you can't donate, you can share this with all those in your network that may be interested in a project like this. Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Hello! We are The BarrowBand, a ground breaking musical project. With our amazing all singing and dancing market barrow we bring to the world the history and magic of fruit and vegetables.

The BarrowBand is an Environmental Arts Theatre Company Project which came about after Malcolm saw a famous cook trying to get children to identify various fruit and veg without much success (leeks were kiwi’s apparently). He immediately started writing songs about them and not long after created The BarrowBand. The BarrowBand are multi generational in age and appeal, making the adults titter as much as the kids. 

"Mosh pit of 5 year olds! Excellent!" 

Jennifer Kearns Cambridge Folk Festival

With sterling musicianship and an exceptional range of songs varying in style from folk and bluegrass to thrash jazz, our performance has been described as inherently funny and educational.

 

 

This campaign will enable us to build a new barrow for our BarrowBand performances. It will be an amazing kinetic work of art featuring a lit up tower of cauliflower, circus sprouts, winking spuds, springing onions, squeezing oranges and much, much more...

As the repertoire of the band grows, so must the barrow. Following the release of our second album we have another 14 amazing fruits and vegetables to incorporate into our show.

 We need help to design a bigger, folding adaptable barrow which we can alter to suit each gig we play. This may include modules with bigger fruit and veg for younger children. Even a nursery a barrow.

You can help us to develop our show to reach even more and especially to reach people in areas with low arts input and poor diet. 

The Barrow is an essential interactive learning tool for our workshops we run in schools.

 

What We Need and What You Get

We have priced our new barrow at £7,700. Albert Bartlett Potatoes of North Lanarkshire have already kindly donated £1500.

We have £1200 in in kind donations

We need another £5000 for design, construction, materials, travel to and from our workshop space and admin to organise the project and source the right materials.

 

Here is where the money will be spent:

 

(This minus Indigogo fees)

For this there are several tantalising perks on offer....

 


Signed copies of our first and second album are up for grabs as well as Secret Downloads of unreleased material, personalised t shirts made for you by the band! and the opportunity to be an official BarrowBand sponsor to have your logos featured on out publicity material and website. 

You can also opt for a live performance- unfortunately these are limited to the central belt of Scotland.

 

 

The Impact

 

"A generation growing up loving The BarrowBand will be a healthier generation"

Parents will be guaranteed that their children will eat more fruit and veg

Children will be healthier and happier

Vegetable producers will sell more fruit and veg 

Schools and communities will get the chance to engage in a creative interactive performance which has a proven lasting impact

All healthy eating projects initiatives are worthwhile. plus learning about the benefits of vegetables and fruit through growing and general information are very important however, unless this ethos continues in the home and beyond the intuitive it can fail longterm. What the BarrowBand does is give something that people of all ages can enjoy, share and which will constantly remind them of the wonders of vegetables and fruit. The correlation between feeling good about something (say carrots) and then engaging with it (eating) cannot be underestimated thus the more amazing our barrow the more people (particularly children will want veg). If both parents and children love us they will love veg and fruit.

One family recently told us that the BarrowBand is the best CD to put on in the car because "we all love it".

 

Risks & Challenges

 

We will face challenges in designing this wonderful new piece of kit which is why  we why we need the help of specialist artists and designers so we can make a durable and custom made prop which will be in use well into the future of the project.

 

Shout It Out!

Please tell anyone and everyone about our campaign, especially your local greengrocer!

Please watch our videos!

and

Follow us on Facebook and Twitter

Here is our website:

http://thebarrowbandlive.co.uk

Thank you from The BarrowBand team!

With our amazing all singing and dancing market barrow we bring to the world the history and magic of fruit and vegetables.The BarrowBand is an Environmental Arts Theatre Company Project which came about after Malcolm saw a famous cook trying to get children to identify various fruit and veg without much success (leeks were kiwi’s apparently). He immediately started writing songs about them and not long after created The BarrowBand. The BarrowBand are multi generational in age and appeal, making the adults titter as much as the kids. "Mosh pit of 5 year olds! story:
My name is Tommy Halloran. I am a songwriter/guitarist/singer living and working in St. Louis. I love to play. My band Tommy Halloran's Guerrilla Swing has racked up a few "Best Jazz" awards in the River Front Times, and the three records I've made in the past ten years have all been very well received and critically acclaimed.    

Now I am working on a new album of nine original songs with my musical comrades, bassist Max Kelly and guitarist Joe Park. I am very proud of this album. It will be called 'Just As Good As Feeling Good'. We recorded the album last week at Native Sound with Patrick Crecelius. Next we will have it mixed, mastered by Brad Sarno, create and layout the artwork, and send it off to be manufactured into 1,000 CD digipaks.  

From start to finish the project will run about $4000. If we can raise that amount over the next several weeks, we can release the new album this summer! So, please help us by pre-ordering the CD, making a donation, or going in for a private-performance perk!

We are hopeful that we will be sharing this new music with you very soon!

Thank you,

Tommy Halloran, Max Kelly & Joe Park

 

  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
DJ Nejo: As a producer Nejo’s remixes have drawn support from the likes of Roger Sanchez whilst his DJ sets take in all the shades of underground house.

 

Days Gone By (part I) is the first album by the young and talented Italian DJ Nejo. With this release DJ Nejo explores elements of house and electronic music both past and present. His remix of Clannad's anthem "I will find you", his deep house edit of Staind's "It's been Awhile" and the nu-Disco of "Good Old Days" are a testament to this journey through house. The album provides different moods throughout with unexpected moments such as the uplifting "Sunshine Day" contrasting nicely with the stripped-back beats of "Ork". The different textures are enhanced by numerous featured artists, guest vocalists and live instrumentation

 

http://www.traxsource.com/track/3709889/i-will-find-you-club-mix

 

Details:

With this Campaign DJ Nejo would cover promotion and distribution costs outside Italy.

 

http://www.traxsource.com/title/672382/a-brand-new-start

 

Perks:

Great things are waiting for those who contribute. You can receive a digital copy of the album Days Gone By (Part I), including the first single "I will find you" which has already been rocking dancefloors. A signed CD copy, an exclusive Vinyl release, only for backers and T Shirt limited edition.

You could even organize a DJ Set with DJ Nejo or an exclusive Live set with all his band.

 

Risks and Challenges

Recordings are ready, this album needs only to be mixed and mastered, but it's only a matter of time (not money). In the coming 40 days you will listen to some exclusive previews of the other 9 tracks of Days Gone By (Part I).

 

https://soundcloud.com/nejodj

 

If you love House Music, and you want to listen to some brand new music made with heart and soul, you're in the right place, so please share this campaign and help DJ Nejo to spread the word of pure House and Electronic Music.

story:
Le Projet

Ça fait maintenant plus d'un an que je compose et chante mes chansons (en anglais), avec mon band de musiciens spécialement concocté. On a joué dans des salles de Montréal, comme la Casa del Popolo, dehors dans une cours arrière, comme au café Blanc de Blanc, dans des festivals, comme le Festival Atmosph'air sur ma Plaza. J'ai sorti deux singles: Butterfly et Love Beauty (https://sara-danielle.bandcamp.com/). Et maintenant, je suis en studio pour enregistrer un album avec mes plus récentes chansons. Il sera lancé au printemps 2017!!!

Mon projet, c'est de la musique, des mots qui s'entrechoquent, des rêves, des émotions qui débordent un peu trop, des musiciens plein d'énergie et de créativité. Je veux enregistrer ces chansons parce que je crois sincèrement qu'elles ont une âme et le potentiel de rejoindre les gens.  Je le perçois et le vis quand je fais des spectacles. C'est aussi un stade important de ma carrière musicale. Jouer devant public, c'est toujours incroyable, mais le moment est venu de mettre tout ça sur un album, d'explorer mes idées et de les immortaliser. Je pourrai me faire entendre dans le milieu de la musique avec cet album et j'aurai une grande expérience dans mon bagage. Bien que je finance une partie du projet moi-même, j'ai besoin de votre aide pour le mener à bien et vous faire vivre avec mes chansons ce qui me fait tant tripper dans la musique!

 

Ce que vous financez & ce que ça vous donne

Les coûts de l'album s'élèveront à 4600$. Je finance une partie du projet moi-même et avec l'aide d'autres campagnes de levées de fonds. Il reste 3000$ à couvrir, et tout ça comprend le temps de studio et le mixage, la paie de mes musiciens, le vidéo "Live session" pour une de mes chansons, les photos promotionnelles et qui serviront au design de l'album, le graphisme du projet ainsi que la duplication des CDs (pour qu'il y aie des belles copies physiques à tenir dans vos mains WOW). 

Je vous offre plein de petites choses, et même des grosses choses, parce que vous m'aidez. Vous aurez un download de l'album, une copie physique, une journée en studio avec nous, moi et Karo qui jouons des tounes dans votre salon, selon votre contribution. Et même un show full band!!!!!

Si JAMAIS on n'atteint pas le montant prévu, ne vous inquiétez SURTOUT PAS: il y aura quand même des chansons. J'utiliserai vos dons pour enregistrer ma musique en plus petit format, et vous aurez quand même droit à vos petites choses qui viennent avec (CD physique, Karo et moi, etc.).

 

L'impact

Cet album sera rempli de musique originale et de sensibilité, et vous fera ressentir des émotions et du groove que vous ne soupçonniez peut-être pas à l'intérieur de vous. Du moins, c'est ce qu'un artiste aspire à faire, et c'est ce que vous m'aiderai à accomplir en finançant cet album. Il me permettra de chanter ce que j'ai à dire et, je l'espère, de toucher les gens à travers ça. 

 

La Suite

Lorsque l'album sera terminé (YYYAAAAYY), je ferai un spectacle/party de lancement pour célébrer son arrivée dans le monde. Je donnerai un concert avec toutes les chansons de l'album mais aussi plusieurs autres, et il y aura des surprises et collaborations avec d'autres artistes. Pour la suite, je ferai la promotion de mon album dans les réseaux sociaux, auprès de la presse et des blogueurs, dans les radios, dans les maisons de disque. Bref: je diffusera mon contenu pour qu'il se fasse connaître. Je prévois également faire plusieurs spectacles et festivals à l'été 2017 pour promouvoir mon matériel. Vous, contributeur, jouerez un grand rôle dans le développement de ce projet artistique. Sans votre aide, l'album ne pourrait pas avoir un tel impact dans le milieu de la musique. Et ce n'est que le début de mon parcours musical!! Je vous tiendrez au courant de mes prochains shows, évènements, sorties de musique... Bref, tout ce qui se passera pour moi après l'album, car votre contribution ne se limite pas ici, elle me permettra de faire fructifier ma carrière et je tiens à vous en faire part. 

 

Risques et défis

Avec tout projet dans la vie, il se peut que les choses n'aillent pas tout à fait comme on le veut. Dans mon cas, il est possible que je n'amasse pas tout l'argent nécessaire à la production de l'album. Il se peut aussi que sois malade une journée d'enregistrement de voix. Mais n'ayez crainte!! J'ai plusieurs tours dans mon sac et je saurai trouver des solutions. Je m'engage à vous fournir le meilleur de ma créativité sur cet album, avec toute les ressources que j'ai. C'est pourquoi j'ai absolument besoin que vous m'accompagniez dans cette aventure. Plus on est de fous, plus on crée!!

 

Share the love

Une autre façon de m'aider est, vous l'aurez deviné, de PARTAGER mon projet Indiegogo sur les réseaux sociaux!!! Ensemble, nous pourrons rejoindre beaucoup plus de gens. Peut-être votre père, tante, voisine d'en face ou ami de la famille voudra-t-il m'aider dans mon projet. Mais surtout, ça permettra au plus grand nombre de gens possible d'avoir entendu parler de mon album au moment où il sortira. So share the love everyone :)

story:
Let's try this "again"

My name is Floco Torres & I'm a recording artist, musician & songwriter born in Willingboro NJ, reppin Macon GA & now living in Akron OH. Writing has always been my passion & music helped me express myself on a more vast platform. I've gone from being homeless & on the verge of taking my own life to being the happiest I've ever been because of music. If there's one thing I've learned throughout 10 years of creating a career as a musician, it's to don't be afraid to start over and try it again.

We've released countless projects & videos independently & have played hundreds of shows with an immense amount of talented musicians over the years. Some projects & shows have gained more attention than others, but I've always taken pride in knowing that one day, our message will make it to the main stage. That's what we want to achieve with our EP again & full length album Nobody Cares News.

Although we have been able to create art that we're extremely proud with just a few of us, we've now reached the point where we're asking for your help to keep moving forward. These two projects are equally about everyone involved because I would be nowhere without their willingness to collaborate. This campaign aspires to help us grow & inspire multiple careers in music & beyond.

What We Need

We are asking if you would help us raise funds to finish creating these two projects, more professional quality videos, & to broadcast our movement to a higher level. We're asking you essentially to invest in our abilities to try again.

To be more specific:

  • Mixing/Mastering - We record ourselves and don't use fancy studios just to take Instagram pics in. But we do need engineers that love their craft & have the ability to make our DIY setup sound crisp.
  • Merch - I've tried to make my own merch in the past & while fun, I know some artists who are much better at it than I am. 
  • Video production - We shoot our own videos & we bought our own camera. But no amount of YouTube tutorials can trump a videographer that lives and breaths behind his/her lens.
  • Marketing - The difference between your favorite local artist & the famous one on the radio is usually who they know & how much money they have. While we aren't chasing fame or radio dreams, we do aspire to work with more like minded industry pros that believe in our message & will help spread the word.
  • Paying our collaborators - These ladies & gentlemen don't need another musician asking for a "favor"

Any & all of your help here allows us to swing a little harder for the fence.

We want to thank you for your support by gifting you with some awesome merch & bringing you along for the ride during this process. Our contribution levels will range from 10$ to 1000$ so for example,

  • 10$ contribution gets you both projects via digital download before they are everywhere.
  • 25$ contribution gets you digital AND physical (signed) copies of both projects.
  • 100$ contribution gets you a digital download, signed physical copy, liner note credit & an"again" merch pack (Shirt, sticker, koozie)

And the list goes on... (The gifts for your support are listing on the right side of this page in full)

The Impact

These projects will help us continue to create art at a high level, reach larger audiences for our own work while exposing those audiences to so many other great artists/musicians/designers that we love. This is an opportunity to ascend & to bring those we love with us.

This is more than just creating music in a sense, I see it as shifting a paradigm in countless lives that without music, may never had crossed paths in the first place. I've always believed in myself, but I believe in the folks around just the same if not more. For those of you that have followed Floco Torres for a while, then you remember the movement we created with Floco's Modern Life. This is a chance to do it better.

The only risk I've ever seen is being afraid to push forward. As a creative, you fight that battle everyday. We may not reach our full goal but what we do raise gets us one step closer.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please don't think that if you can't contribute monetarily, that you can't help or you aren't apart of this movement. If you know anyone that may be interested in helping, please use the social media sharing links to help us get the word out.

 

Thank you for taking the time to listen/read. We look forward to sharing new moments with you soon!

 

FT
story_txt:
Let's try this "again"
My name is Floco Torres & I'm a recording artist, musician & songwriter born in Willingboro NJ, reppin Macon GA & now living in Akron OH. Writing has always been my passion & music helped me express myself on a more vast platform. I've gone from being homeless & on the verge of taking my own life to being the happiest I've ever been because of music. If there's one thing I've learned throughout 10 years of creating a career as a musician, it's to don't be afraid to start over and try it again.

We've released countless projects & videos independently & have played hundreds of shows with an immense amount of talented musicians over the years. Some projects & shows have gained more attention than others, but I've always taken pride in knowing that one day, our message will make it to the main stage. That's what we want to achieve with our EP again & full length album Nobody Cares News.

Although we have been able to create art that we're extremely proud with just a few of us, we've now reached the point where we're asking for your help to keep moving forward. These two projects are equally about everyone involved because I would be nowhere without their willingness to collaborate. This campaign aspires to help us grow & inspire multiple careers in music & beyond.

What We Need
We are asking if you would help us raise funds to finish creating these two projects, more professional quality videos, & to broadcast our movement to a higher level. We're asking you essentially to invest in our abilities to try again. 
To be more specific:


Mixing/Mastering - We record ourselves and don't use fancy studios just to take Instagram pics in. But we do need engineers that love their craft & have the ability to make our DIY setup sound crisp.

Merch - I've tried to make my own merch in the past & while fun, I know some artists who are much better at it than I am. 

Video production - We shoot our own videos & we bought our own camera. But no amount of YouTube tutorials can trump a videographer that lives and breaths behind his/her lens.

Marketing - The difference between your favorite local artist & the famous one on the radio is usually who they know & how much money they have. While we aren't chasing fame or radio dreams, we do aspire to work with more like minded industry pros that believe in our message & will help spread the word.

Paying our collaborators - These ladies & gentlemen don't need another musician asking for a "favor"

Any & all of your help here allows us to swing a little harder for the fence.
We want to thank you for your support by gifting you with some awesome merch & bringing you along for the ride during this process. Our contribution levels will range from 10$ to 1000$ so for example,

10$ contribution gets you both projects via digital download before they are everywhere.
25$ contribution gets you digital AND physical (signed) copies of both projects.
100$ contribution gets you a digital download, signed physical copy, liner note credit & an"again" merch pack (Shirt, sticker, koozie)

And the list goes on... (The gifts for your support are listing on the right side of this page in full)

The Impact
These projects will help us continue to create art at a high level, reach larger audiences for our own work while exposing those audiences to so many other great artists/musicians/designers that we love. This is an opportunity to ascend & to bring those we love with us.

This is more than just creating music in a sense, I see it as shifting a paradigm in countless lives that without music, may never had crossed paths in the first place. I've always believed in myself, but I believe in the folks around just the same if not more. For those of you that have followed Floco Torres for a while, then you remember the movement we created with Floco's Modern Life. This is a chance to do it better.
The only risk I've ever seen is being afraid to push forward. As a creative, you fight that battle everyday. We may not reach our full goal but what we do raise gets us one step closer.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Please don't think that if you can't contribute monetarily, that you can't help or you aren't apart of this movement. If you know anyone that may be interested in helping, please use the social media sharing links to help us get the word out.
 
Thank you for taking the time to listen/read. We look forward to sharing new moments with you soon!
 
FT

story:
I am Doctora Xingona Diana Alvarez.

My ancestors bloom in my voice. With my music, I roar an otherworldly fire against oppression, exalt queer love and liberation, and create a gripping atmosphere for healing. My songs live as I do: in-between, where borders are a myth.

I am a singer-songwriter, poet, composer, filmmaker, educator, and scholar whose work centers transcendence, kinship, and the co-liberation and nourishment of BIPOC women, nonbinary, trans, and genderqueer artists.

The songs on my debut album Ser Artista, are songs from my award-winning show, Quiero Volver: A Xicanx Ritual Opera. Quiero Volver is a multimedia performance altar for women, nonbinary, trans, and genderqueer artists of color to convene and manifest futures. Quiero Volver features my original music, sonic text scores, a poem-script for ensemble performance, and documentary portraits from the BridgeSong Series, a virtual convening for artists of color to build coalitions for planetary healing. In 2018, Quiero Volver was produced at Smith College by grassroots organizers, and raised over $10,000 to support immigrant justice initiatives. In 2020, Quiero Volver was awarded a grant from the New England Foundation for the Arts, and will premiere as a video project in 2021. Performances from Quiero Volver benefit the BridgeSong Fund, a nourishing grant program for BIPOC Women, Nonbinary, Trans, and Genderqueer Musicians in Western Massachusetts. I founded the BridgeSong Fund in 2020 in collaboration with the Institute for the Musical Arts in Goshen, MA.

As you can see, the songs on Ser Artista are seeds that bloom far and wide to catalyze transformation and healing on the planet. 

I would love for you to join me on the journey of releasing my music to you, across the universe!

This campaign will support production, mixing, mastering, graphic design, distribution, and publicity for Ser Artista, so that I can start releasing songs as early as April 2021. The expected release date for the album is September 2021. 

Ser Artista Budget Goals

In the most ideal circumstances, I will raise enough money for the following album expenses:

Production, Mixing, and Mastering - $10,000

Graphic Design - $3,000

Distribution - $100

Limited CD printing and materials - $2,000

Publicity - $3,000

------------

Total - $18,100

My budget goal is ambitious, as I am. Should I reach a smaller target, I will put all funds toward production, mixing, mastering, and digital distribution. My goal is to start releasing singles from this album in April. Your support will help me reach this goal!

To entice you further, I have exclusive perks including voice lessons, handwritten notes, outdoor concerts, and virtual workshops!

Ser Artista Impact

In supporting this project, you are supporting a debut music album created by a genderqueer Xicana independent artist from South Texas, who is the first in her family to attend college, let alone pursue an MFA in Poetry...let alone pursue and EARN a doctorate in Electronic Arts. 

It is my ethos to circulate abundance. Ser Artista is my gift to community across the universe who feel in-between, who seek chosen familia, who are brilliant for their multifaceted ways of being. This album is my way of directly nourishing chosen family. As with all my work, when I am offered support, I redistribute wealth to support my community, especially QTBIPOC fam. 

Let's do this!!!!

I am committed to seeing this album project through. I need your support. I invite you to contribute financially to this campaign, but also to get the word out and make some noise about this Indiegogo campaign. Please email your friends! Shoutout the campaign on social media!

Mil gracias for your support. I continue to create for you/us.

story:
My IndieGoGo Campaign

           Hello everybody! This is my very first IndieGoGo Campaign. My name is Vinnie Valentino and I'm am a Singer, Songwriter from the "Biggest Little City in the World" Reno Nevada. I am here to talk to you today about a crowdfunding campaign that I just launched! I want to offer an invitation for you to participate in the creation of my debut album called "Radio Acoustica." This is going to be a 10 Song Collection of all Acoustic-Based Original Music and Cover Songs.

  

"Solitary Heart" the 1st Single

          In October of 2019, I started production on this project, and since then, have recorded, and mixed 5 of the 10 songs that will be on the Album. In February of this year, I released the 1st single entitled "Solitary Heart." And the response that I have received from this release has been overwhelming!

 

THE COUNTRY NETWORK

            The music video created for "Solitary Heart" was quickly noticed by "THE COUNTRY NETWORK." Which is a nationally broadcast country music channel; And is currently being played at least once a day in music video blocks, and on featured programs, such as "Americana" and "On the Rise!"

https://tcncountry.net/

 

COUNTRY MUSIC CHANNEL

        "Solitary Heart" was also noticed by the COUNTY MUSIC CHANNEL! And in August 2020 went all the way up to #1 on the COUNTRY MUSIC CHANNEL playlist!

www.cmctvusa.com

Now 4 months later, "Solitary Heart" is still going strong, and is still in the TOP 20! At #17!

 

Artist Interview on GALAXY 107 FM with DJ Grant

       In October of this year, I was a guest on the GALAXY 107 FM radio show... DJ Grant showcased 5 of my Songs on the air! Below is a Youtube link to the entire Radio Show! It was a blast! As of October 7th, 2020 “Solitary Heart” has been requested 2,137 times on the Internationally Broadcast Radio Station GALAXY 107 FM. And was at #8 in the Top 10 GALAXY COUNTRY CHARTS!  I placed a link to the GALAXY 107 FM website so you can check out their global operation! Showcasing independent Artists worldwide! Broadcasting live to over 70 Countries and 98 Cities Globally, with 5 million-plus fans! 

http://galaxyfm.co.nz/

 
 

Tom Gordon & Imirage Sound Lab

http://www.inspired-amateur.com/

          Radio Acoustica is being produced, recorded, mixed, and mastered by Tom Gordon (Inspired-Amateur Productions) at Imirage Sound Lab. The Reno/Tahoe area is blessed to have one of the very finest Music Producers in the business... Tom Gordon, is a Record Producer, Engineer, and Educator. His client list includes Ozzy Osbourne, Dr. Dre, The Beach Boys, Boyz II Men, Willie Nelson, Merle Haggard, Creedence Clearwater Revisited, Collective Soul, Whitesnake, Bruce Dickenson (Iron Maiden), Buddy Miles (Hendrix), Laurie Anderson, Leonard Nimoy, Cliff Robertson, Peter Graves, Nelson, G Love, and Special Sauce, Dillinger Escape Plan, E40, Doug E Fresh, Shock G, Classical clients include Eric Whitacre, Edgar Meyer & the Russian National Orchestra. TV and film work include Role Models (WB) Wife Swap and Inside Edition (ABC) Behind the Music (VH1) Celebrity Death Match and "2gether" (MTV) & The Secret Live of Walter Mitty and The Naked Gun (Fox).

           Tom has been making records for 25 years with 5 Platinum and 1 Gold-selling albums, 1 Emmy, 1 3M Visionary Award, and over 200 independent CDs of local and regional artists to his credit. He has also done an audio post for several independent films. He currently runs Imirage Sound Lab and was the former head engineer at Granny's House/ Sierra Sonics Recording Mansion. Additionally, he's the private engineer for Mike Love of the Beach Boys.

 

Cameron Paris & Firebolt Media

         The Cover Photo and all Photography for Radio Acoustica were produced by Cameron Paris...  His brilliant concept and vision for "Solitary Heart" made it possible for my music career to be recognized on the world stage! As well as creating a very stylized country-western theme for the Radio Acoustica Album.

https://fireboltmedia.co/

Who is Firebolt?

DEDICATED | CREATIVE | DRIVEN

Cameron Paris, creative director, and owner of Firebolt Media has worked on visual art, ideas, and projects throughout his childhood and adult life. 

Earning his clientele’s trust over the years has allowed him to go full-time with Firebolt in 2018, which he is extremely grateful for.

He enjoys capturing the magical “sweet spots” between artistic expression and storytelling with the content he is tasked to create.

Cameron’s goal is to become a master storyteller and content creator for projects that have important messages to tell.

 

Steve Baker & Visual Image Marketing

https://www.visualimagemarketing.com/

       The marketing and promotion of Radio Acoustica's Music Video's are a very important element in the success of this album. I had the pleasure of working with Steve Baker in the promotion of "Solitary Heart." I was very impressed with his marketing connections, and I am very much looking forward to working with him again on up-coming Music Videos for Radio Acoustica.

           Steve Baker has promoted over 350 music videos from Independent Country and Americana artists over the past 20 years from artists like Dolly Parton, Kevin Costner, The Grascals, Charley Pride, The Bellamy Brothers, Andy Frasier (from the '60's group Free), American Idol finalist Michael Sarver, The Nickel Slots, Tommy Steele Band, Stephanie Urbina Jones, Hillbilly Vegas, Southern Halo, Tyler Steel, The Soul Circus Cowboys, and many others.

 

On-Line {‌{‌{LISTENING•PARTY}‌}‌}

            I can't express in words just how much I appreciate your support, and I would love for you to be a partner with me in this project. I feel extremely fortunate that I can show my backers what they are investing in, by offering an On-Line Listening Party... Please check out the 5 Tracks that are completed! "Solitary Heart" is the only track that has been officially released! And is available on many popular streaming platforms, such as Spotify, Apple Music, Amazon, Deezer, Google Play, and iHeartRadio. The other tracks on the website are for streaming only and will be officially released when Radio Acoustica is finished. With the exception of "Believe."  Which is to be the 2nd Single on the album to be released! The Official Music Video for "Believe" was postponed in April 2020 due to the COVID 19 lockdown! Since then, it has been resumed and is in mid-production now... And will be released in December 2020 or early January 2021 along with the Single. The link to my unreleased tracks is available as my {Campaign Listening Party!} And cannot be downloaded! Please listen on my Artist Website at 

www.vinnievalentinomusic.com

 

MOVING FORWARD>>>

           Moving forward with Radio Acoustica includes getting my music out to radio. My next objective is to distribute the single "Solitary Heart" to CDX Nashville! And enter Nashville Radio through Mainstream Country Music TrAction. CDX Nashville’s clients include a ‘who’s who’ of Country Music artists: all the greats from George Strait, Garth Brooks, Carrie Underwood, Blake Shelton, Miranda Lambert, and many more over a 28-year history. Artists who started as indies and have gone on to major success who began with CDX include Florida Georgia Line, Luke Combs, Mitchell Tenpenny, and Kelsea Ballerini.

https://www.cdxcd.com/about-cdx/          

        

InDemand Stretch-Goal>>>$9,600

           If I have the good fortune of reaching my goal and be blessed with the opportunity to be part of the InDemand Status...  I will produce 2 more Songs for the Album as "InDemand Tracks." This will make Radio Acoustica a 12 song Collection. For me, the average cost of producing, recording, and mixing (1 song) in the Studio is about $600...  I will need to raise at least another $1,200 above my Campaign Goal to accomplish this. I have the material written and arranged to make this happen, but we'll see if funds allow me to make this change. 

         And to enter Nashville Radio through Mainstream Country Music TrAction... I will need another $1,400 for The Mainstream Country Distribution Full Service Package! Setting my Stretch-Goal at $9,600.

 

https://cdbaby.com/

          Since half of this album is already completed, I do have a really good idea of how much money I will need to finish it! With special allowances for mastering the entire project, producing the first run of CDs, Vintage Vinyl Records, Limited Edition T-Shirts, Music Distribution through CD Baby, and Licensing/Publishing through BMI.

https://www.bmi.com/

        Any funds that go over my funding goal of $7,000 will be used for the following... CDX Nashville’s Distribution, Music Video Production, Music Production, Music Video Promotion, Marketing, and will also be used to produce the 2 new additional Songs "InDemand Tracks."

 

"Solitary Heart"

The inspiration behind solitary heartfelt lyrics...

            The former frontman of a popular local band in Reno, NV. called TWENTY4SEVEN; Vinnie Valentino has had his fair share of life challenges and has had to work through setbacks on this journey. The inspiration behind "Solitary Heart" is a paradox of two different types of loneliness. "Solitary Heart" captures the individuals' search for social acceptance and the quest for finding a complementary soulmate. Several years of in-activity in musical endeavors and being single had ultimately left the singer lost and lonely. The song takes the listener on a journey to try to answer common questions of how some are lucky in love, while others are left behind. And what hope is there for the lonely to find love? "Solitary Heart" taps into mankind's quest for intimacy and emotions that we all struggle with.

          Upon completion of recording, mixing, and producing "Solitary Heart" at Imirage Sound Lab, music producer Tom Gordon suggested that Valentino should release the single with a music video... And referred him to Cameron Paris of Firebolt Media. And so Vinnie Valentino set out to embark on making his very first music video!
         From their first meeting onward Cameron Paris had a vision for the song and suggested that they should go out on location to a remote stretch of highway known as {The Loneliest Road in America} HIGHWAY 50. And then began developing the idea of Vinnie walking along the long lonely highway, with no one to talk to, except for the billboards above.
         According to Mr. Valentino, "Making Solitary Heart (Official Music Video) was an adventure in my life, and I'm looking forward to filming more videos."
 

PERKS

        I have some great rewards for my backers (partners.) Starting now, you can pre-order a Digital Download of Radio Acoustica for $15.00. In addition, there are other incentives you can participate in as well. These items include a Compact Disk, Vintage Vinyl Record, and a Limited Edition T-Shirt. The T-Shirts for my Albums release are a very unique and stylish line of... Bella+Canvas 3650 - Unisex Cotton/Polyester Black Acid-Washed Graphic T-Shirt with Custom Radio Acoustica Logo and Artist Web Address. The run of sizes are 30 (XS)  50 (S)   75 (M)   100 (L)   100 (XL)   50 (2XL)  •   Total = 405 T-Shirts

               Black Acid-Washed Graphic T-Shirt with Custom Radio Acoustica Logo

My backers have the option of choosing an individual item or get a Kit & Kaboodle Bundle which includes one of each of these Perks. I also have a series of Signed Items and a Double Set of Signed Items I call the Double Kaboodle Bundle. You can be named on the Liner Notes or become an Executive Producer for an [Individual Song], or an Executive Producer for the [Entire Album] of Radio Acoustica... For those investors who believe that this project has the potential to be a HIT RECORD someday. I sincerely believe that it "does" have the "Right Stuff!" 

        Any or all these options will go a long way towards helping me get this collection of great music produced. Alongside my rewards, I've also placed a variety of donation boxes for those who are interested in contributing to this project with "no strings attached." All of my backers (partners) will be named in the Liner Notes of this Album unless specifically requested not to... And wish to remain anonymous.

        Signed Radio Acoustica • Executive Producer Print: 20"x 30" (Framed & Matted)

Working around the COVID 19 Limitations>>>

           This first song’s popularity proved to be a great way to start the album. However, in March of this year, production on this album was forced to a halt due to the COVID-19 pandemic! Since I am an independent artist, I rely on my live performances to fund my studio costs... And like many other businesses, my music career has been temporarily closed! But I am extremely optimistic and am looking forward to this pandemic lifting soon. But in the meantime, I am searching for a way to work around the COVID-19 limitations! 

Risks & Challenges

I really don't foresee any risks or challenges, in launching this campaign... And I am very enthusiastic and optimistic about the possibilities of this amazing platform! After a lot of consideration, I've come to the conclusion that I have absolutely nothing to lose by launching this campaign...This is a Flexible Goal, so anything you can spare will be greatly appreciated! And will get me closer to making Radio Acoustica a Reality!

 

I want to thank you for your time... Much Love, God Bless and Stay Well...
