I was very impressed with his marketing connections, and I am very much looking forward to working with him again on up-coming Music Videos for Radio Acoustica.

           Steve Baker has promoted over 350 music videos from Independent Country and Americana artists over the past 20 years from artists like Dolly Parton, Kevin Costner, The Grascals, Charley Pride, The Bellamy Brothers, Andy Frasier (from the '60's group Free), American Idol finalist Michael Sarver, The Nickel Slots, Tommy Steele Band, Stephanie Urbina Jones, Hillbilly Vegas, Southern Halo, Tyler Steel, The Soul Circus Cowboys, and many others.

 
On-Line {‌{‌{LISTENING•PARTY}‌}‌}
            I can't express in words just how much I appreciate your support, and I would love for you to be a partner with me in this project. I feel extremely fortunate that I can show my backers what they are investing in, by offering an On-Line Listening Party... Please check out the 5 Tracks that are completed! "Solitary Heart" is the only track that has been officially released! And is available on many popular streaming platforms, such as Spotify, Apple Music, Amazon, Deezer, Google Play, and iHeartRadio. The other tracks on the website are for streaming only and will be officially released when Radio Acoustica is finished. With the exception of "Believe."  Which is to be the 2nd Single on the album to be released! The Official Music Video for "Believe" was postponed in April 2020 due to the COVID 19 lockdown! Since then, it has been resumed and is in mid-production now... And will be released in December 2020 or early January 2021 along with the Single. The link to my unreleased tracks is available as my {Campaign Listening Party!} And cannot be downloaded! Please listen on my Artist Website at 

www.vinnievalentinomusic.com

 
MOVING FORWARD>>>
           Moving forward with Radio Acoustica includes getting my music out to radio. My next objective is to distribute the single "Solitary Heart" to CDX Nashville! And enter Nashville Radio through Mainstream Country Music TrAction. CDX Nashville’s clients include a ‘who’s who’ of Country Music artists: all the greats from George Strait, Garth Brooks, Carrie Underwood, Blake Shelton, Miranda Lambert, and many more over a 28-year history. Artists who started as indies and have gone on to major success who began with CDX include Florida Georgia Line, Luke Combs, Mitchell Tenpenny, and Kelsea Ballerini.
https://www.cdxcd.com/about-cdx/          
        
InDemand Stretch-Goal>>>$9,600
           If I have the good fortune of reaching my goal and be blessed with the opportunity to be part of the InDemand Status...  I will produce 2 more Songs for the Album as "InDemand Tracks." This will make Radio Acoustica a 12 song Collection. For me, the average cost of producing, recording, and mixing (1 song) in the Studio is about $600...  I will need to raise at least another $1,200 above my Campaign Goal to accomplish this. I have the material written and arranged to make this happen, but we'll see if funds allow me to make this change. 
         And to enter Nashville Radio through Mainstream Country Music TrAction... I will need another $1,400 for The Mainstream Country Distribution Full Service Package! Setting my Stretch-Goal at $9,600.
 
https://cdbaby.com/
          Since half of this album is already completed, I do have a really good idea of how much money I will need to finish it! With special allowances for mastering the entire project, producing the first run of CDs, Vintage Vinyl Records, Limited Edition T-Shirts, Music Distribution through CD Baby, and Licensing/Publishing through BMI.
https://www.bmi.com/
        Any funds that go over my funding goal of $7,000 will be used for the following... CDX Nashville’s Distribution, Music Video Production, Music Production, Music Video Promotion, Marketing, and will also be used to produce the 2 new additional Songs "InDemand Tracks."
 
"Solitary Heart"
The inspiration behind solitary heartfelt lyrics...
            The former frontman of a popular local band in Reno, NV. called TWENTY4SEVEN; Vinnie Valentino has had his fair share of life challenges and has had to work through setbacks on this journey. The inspiration behind "Solitary Heart" is a paradox of two different types of loneliness. "Solitary Heart" captures the individuals' search for social acceptance and the quest for finding a complementary soulmate. Several years of in-activity in musical endeavors and being single had ultimately left the singer lost and lonely. The song takes the listener on a journey to try to answer common questions of how some are lucky in love, while others are left behind. And what hope is there for the lonely to find love? "Solitary Heart" taps into mankind's quest for intimacy and emotions that we all struggle with.

          Upon completion of recording, mixing, and producing "Solitary Heart" at Imirage Sound Lab, music producer Tom Gordon suggested that Valentino should release the single with a music video... And referred him to Cameron Paris of Firebolt Media. And so Vinnie Valentino set out to embark on making his very first music video!         From their first meeting onward Cameron Paris had a vision for the song and suggested that they should go out on location to a remote stretch of highway known as {The Loneliest Road in America} HIGHWAY 50. And then began developing the idea of Vinnie walking along the long lonely highway, with no one to talk to, except for the billboards above.         According to Mr. Valentino, "Making Solitary Heart (Official Music Video) was an adventure in my life, and I'm looking forward to filming more videos."

 

PERKS
        I have some great rewards for my backers (partners.) Starting now, you can pre-order a Digital Download of Radio Acoustica for $15.00. In addition, there are other incentives you can participate in as well. These items include a Compact Disk, Vintage Vinyl Record, and a Limited Edition T-Shirt. The T-Shirts for my Albums release are a very unique and stylish line of... Bella+Canvas 3650 - Unisex Cotton/Polyester Black Acid-Washed Graphic T-Shirt with Custom Radio Acoustica Logo and Artist Web Address. The run of sizes are 30 (XS)  50 (S)   75 (M)   100 (L)   100 (XL)   50 (2XL)  •   Total = 405 T-Shirts




               Black Acid-Washed Graphic T-Shirt with Custom Radio Acoustica Logo
My backers have the option of choosing an individual item or get a Kit & Kaboodle Bundle which includes one of each of these Perks. I also have a series of Signed Items and a Double Set of Signed Items I call the Double Kaboodle Bundle. You can be named on the Liner Notes or become an Executive Producer for an [Individual Song], or an Executive Producer for the [Entire Album] of Radio Acoustica... For those investors who believe that this project has the potential to be a HIT RECORD someday. I sincerely believe that it "does" have the "Right Stuff!" 
        Any or all these options will go a long way towards helping me get this collection of great music produced. Alongside my rewards, I've also placed a variety of donation boxes for those who are interested in contributing to this project with "no strings attached." All of my backers (partners) will be named in the Liner Notes of this Album unless specifically requested not to... And wish to remain anonymous.



        Signed Radio Acoustica • Executive Producer Print: 20"x 30" (Framed & Matted)
Working around the COVID 19 Limitations>>>
           This first song’s popularity proved to be a great way to start the album. However, in March of this year, production on this album was forced to a halt due to the COVID-19 pandemic! Since I am an independent artist, I rely on my live performances to fund my studio costs... And like many other businesses, my music career has been temporarily closed! But I am extremely optimistic and am looking forward to this pandemic lifting soon. But in the meantime, I am searching for a way to work around the COVID-19 limitations! 
Risks & Challenges
I really don't foresee any risks or challenges, in launching this campaign... And I am very enthusiastic and optimistic about the possibilities of this amazing platform! After a lot of consideration, I've come to the conclusion that I have absolutely nothing to lose by launching this campaign...This is a Flexible Goal, so anything you can spare will be greatly appreciated! And will get me closer to making Radio Acoustica a Reality!
 
I want to thank you for your time... Much Love, God Bless and Stay Well...

story:
Who Are We?

So let's cut to the chase:

  • We're a three piece rock band that's been together since 2014
  • Since that time, we've NEVER done any fundraising like this
  • Every Music Video, Photoshoot, Studio Recording Session, Album release, EP release, Single release, Merch release, Car ride to gigs, etc - has ALL been paid for out of our back pockets
  • We worked out that we've spent a minimum of £15,000 over the years in creating this band from the ground up and have only ever asked people to listen to songs which we are proud of

Now we've reached that creative peak, but our finances are depleting rapidly - which is why we wholeheartedly turn to you beautiful people!

What We Need

It's as simple as this:

  • We need a minimum of £500 and a maximum of £1,000 (anymore than that is just greed!)
  • Any amount within that bracket will pay for the duplication costs of the new album we've finished, will give us the proper packaging this album deserves, from the lyrics booklets, to innovative art design for the front cover, back cover, CD disc design, Vinyl design, etc!
  • Should we fail to reach the minimum target in time, then the money that we receive will simply go towards the final cost and we will cover what's needed! :) 

What's In This For You?

The main reason why we've never asked for donations for all our previous projects is because we never had any 'perks' to offer at that time, whereas now we do! So each donation has a reward, such as:

  • Having a part in one of our Music Videos which will be on VEVO!
  • Getting your name credited in our Album Liner Notes (both on CD, Vinyl & social media)!
  • Receiving a FREE copy of the New Album in a format of your choice!
  • Being added to our VIP Lists for future gigs (announced ones and ones in the works!)
  • First class delivery of Original Lyrics Sheets, signed by all three of us with personalised messages of your choice!
  • Spend a day with 2OS in either a Live Session, Studio Session or Jamming with us!
  • Coming up with the title of a future 2OS song!
  • ONE OFF - Signed by all three of us - 18" Sabian Crash Symbol which was been used on ALL our Recordings to date!
  • FREE Signed Copy of our debut album 'Ascended From Colours'!
  • Have us write a Song JUST FOR YOU!

Risks & Challenges

Another major reason why we are struggling to fund this ourselves is because of the giant Covid elephant in the room, it's unavoidable, we understand that EVERYBODY has been affected by the Pandemic, not just physically but financially too. We will never turn away from the fact that asking for donations in today's world is like asking for a Covid-free world - it just isn't easy, we totally respect that. However, if just 100 people out of the 65 million UK Citizens donated a fiver each towards this campaign, then it's job done! 

  • We put money where our mouth is - so by helping us out, we help you in return. Your hard earned money will be met with a reward, consider it a guaranteed investment or a simple purchase. You're paying for something that nobody else can buy when the campaign is over, think of it like that!
  • As time goes on and each day provides us all with new challenges, we will continue to adapt to each of them every single day! You worried about posting issues? Done. We will set up the best delivery system with tracking numbers and guaranteed delivery charges on top of it... You worried about not being able to travel? Done. We will accommodate any traveller as soon as it is safe to do so, providing the best for your buck and covering the costs! We got you!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Money isn't the only way you can contribute towards this campaign, spread the word!
  • Every social media share or word of mouth mention increases the likelihood and reality of more people donating and receiving their rewards and helping us get over the finish line!

And that's all there is to it. We love you and we thank you for taking the time to read this! We now leave in your hands, don't drop us! - Aaron, Tommy & Grant xxx

story:
Hello! I have been writing music for many years, and over the last 10 years I have created a number of songs that are dear to my heart. It feels like the right time to share them, and so I would like to record an album of sweet spiritual folk music. My intention with recording these songs is to inspire others to live more fully from their hearts, and to see the magic that is all around us! 

I have estimated that I will need a few thousand dollars to make a good quality recording of my songs with beautiful instrumental accompaniment.  The money will go towards time in a recording studio, and/or the appropriate equipment to record it myself.  Anyone who makes a donation will receive a digital download of the final product.  The songs that I've uploaded here are a rough demo of 4 of the 10 songs I have ready for recording....Thank you for listening, and may these songs inspire in you joy, happiness, and the remembrance of our Oneness.

story:
Hi Friends and Internet Neighbors, 

My name is Patrick von Wiegandt and I'm here to do a little digital begging for money to record my new CD - called SWANKY AT ABBEY ROAD (yes, that Abbey Road....Studio 2.... "The Beatles Room." !!!! )  I've never done this so it's a bit strange for me - but since I'm here, I'll go for it.

My goal is to raise $15,000 to record this new CD. It's the 3rd in a series called SWANKY. The first was recorded with 23 time Grammy Winner Al Schmitt at Capitol Studios in Hollywood…..and multiple Grammy winner musician Bill Champlin and a host of the best studio musicians in Hollywood and Honolulu.

I’ll be working with some of the best studio musicians in London on the basic tracks and overdubs and then finish the CD in Los Angeles and Honolulu with the terrific musicians who played on the first 2 Swanky CDs.

A Little Background About the Swanky Series

The Swanky series is inspired by music of the 1920’s to 40’s - The Jazz Age -  and include some of the most elegant and sophisticated songs ever written. Composers such as Cole Porter, Irving Berlin, Rogers and Hart and so many more created a style that has remained timeless. There were also many wonderful character type songs crafted then and many tunes from what is called The Great American Songbook. I think the word "Swanky" really captures the mood and elegance of that era. 

 I've loved this music my whole life, thanks to my parents and their friends who played it and taught it to us as we were rocking and rolling (and The Beatles also included some of these songs and styles in their records.)  I've also been inspired by many of my friends and contemporary musicians who love and perform this music – so it’s been a fun journey to share it with them too. We have a lot of fun making these records in a contemporary style while honoring the originals.

Playing for Seniors

It’s especially gratifying to play this music for the older generations, who were the ones who brought it to us in the first place. When we play these songs it’s nice to hear the older clan talk about their first memories of the tunes. My mother was very happy to hear me play these pieces since she and my dad had played them to us as we were growing up - and she would get my brothers and sisters in a tizzy when she would play old songs, ragtime and especially the song Darktown Strutters Ball.

So....Why ABBEY ROAD – LONDON ?


Whaddya kidding me or something ?  My entire life has been spent listening to music from this studio. It’s the most famous studio in the world and that also means it’s among the very best.  To record where George Martin took the Beatles – and changed the world is very exciting and pretty daunting… ok…. intimidating.  But, it’s also such a boost to work in rooms where your heroes have made classic records. 

Having lived and worked in recording studios for the past 40 years - with some of the best recording artists, producers and engineers, there’s a special aura or magic that happens when you enter a great studio.  When we walked down the hallway into Capitol Studio 1 to make

SWANKY 1 - the hallway was filled with the iconic photos of Sinatra, Ella, Dean Martin, Bobby Darin, Nat King Cole, the Beach Boys, Beatles – you get filled with awe and get both inspired and intimidated.  You want that magic to rub off – and you want to make your record as special as what you’ve heard from those studios.  It’s a thrill and a challenge. I think we pulled it off with SWANKY 1 and 2. Now we have the chance to work with some terrific players in London who also know and love the music we have been playing. It should be a hoot.   You can hear clips from the first 2 SWANKY CDS in the links below to get the idea. SWANKY 1 - TRAILER     SWANKY 2 - TEASER

What’s In It For You ? The Perks

Well, There’s a bunch of good swag to be had - look over there  >>>>>>>>>>      Not just good feelings and praises and fluff. You can get the entire Swanky Collection of CDS – A Swanky T shirt – A Swanky Derby for the Guys – or a Swanky Cloche Hat for the Ladies - A Thank You Credit on the CD – Co-Producer Credit - A Concert with me and my Swanky pals…..and, if you’d like to pony up some big British pounds – Executive Producer credit and a trip to the studio with us in London, Los Angeles or Hawaii. And, of course, you get bragging rights for sending me to London. That ought to warm your heart. Not sure if that will make you rich or happy – but it just might put a smile on your face when you are riding down the highway listening to this new Swanky CD in your car….. thinking….. I helped make this happen.

THE FLUFF……..The main perk, I’ve been told, of any of these fundraising campaigns, is to be part of the project and help it move forward. We’ve had success in bringing this music out of the closet so to speak – and it’s been fun to work and play with the musicians who really love this music and want it carried on. A lot of you have said very nice things to us about the songs and the way we present them -  and, you have come to see us perform, so I think we are on to something special. And..... we've been building the "Swanky" brand (for whatever that's worth.)

Now, Let's get crackin..... as they say over there.   

cheerio - and thanks,

Patrick von Wiegandt


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • If you like this project - please get the word out and tell your friends
  • If you don't like this project, you can tell people that you don't like.
  • And don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

thanks again

Lord Von Swank

story:
Welcome to the Launch of Solar Theory! 

Over the past 2 years we have been in the studio creating new music that combines ambient soundscapes, deep electronic grooves, ethereal vocals and spiritually conscious songwriting. This is truly progressive music that moves the soul, and has evolved from our consistent work in the sound healing arts and years of electronic music production.  Outside of the studio we have played festivals like Lightning in a Bottle, Burning Man, Lucidity, ShaktiFest, BhaktiFest West, Love Long Beach in addition to yoga studios, fundraisers and events all around California separately and as collaborators. We are just starting to take our work around the country and soon internationally.

Through Visual Reality collective of artists, we are developing meditative Virtual Reality experiences and 360 music videos, interactive sound healing experiences.  Visionary VJ artist, Michael Strauss is working with us to develop custom visual content for our live performances. We are pushing the boundaries of not only how music and sound is delivered, but how we can also harness new technologies to offer experiences that are therapeutic in nature, and bring humanity into a new realm of personal and social interaction.

Who are we?

Torkom Ji and Lynda Arnold (AKA Divasonic) are both LA Based sound healing & meditation facilitators/educators working tirelessly for many years to create experiences for healing, personal growth and transformation. At the same time, they are both involved in their own musical artistic growth with this collaboration being the most synergistic combination of Torkom’s electronic soundscapes and the ethereal melodicism of Lynda Arnold.  Both have a deep understanding of their craft and are motivated to create sounds for enjoyment as well as for healing purpose.  We are honored to work with visual wizard Michael Strauss on developing custom video content for our live performances and more.

Our Soul’s Mission

We want to continue our work in the community and fuel our soul’s purpose with the expression of our art. This infinite cycle keeps us inspired and moving forward in all aspects of our artistic and professional work. We want to have you all along for the ride. Your support means the world to us!

 

Here are some of the Items needed to be Covered by your Generous Donations:

Solar Theory - Race the Sun Album

We have almost finished our first intergalactic electronic record ‘Race The Sun’ and can’t wait to share it with you.  We have a wonderful community of like-minded artists we are working with to bring our visions into reality. It’s very important for us to keep the work of our community alive as we push boundaries, strive and grow together!

The funds we are raising will go towards the following items needed for the completion and release of this record:

*Recording, mixing and mastering costs

*Studio equipment and instruments needed for completion of record and live show

*CD Manufacturing

*Social Marketing and Delivery

*Graphic and Web Design

*Video production and Visual Development for Live Performance with Michael Strauss

*Photography

*Travel expenses

Many of these costs have already come out of our pocket to keep the project moving along and now, in this last phase we are requesting our fans to help us make the final push!

 

Help Us Record a Language of Light Record 

 

 

We are very motivated. If we reach our goal, we will be going into the studio and recording an ambient sound meditation record.  We felt that a sound meditation album focused entirely on the important therapeutic work we do every week with groups and clients was an important step in reaching more people around the world. The sound meditation offering of Solar Theory is called Language of Light.

For this project, we intend to record at a professional studio to analog tape, performing the entire transmission in one take with minimal instrumental overdubs. This recording will be meant for all kinds of therapeutic sound applications and represents years of testing, development, careful design and pure intention from both facilitators.

This record will be a high quality digital download and be available to everyone who pledges at the $60 level and above!

 

Join our Growing Community!

Check out our offerings and get involved to help us manifest the launch of Solar Theory.  As our process moves along, we will be sharing updates and videos via FB. We are available to you as sound healing facilitators, educators, practitioners and performers.  Now is the time to jump on board and become part of the conversation. The world of sound healing and transformative music meditation is an exciting field full of spiritual growth and infinite potential!
story_txt: Welcome to the Launch of Solar Theory!  Over the past 2 years we have been in the studio creating new music that combines ambient soundscapes, deep electronic grooves, ethereal vocals and spiritually conscious songwriting. This is truly progressive music that moves the soul, and has evolved from our consistent work in the sound healing arts and years of electronic music production.  Outside of the studio we have played festivals like Lightning in a Bottle, Burning Man, Lucidity, ShaktiFest, BhaktiFest West, Love Long Beach in addition to yoga studios, fundraisers and events all around California separately and as collaborators. We are just starting to take our work around the country and soon internationally.Through Visual Reality collective of artists, we are developing meditative Virtual Reality experiences and 360 music videos, interactive sound healing experiences.  Visionary VJ artist, Michael Strauss is working with us to develop custom visual content for our live performances. We are pushing the boundaries of not only how music and sound is delivered, but how we can also harness new technologies to offer experiences that are therapeutic in nature, and bring humanity into a new realm of personal and social interaction.Who are we?Torkom Ji and Lynda Arnold (AKA Divasonic) are both LA Based sound healing & meditation facilitators/educators working tirelessly for many years to create experiences for healing, personal growth and transformation. At the same time, they are both involved in their own musical artistic growth with this collaboration being the most synergistic combination of Torkom’s electronic soundscapes and the ethereal melodicism of Lynda Arnold.  Both have a deep understanding of their craft and are motivated to create sounds for enjoyment as well as for healing purpose.  We are honored to work with visual wizard Michael Strauss on developing custom video content for our live performances and more.Our Soul’s MissionWe want to continue our work in the community and fuel our soul’s purpose with the expression of our art. story:
“If you have failed and fallen as I have

And long to be forgiven

Walk out under the graphite sky”

~ by Dorothy Trogdon, from the poem ‘Under The Graphite Sky’

 

About This Project

Hello, my name is Sam Genders. I have been a musician since I was 15 and I've toured the world and played festivals such as Glastonbury, Latitude, Green Man, Haldern Pop and Iceland Airwaves with my various bands Tunng, The Accidental, Diagrams and Throws.  Independent record label Full Time Hobby has released six of my albums, my songs have had regular airplay on BBC 6 Music, Xfm and more, and my previous band Tunng was once nominated in the UK BBC 2 Folk Awards for 'Best Group'.

The last couple of years have taken me on an amazing journey during which I met an incredibly talented 90-year-old poet named Dorothy Trogdon, wrote an entire album’s worth of songs with her and then recorded that album with some of my all time favourite producers and musicians.

I’ve created this campaign to fulfil a life-long dream of setting up my own home-based record label so that I can self-release the album out into the world. Your generous contributions will make all of this possible:

~ designing beautiful artwork for the album
~ mastering and manufacturing the CDs and vinyl
~ making downloads available
~ distributing the album to record shops all over the world
~ promoting the album in all the right places to reach as many listeners as possible

Thank you in advance for your support!

You can listen to the first single 'It's Only Light' from the album here: https://soundcloud.com/ideas-and-sketches/its-only-light-by-diagrams

Here's an album teaser: https://youtu.be/Otgfw2AsLOc

And here's 'Under the Graphite Sky' played live as a stripped down session for legendary radio presenter Bob Harris:

 

The story so far...

This project has felt special to me from the very first time I read one of Dorothy’s poems and found myself turning it into a song in my mind. That poem was called ‘Mnemosyne’ and I loved its combination of mythological and scientific imagery along with a rich sense of human vulnerability and the precious nature of our minds, memories and fleeting lives.

I felt like a nervous kid when I emailed Dorothy to ask if she might help me write some songs and so excited when she agreed. Later on I was encouraged by how inspired people were by her involvement and I was enthused by their willingness to get involved and help make the album a reality.

Producers Mike Lindsay (Tunng, Farao, Low Roar, Speech Debelle) and Kristofer Harris (Smoke Fairies, Storybooks) offered their time, as did some brilliant instrumentalists  - brass player Sam Ewens and violinist Danyal Dhondy as well as drummer Rob Wilks and singers Astra Forward and Tim Barr.

I even had a reply to a shot in the dark email I sent to world-renowned multi-instrumentalist / composer / arranger Kelly Pratt (Arcade Fire, St Vincent, David Byrne, Beirut) who agreed to record arrangements for the album.

My friend Marion, who first gave me Dorothy’s book and started this amazing journey, visited Dorothy where she lives on Orcas Island outside of Seattle, Washington State, and took my old dictaphone with her to make field recordings.

The icing on the cake was being awarded a £2,500 grant by the PRS for Music Foundation, which when added to my own savings meant I had enough to start making the album.

Towards the end of the recording process I had the privilege of visiting Dorothy for the first time.  It was wonderful to meet her and spending time there gave me a real connection to the field recordings that appear on the record, such as the soft buzz of hummingbirds that feed throughout the day by Dorothy’s back door in view of the sea and nearby woodland.

This album exists because of the enthusiasm of the amazing and creative people involved.  We’re all really happy with the finished result and we think people will love the record.

 

Our team and who we are...

My wife Sofia and I will be running this very exciting campaign from our house in Sheffield, England with a small team of friends. As you already know, I’m a musician and songwriter who has released 6 albums and toured many places around the world with the bands Tunng, The Accidental, Throws and Diagrams. I also work as a songwriter for other artists such as Liam Bailey, Ben Ottewell and more, and I run songwriting courses and teach kids guitar in primary schools.

Music, words, ideas and compassion are what most inspire me. I love science and nature.

Sofia co-founded the amazing End of the Road Festival which is held in the Dorset countryside in England each September. Her organisational skills, attention to detail and positivity are a big part of the reason the festival became so successful and she’ll be helping me run the campaign properly without me getting sidetracked by my childishly enthusiastic and sometimes confusingly random creative brain.

We have a great team of musician friends, colleagues and collaborators who are supporting this project. Thank you so much Marion McLaren, Mike Lindsay, Kristofer Harris, Kelly Pratt, Rob Wilks, Sam Ewens, Danyal Dhondy, Astra Forward, Tim Barr, Sophie Jane Mortimer, Leon Lockley, Matt Bagguley, Zoe Genders, Kate Hewett, Howard Monk, Suzie Kemner, Ian Smith, Jennifer Madeley, Tamara Gal-On, Ben Charles, Jess Roberts, Helen Mort, Niki Stevens, Guy Whittaker, Leonie Sloots, Sara Hill, Heather Hull, Mike Hull, Becky Matthews, Matt Austin, Rachel Mepsted, Jane Aspeling, Katy Blott, Lucy Jamieson, Orlando Seale and Paddy Fairlamb.

We also have a great team of music industry professionals who are on stand-by to support us with the actual album release as soon as we reach our goal, including David at Key Production, Mark at Republic of Music Distribution, Jesse Treece on artwork, James of Viaduct Promotions, Will of In House Press, Liv and Genevieve at One Beat PR, Brendan at Canvas Media PR (US), Jan at Affairs of the Heart (Germany), Justine at Boogie PR (France) and more.

 

What your contribution will fund

  • Mastering of the album - £1,000
  • Manufacturing of CDs, vinyl and promo copies - £3,500
  • Artwork + layout for manufacturing purposes - £1,500
  • Record label set-up, admin, accountant and AIM membership - £1,100
  • UK print and online press + radio for the album release campaign - £5,800
  • US + mainland Europe press + radio for the album release campaign - £7,500
  • Crowdfunding campaign mgmt/support + Facebook advertising - £1,100
  • Postage & packaging for sending out albums - £2,500
  • Contingency - £500
  • Indiegogo commission + credit card fees - £2,500

Total: £27,000

 

Timeline - this is how we will make our goal a reality  

November 2016
Launch first single to press & radio + deliver download of single to all contributors

December 2016
Set up record label + master the album

January 2017
Create all artwork & files for the manufacturing process + set up distribution

February 2017
Release second single to press & radio + order the CD & vinyl manufacturing

March 2017
Receive all CDs and vinyl + sign and write personal messages

April 2017
Deliver online webinar + send out all albums (incl. download) before public release

May 2017
Release the album into the world!  AND  Have the best THANK YOU PARTY ever!

 

How YOU can be a part of this

By supporting this project you’ll be making it possible for this music to go out into the world, professionally mastered with beautiful art and design.

You’ll be promoting a creatively driven project that major commercial record labels might not choose to support and you’ll be supporting Dorothy and myself in our work as writers. Dorothy’s words are intelligent, tender and thought provoking and it’s been a privilege to work with somebody with such talent and rich life experience.

I hope you’ll join us in our creative adventure and make this album release a reality:

Contribute - Each and every contribution is deeply appreciated and takes us closer to achieving our goal. No amount is too small!
Share - Every single share on social media takes us one step closer to our goal. Every person you tell about it! Every mailout to a mailing list in which The Dorothy Project is mentioned makes it more and more likely that this will happen.
Invite - Invite 20 friends to be part of this adventure on our Facebook event page. If every person who heard about this project went on to tell two other people we’d reach our goal today! Thank you :)

 

Your Perks

All perks will include a copy of the first single that will be yours to download TODAY!  We’re also offering signed copies of the album on CD or vinyl, and opportunities to connect more closely with me through my online talks, one-to-one Skype sessions and songwriting courses. And maybe we’ll have the pleasure of your delightful company at our ‘Thank You Party’?

A project like this succeeds because of the belief and support of generous people like you. If we can make this dream a reality - as we believe we can - it will be because of your decision to help make this project happen.

We would like to say a huge thank you for every contribution, every share and invite and every ounce of goodwill that you decide to offer. Every single contribution helps - no matter what size it is.
If you do get involved and if our paths cross sometime in the future, maybe at a festival, concert or reading, please come and say hello so we can shake your hand and say a personal thank you.

There is so much goodwill around this project and we’d love you to be a part of this creative adventure with us. Thank you.

With gratitude,
Sam (Diagrams)

story:
Hello, My name is Laurie Amat.

I am a resident artist and musician based in Providence at AS220, a nationally renowned unjuried, uncensored creative space and artist community. I was a producer and performer for the first international artist exchange between San Francisco and Czechoslovakia after the the Velvet Revolution. I was a long term collaborator with the late computer music pioneer Max Mathews at Stanford University. I have even sung in the monastery where Charlemagne's wife was exiled! 

I have been so fortunate as a vocalist, improviser, and composer to travel the world, collaborate, and share music with a diverse range of incredibly talented people. Now based in Rhode Island, I want to bring the national and international looping scene to Providence and showcase the brilliant pool of local looping talent. This festival is an opportunity to expand our reach through the Y2K community.

The annual Y2K International Live Looping Festival began in 2001 and is known as the premiere and longest running live looping festival. To this day, in our community, there is no style or genre of music associated with the movement. The only thing that links thousands of emerging and established live looping artists is a strong and supportive sense of community and a love for the concept of looping live in public.

We have done the work to create a huge network of supporters to help launch the festival. We have the blessing and support of the Y2K family. We are performing at AS220. We have integrated multiple local community organizations including AS220 Youth, Girls Rock, and the City of Providence to promote local artists and to produce free events. We’ll also have an amazing team of volunteers to help round out the staff we’ll need to make the festival happen.

Where's the Money Going?

We are raising money to launch the festival, support the artists' stay in our city, and provide each artist with new promotional photography and video which will support their careers.

Here's the breakdown:

  • Festival Costs employ a team to make the festival happen.
  • Promotions will help us advertise the festival and pay designers to develop and print amazing graphics and posters. 
  • AS220 rental fees will support the ongoing operations of this incredible Providence arts organization.
  • Indie GoGo gets a cut but YOU get some awesome rewards, too.
  • Did you notice that 50% goes to the performers? This will go directly to supporting their stay in Providence - food, transportation, housing, etc. 
Part of our philosophy is that artists shouldn't have to "pay to play." We have all been willing to play Y2K festivals at our own expense. PVDLoop would like to take the extra step of making sure that every other aspect of their participation is covered. We are hosting them. We want them to feel like guests in our city.

Who are you supporting?

You're supporting more than just performers - you're supporting the whole local community. Check it out:

Artists include not only performers but the technical staff, many of whom are also artists. The producers are artists. The photographers and videographers are bringing their talents together as artists. And we're also employing local designers. So really, when you think about it, more than 80% of the funding is supporting artists.

We mentioned that $1000 for AS220. It's so important that the venue makes money so that it can continue to subsidize and promote the development of new work. This money will directly support the Main Stage and the Black Box Theatre.

We're also getting the local food community involved. We're committed to supporting local businesses to help create a hospitality space with food, coffee, and other refreshments made right here. 

Risks & Challenges

The greatest risk is that we're unable to reach our goal. Realistically we need to raise as much as possible but, as you know in the art world, we're used to banding together to make it work. And we're hoping that we do well at the door. We're confident that we have the network and support of the local and international community to raise the funds and fill the venue. 

Other than that, we've built reward packages that are extremely accessible and low cost. When you back the project, you'll get amazing rewards and it won't cost us too much to deliver them to you.

We'll need time to sort out the printing and shipping of the physical rewards but the digital reward for anyone who backs us at $50 or more will get instant access to live streaming the entire festival. Our wickedly savvy Media Arts team will make sure your viewing will go smoothly and without interruption. You will be able to be right there with us - in spirit - a part of the audience. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Social media, list serves, Reddit, carrier pigeon, chain mail, office memos, whatever you kids are using these days to communicate...and we'll keep you updated and give you access to performers profiles, their links, videos, and audio files. 
You probably came to this campaign because you know a musician or a musician knows you like music. Pass it on to other people who like music.

Are you local? BUY A TICKET AND COME JOIN US! All tickets will be $10 a show. Throughout the day, you'll also get a chance to chat with the artists, buy their merch, and support AS220's The BAR and FOOd by buying some stuff to eat and drink. 

Your support is vital to the expansion of new music. Your contribution allows artists to take risks, create new sounds and sonic experiences, and become a part of a growing movement which is breaking new ground, festival by festival. 


Thank you, thank you. No, no really! Thank you.
Laurie Amat

We are hosting them. We want them to feel like guests in our city.

Who are you supporting?
You're supporting more than just performers - you're supporting the whole local community. Check it out:

Artists include not only performers but the technical staff, many of whom are also artists. The producers are artists. The photographers and videographers are bringing their talents together as artists. And we're also employing local designers. So really, when you think about it, more than 80% of the funding is supporting artists.
We mentioned that $1000 for AS220. It's so important that the venue makes money so that it can continue to subsidize and promote the development of new work. This money will directly support the Main Stage and the Black Box Theatre.
We're also getting the local food community involved. We're committed to supporting local businesses to help create a hospitality space with food, coffee, and other refreshments made right here. 


    Risks & Challenges The greatest risk is that we're unable to reach our goal. Realistically we need to raise as much as possible but, as you know in the art world, we're used to banding together to make it work. And we're hoping that we do well at the door. We're confident that we have the network and support of the local and international community to raise the funds and fill the venue. 
Other than that, we've built reward packages that are extremely accessible and low cost. When you back the project, you'll get amazing rewards and it won't cost us too much to deliver them to you.
We'll need time to sort out the printing and shipping of the physical rewards but the digital reward for anyone who backs us at $50 or more will get instant access to live streaming the entire festival. Our wickedly savvy Media Arts team will make sure your viewing will go smoothly and without interruption. You will be able to be right there with us - in spirit - a part of the audience.    Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word! Social media, list serves, Reddit, carrier pigeon, chain mail, office memos, whatever you kids are using these days to communicate...and we'll keep you updated and give you access to performers profiles, their links, videos, and audio files. 

You probably came to this campaign because you know a musician or a musician knows you like music. Pass it on to other people who like music.
 Are you local? BUY A TICKET AND COME JOIN US! All tickets will be $10 a show. Throughout the day, you'll also get a chance to chat with the artists, buy their merch, and support AS220's The BAR and FOOd by buying some stuff to eat and drink. 

Your support is vital to the expansion of new music. Your contribution allows artists to take risks, create new sounds and sonic experiences, and become a part of a growing movement which is breaking new ground, festival by festival. 

Thank you, thank you. No, no really! Thank you.Laurie Amat

story:
Project Overview

Hello there! My name is Avi Diamond. I am a singer-songwriter out of the Pittsburgh area, and I need your help to put out The Wolfmother EP. This new project is a stylistic departure from my previous album, Down the Drain, featuring songs that are influenced by Acoustic-Folk, Rock, and Bossa Nova. 

Shortly after releasing my first album, I moved upstate for a Music Therapy internship in the Catskill mountains. I experienced healing and renewal while living in a house in the woods and going on frequent adventures in my surroundings. This setting mixed with life experiences inspired me to write new music. 

If I reach my goal, I will have the resources to share music that will hopefully take you through an emotional journey. I wrote these songs during a time when I was starting to realize who I was beyond what other people wanted me to be. I hope that I can also inspire you to live genuinely.
 

Cost Breakdown

Since I now have the experience of successfully crowd-funding a similar project, I can anticipate bumps in the road that were unexpected in my first campaign and optimize your contributions.

  • Studio Recording Fees: $2,000
  • EP Distribution: $200
  • EP Artwork and Design: $500
  • Indiegogo Fee: $150

 

How You can Help

Contributions of any amount are greatly appreciated and will be acknowledged in my final project in the EP liner notes. Even just a couple of dollars will bring us closer to our goal and draw attention to the Campaign. 
You can also help by spreading the word. All it takes is a quick share on social media or mentioning it to a friend. :) 


Thank you so much for your love and support as we embark on this crowd-funding journey together again or for the first time! I am so excited to connect with all of you. 

 

Love,

Avi

story:
About The Whistling Dixie Graveyard Project

Music for the Resistance

Hi Folks, My name is Paul Metsa. I am a singer- songwriter born on the Mesabi Iron Range in Northeastern MN and have been living in Minneapolis since 1978. I am asking you to support a multi-leveled musical project of mine that I believe can provide a  powerful soundtrack for the progressive movement in America. You can learn more about me in the Huff Post by clicking here. 

I am making an appeal to you to fund my IndieGoGo campaign to support the operational costs of releasing 3 original CD's, 2 new singles called ' Ain't Gonna Whistle Dixie Anymore', and 1 remastered CD.  In the event that we have a surplus of funds, after meeting all project related expenses, we will donate the unused funds to organizations that work towards racial advancement. In an effort to be transparent we will notify all backers of this campaign of any surplus funds donated to charity. Net proceeds from my next music release 'Ain't Gonna Whistle Dixie Anymore' will benefit organizations that work for equality and racial advancement, via non profit record label Rock the Cause Records. 

If you would like to make a direct donation to this project that is tax deductible you may do say at http://irockthecause.org/donate-now    

My new song "Ain’t Gonna Whistle Dixie Anymore" was inspired by an article in Esquire.com by Charles Pierce after the tragic march in Charlottesville Virginia on August 12th of 2017 that took the life of American Patriot Heather Heyer and two state troopers. The chorus goes, "Bury that song in the land of Cotton, deep in the Delta Mud to be long forgotten, I Aint’ Gonna Whistle Dixie Anymore". The song honors not only  Heather Heyer, but also pays tribute to the over  million soldiers, between the Civil War and WW2, who gave their lives fighting slavery and fascism. It is a call to action to continue the great civil rights work of the 1950's and 1960's. My song protests the injustices and inequality that people of color, women, and the LGBQT community live with daily! It also calls out the Alt right for what they are, Un American! I Ain’t Gonna Whistle Dixie Anymore, I believe, could be the new anthem for the resistance.

The song features legendary soul singer Wee Willie Walker, who recorded his first single I’m a Lucky Loser in 1967 with a young guitar player named Duane Allman, and 3 time Grammy Award winners The Sounds of Blackness. We are also working on a hip hop version of the tune as well with High School for Recording Arts (HSRA). Hip-Hop education professionals across the nation have praised the collaboration with HSRA as a new model for teaching young people American History and about Civil Rights.

The Lyrics to 'I Ain't Going to Whistle Dixie Anymore' are below. 

I saw your Tiki Torch parade on the blood red evening news,

I remembered Timothy McVeigh and that Jesus was a Jew,

Benedict Arnold waits for you in the hottest place in Hell,

The screaming souls will drown you out-your Seig Heil Rebel Yell

Chorus

Ain’t Gonna Whistle Dixie Anymore, ain’t gonna whistle Dixie anymore

Bury that song in the land of cotton, deep in the Delta mud to be long forgotten

Ain’t Gonna Whistle Dixie Anymore

2nd Verse:

Fallen soldiers that were left behind, we salute on wounded knee

Sacrifice of the highest kind, from Gettysburg to Normandy

Burn your crosses, mask your face, sing the Appomattox Blues

Woody Guthrie told us long ago, fascists are bound to lose, fascists born and bound to lose

Repeat Chorus

Charlottesville Virginia, August 12th of ‘17

Emancipation Park and Dixie flags flew across the village green

4 wheels of hate on 4th street raced where Heather Heyer died

Now her Blue Ridge Mountain Angel voice forever magnified, forever magnified

Paul Metsa 2017 All Rights Reserved

I also want to release a remastered 25th Anniversary re-release of my 1993 album Whistling Past the Graveyard, including bonus tracks.  Bucky Baxter was in town playing with Bob Dylan in 1992, a cab driver told him he might want to check me out at a weekly gig of mine, and after listening to a set offered to do a demo for me at his studio in Nashville that he owned with Garry Tallent, long time bass player in Bruce Springsteens E Street Band. The first 4 songs went so well, we recorded another 4 and released it in 1993.  All songs feature Bucky and Garry and also  George Marinelli, Bonnie Raitt’s  longtime guitarist. It features 4 other politically charged and radio ready songs that are as timely today as when they were written.  

One song,Slow Justice features the line, "And as the world goes around all I want to ask is, if the rich mans owns the land, why must the poor man pay the taxes?". The Mpls. Star Tribune called it the most “all-purpose protest tune since Blowin in the Wind.

You can hear some of these tunes, for free, on our Indie Go Go Page.

We Can Not Do It Alone 

I am working with the internationally acclaimed nonprofit record label Rock the Cause Records to help me make this project available to the world. Over the past decade Rock the Cause has sold over 500,000 charitable music singles, close to 60,000 digital albums and CD's, and their releases have been streamed over 30 Million times. All of this has added up to Rock the Cause being able to direct close to $750,00 in revenues from the sale of their music releases to charitable causes like children's health, education, and human rights organizations. I know I have the right partner to get the job done.  

In order to get the job done and make the impact we want to make this project needs funding. The record label will administrate the funds. We need you to help fund this project!

Here is how your funding for this project will be spent:

Goal: $15, 000

Musicians: $1,500

Studio: $1,500

Video: $2,500

CD production w/ artwork $2,500

Final Mastering and Remastering - $2500

Marketing (Radio, Social Media, Publicist, other employee expense) $3000

Other operation expenses (Materials, Fulfillment, Accounting and other project related expenses .) $2500

In the event that we have a surplus of funds, after meeting all project related expenses, we will donate the unused funds to organizations that work towards racial advancement. In an effort to be transparent we will notify all backers of this campaign of any surplus funds donated to charity.     

What Do You Get For Funding This Project?   

In addition to participating in the making of a cultural breakthrough in music, you also get some pretty awesome premiums and incentives for funding our project!

Premiums: Blue Guitar Highway book- $30, Paper Tigers LP - $25, Paper Tigers CD $15, Judas Sang the Blues LP - $25,  Judas Sang the Blues- CD $20, Bundle (Paper Tigers LP and CD, Judas Sang the Blues LP and CD, Blue Guitar Highway Book - $150.) Paul Metsa solo private gig- $750, Paul Metsa – Willie Walker gig- $1,500 Original Metsa 3 minute tune- $1,000 and many other exciting perks! 

The Impact Of Funding the Project

I LIKE TO THINK my songs are bullets of love in the machine gun of peace. I want to put these tunes into the political pipeline, have them blast forth from the radio, and let them be shared and sung by all those in the progressive and resistance movement. Like Pete Seeger said, A GOOD SONG REMINDS US WHAT WE ARE FIGHTING FOR.

As I mentioned previously, Rock the Cause Records will be releasing both versions of 'I Aint Going to Whistle Anymore' worldwide on August 8, 2018, distributed by Sony.  'Ain't Gonna Whistle Dixie Anymore' will be available on all digital service platforms i.e. iTunes, Spotify, Amazon, Google etc. 50% of all net proceeds from the digital revenues  of 'Ain't Gonna to Whistle Dixie Anymore' will be donated to organizations that work towards racial advancement TBA. The remaining digital revenues will be split between the songwriters - we have additional songwriters on the Hip-hop version that I will also get songwriting credit.      

My ultimate goal is to create a "lightning in a bottle" musical response to those who want us to go backwards, slipping into the darkness of hate, poverty, and social injustice! 

With the right funding, in an age of unprecedented digital media, we can share the music far and wide. We can provide a daily soundtrack that empowers others to speak up and get involved in building communities that are free from racism, prejudice, ignorance, fear, poverty and hate. THAT IS THE ULTIMATE GOAL!

If we are unable to fund this campaign. We will push through. The few will carry the weight for the many. Please help us carry the weight.    

The Left owns the music. Now lets USE this music to help take our country back.   And remember, There is beauty in the struggle, and never let the bastards get you down. Thanks for your time and consideration.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about this project. Please share it! Let others know why you think it is worth supporting!  
  • Follow Paul Metsa and Rock the Cause on Twitter and Facebook. When the music is released you can share it and stream it on Spotify or Apple Music! Yes, we monetize the streams. Streaming is a way of donating!

Have a beautiful day. In Peace and Solidarity, Paul Metsa

story:
Je crois que chaque vie est sacrée, que chaque personne mérite d'être respectée que  chaque personne devrait pouvoir vivre sa vie sans se faire briser, cependant, je sais que ce n'est pas toujours le cas. C’est pourquoi je veux faire un album de musique pour aider celles et ceux qui ont été blessés. Je veux communiquer avec leurs coeurs en leur offrant un début de guérison. Pourquoi? Parce que je suis une chanteuse, une compositrice, une interprète et une survivante de viol. Les surplus de la campagne, une partie de l'argent des "perks" (récompenses), comme les profits des ventes de l'album iront à une organisation soutenant les victimes d'agression sexuelle, les CALACS.
 

I am a singer and a songwriter. I am a survivor of armed assault and rape, random acts that happened shortly after I gave birth to my first son. A time of great fragility in a woman's life.

◉ Je suis auteure, compositrice et interprète. Je suis survivante d'une agression à main armée et de viol, un acte criminel aléatoir  arrivé peu de temps après avoir donné naissance à mon premier fils.  Une période de grande fragilité dans la vie d'une femme.

For a long time, I tried to get by in life in silence.  Yet, the physical and psychological impacts the attack and rape had on me were massive. The lack of help deeply impaired me. Years later, PTSD and a severe depression struck.
◉ Pendant de nombreuses années, je me suis débrouillée dans la vie en silence.  Pourtant, les impacts physiques et psychologiques de cette attaque et du viol étaient plus qu'importants.  Le manque d'aide m'affectant encore plus.  Ce qui devait arriver, est arrivé.  Des années plus tard une dépression et un stress post-traumatique me frappaient de plein fouet.

I was broken and needed understanding and support.  Instead, I was stigmatized and abandonned with my own torments. I suffered tremendously.
◉ J'étais brisée et avais besoin d'amour et de soutien autour de moi.  À la place, on m'a stigmatisé et abandonnée avec mes tourments. J'ai énormément souffert.

Making the album goes beyond art-therapy. It is my own way to make a difference in the world of survivors. No one should live through revictimization like I did.  It is inhumane. 
◉ Mon projet d’album est plus que de l’art-thérapie.  C’est ma manière de faire une différence dans le monde des survivants et de leurs proches. Personne ne devrait vivre de la revictimisation comme je l'ai vécu. C'est inhnumain. 

I want to connect with victims and their families, give them comfort and offer them an avenue to begin healing.
◉Je souhaite donc établir un dialogue avec les victimes et leurs proches, les réconforter et leur proposer un début de guérison.

Why the name Hippocampus Project?
◉ Pourquoi nommer l'album « Le projet Hippocampe »?

While researching on the web about trauma, I discovered the work of Dr. Muriel Salmona, a psychiatrist and activist from France, investing her career for the cause of victims of sexual violence.
◉ Lors de mes recherches à propos des traumatismes, j'ai découvert les travaux de la docteure Muriel Salmona, psychiatre et militante française, qui consacre sa carrière à la cause des victimes de violences sexuelles.

I then learned about the existence of the hippocampus of the brain and its role in trauma and rape.   If the hippocampus allowed me to survive during the attacks,  it was now damaged and in part responsible for my PTSD.
◉ J'ai ainsi découvert l'existence de l'hippocampe du cerveau et de son rôle dans les traumatismes et le viol. Si l'hippocampe m'a permis de survivre pendant l'attaque, elle est maintenant endommagée et en partie responsable de mon stress post-traumatique.


Do you know that the shape of the hippocampus of the brain resembles one of the seahorse?
I didn't!
◉ Saviez-vous que la forme de l'hippocampe du cerveau ressemble à celle du cheval de mer?
Je ne le savais pas!

Then, I started to draw lines between the life of the seehorse and the life of survivors.
◉ J'ai ainsi commencé à tracer des lignes entre la vie de l'hippocampe et la vie des survivants.

My Metaphor was born.
◉ Ma métaphore venait de naître.



The cause is so dear to me that I have chosen to give all campaign's surplus and all profits from sales to the non profit organisation in Quebec that helps and supports rape victims, CALACS.
◉ La cause est si importante pour moi que j'ai décidé de faire le don de tous les excédents de la campagne et des profits des ventes à un organisme à but non lucratif venant en aide au victimes d'agressions sexuelles, CALACS.

Help me record the Hippocampus album, help me help others.  Let music be the media that will build bridges between victims and the rest of the world.
◉ Aidez-moi à enregistrer l'album Hippocampe, aidez-moi à aider les autres. Faisons ensemble que la musique puisse contribuer à créer des liens entre les victimes et le reste du monde.

Together we can make a difference.
◉ Ensemble, nous pouvons faire une différence.

What I Need & What You Get.
◉ Ce dont j'ai besoin et ce que vous obtenez.

The sums raised will be used to defray the costs of studio hours, production, mastering, graphic design and manufacturing of the album. Many other expenses will also be involved in the making of this album but with your help this project will see the day.
◉ Les sommes amassées serviront à défrayer les coûts de studio, la réalisation, le mastering, le graphisme, l'impression de l'album. Beaucoup d'autres dépenses seront aussi impliquées dans la réalisation de cet album mais grâce à vous, ce projet pourra voir le jour.

To reach my goal, I did put together really awesome perks, From simple downloads to house concerts!
◉ En contrepartie, vous aurez le choix entre diverses récompenses, au simple téléchargement jusqu'au concert de salon! 

What if I get more money?
◉ Qu'arrivera-til si les sommes receuillies dépassent l'objectif?

That's even better, it will be given directly to the non profit organisation which support and help victims of sexual assaults, CALACS. 
◉ Ce serait extraordiaire car cet argent sera remis aux CALACS, un organisme à but non lucratif qui soutient et aide les victimes d'agression sexuelle.

What if I don't reach my goal?
◉ Qu'arrivera-t-il si je n'atteinds pas mon objectif?

It won't stop me from moving forward and let you have your perks and profits from sales will still go to the non-profit organization surpporting sexual assault survivors.
◉ Cela ne m'empêchera pas de continuer d'avancer avec le projet, de vous donner vos récompenses comme de remettre les profits des ventes aux Calacs, organisme qui vient en aide aux survivantes et survivants de violences et agressions à caractère sexuel.

Why me?

  • I have a great team and that includes a renown coproducer and musician in Quebec, Jean-François Lemieux.  His experience and talent are a major asset to this projet;
  • As a survivor, the cause is dear to my heart and genuine;
  • As a musicians with a bachelor degree of professional studies and a Professional Certificate in Guitar with the Berklee College of Music, I have all the tools and skills;
  • As an environmentalist and politician who did volunteer during more than a decade to promote the environment, I am prepared;
  • As a business women who did help in the making of a successful engineering firm, Martin Roy et associés, I am dedicated;
  • As a member of the first all female punk-rock band in Montreal and first generation of DIY Musicians, I have the experience to bring my hopes and dreams into a reality;
  • I have coproduced a few independant albums: Cloak and Dagger, Sense of Doubt and Blue Oil;
  • I played close to a thousand shows during the first chapter of my life and music career.

◉ Pourquoi moi?

  • J'ai une excellente équipe, qui comprend un coréalisateur et musicien de renom au Québec, Jean-François Lemieux. Son expérience et son talent sont un atout majeur pour ce projet;
  • En tant que survivante, je porte la cause dans mon cœur;
  • Titulaire d'un baccalauréat en écriture de chansons et d'un certificat professionnel en guitare avec le célèbre Berklee College of Music, j'ai les compétences;
  • En tant qu’écologiste et politicienne qui ayant fait du bénévolat pendant plus d’une décennie pour promouvoir l’environnement, je suis prête;
  • En tant que personne des communications ayant contribué à la création d'une entreprise d'ingénierie prospère, Martin Roy et associés, je peux promouvoir la cause;
  • En tant que membre du premier groupe punk-rock féminin à Montréal et qui s'autoproduisait de manière indépendante, j'ai l'expérience nécessaire pour concrétiser mes rêves et mes espoirs en réalité;
  • J'ai joué près de mille spectacles durant le premier chapitre de ma vie et de ma carrière de musicienne.
Thank you in advance for your support. I can't wait to share this music with you and see other survivors benefit from this initiative.

Merci à l'avance pour votre soutien.  J'ai hâte de partager cette musique avec vous et de voir d'autres survivantes pourvoir profiter de cette initiative.

Summary

Being able to effectively communicate is one of the most valuable skills a person can have. It allows you to express yourself, make meaningful connections, and find your soul’s purpose. These skills are especially difficult for children who have special learning needs. Adrienne Murphy, is hoping to change that. 

Adrienne is not a Music Therapist. She is a Speech-Language Pathologist, which means she is an expert in many facets of communication including, speech sounds, social communication, cognitive communication, voice and more. Adrienne has incorporated music into her practice as a way to empower children and help them find their unique path.

A portion of all future album sales will be donated to The Special Olympics and TACA (Talking About Curing Autism) 

 

Backstory

In addition to being a Speech-Language Pathologist, classically- trained vocalist and healing arts practitioner, Adrienne is also a mother to a special needs son. Adrienne’s journey with her son has proven to be the journey of her soul’s purpose. Using her unique combination of professional expertise, deep spirituality, and vocal abilities, Adrienne has been able to help not only her son, but countless children, discover their authentic voice. This key discovery allows children to better navigate their entry into the real world. 

Now that Adrienne’s special needs son has discovered his creative-authentic self and thriving on his own in the world, she has been compelled to bring her one-of-a-kind songs of empowerment, love, acceptance and inclusion to the masses through her unique album.

 

WHAT DOES HEARTSONGS OF THE RAINBOW MEAN?

            Heartsong means to “sing from the heart” , which is exactly what Adrienne has been doing in her mission for inclusion, acceptance, and love for everyone with special needs.

            Rainbow is used to illustrate that beauty that while we all may be different and many different colors, we are still one.

 

The Plan

Adrienne has partnered with The Brothers Koren (aka The Kin) to bring her album to life. The Brothers Koren, who was previously signed to Interscope / Universal Records, and toured with Coldplay, Pink and Rod Stewart, have now made it their mission to help artists, like Adrienne, with a heart for music to express their authentic selves, stories and values without the limitations of the mainstream music industry.

 

The Impact

This project will be a valuable resource to the world of children with disabilities and their parents. It will be used not only as a healing tool but also aims to uplift, inspire and transform while increasing awareness and education to the world at large about the struggles and challenges that this special population of children and their parents face. 

In addition, a portion of all future album sales will be donated to The Special Olympics and TACA (Talking About Curing Autism) 

 

BUDGET

Total Budget: $15,000

  • Studio Time:
    • Recording: $4,000
    • Rehearsal: $3,000
  • Sound Production: $3,000
  • Sound Mixing: $3,000
  • Transportation: $1,000
  • Approximate Fees Taken from Indiegogo: $1,000

 

Timeline 

Currently, Adrienne is working with The Brothers Koren on composition. The album is tentatively scheduled to be recorded in Los Angeles, CA in late October / Early November. The tentative release date is scheduled for Late November.

 

Risks & Challenges

As with any self-started project, there are risks. If I do not reach my target of $15,000, modifications will be made to the budget and timeline to accommodate additional fundraising efforts and co-funding applications.

 

Ways You Can Help

ALL DONATIONS MATTER! No matter how big or small, your donation will not only go towards the creation of this special album, but a portion of all future sales will be donated to The Special Olympics and TACA (Talking About Curing Autism) 

SHARE SHARE SHARE! Share this link everywhere you can think! Helping us get the word out will make all the difference!

story:
The Project

 

  • Hello. My name is Zack Freitas, I'm a 26 year old singer-songwriter from Hollister, CA. I currently reside in Monterey working as a full-time musician. I've been playing music since I was 13 years old, and it's my life's purpose to write songs. I perform several nights every weekend, and you can usually find me busking (Street Performing) 3-5 days a week depending on the weather.
  • I have invested into a 5 song EP with my producer Dean Dichoso and members of Candlebox at EastWest Studios in Los Angeles. My goal is to get back in the studio and transform this EP into a full-length LP with 5 more songs in March. Here's the music video for the first single, "Sweet Oblivion". 
  • This project is so important to me because now is the perfect time for me to take a GIANT LEAP and push my music to break through to a wider audience, opening doors to be touring around the USA and EU. Here's a documentary on the recording of the first half of the record!

 

 

  • As an independent artist I still retain my creative rights, and I've never had quality professional recordings of this scale before.  There's potential for radio play or Commercial/Film/Spotify Playlist placement that could take my career to a whole new level. Who knows, I could be opening up for bigger artists or playing festivals within a year if I were to be so lucky. And I've been pretty lucky lately! Did I mention I met my producer on a video game?

My Goal & What You'll Get

 

  • My goal is $10,000. It's $1,000 per day at EastWest Studios (We need 2 days). My producer charges $7,000 for the pre-production, recording, & mixing of 5 songs. That leaves $1,000 for session musicians if I meet my goal. Any other funds leftover will go towards the session musicians, mastering the music, and touring.

  • I have a wide variety of neat perks to choose from. It could be a swag package of merchandise mailed to your door, a cover song of your choice on YouTube, or your very own private BBQ concert with Zack Freitas & The Hired Guns!
  • Even if I don't reach my entire goal, I'm going to do everything within my power to turn this into a full length record.  It's a giant stepping stone for my career to be working at this level. In any case, funds left over will be invested into the promotional tour.

The Impact

 

  • This album is harboring the best material I have to offer. Not only sonically, but also conceptually as my songwriting has developed over the years. Songs like "Someone Worth Saving" & "Sunny Day" speak to the heart with an honest recognition that the human condition is both beautiful & flawed. I believe people around the world will find this music redeeming and will identify with it in their own way therefore making the world a better place.
  • I've chosen to be a full-time musician and have been so grateful for the support that people have given me wherever I go. It never ceases to amaze me when the power of music seizes a moment in time, and the energy of the space and people around me changes for the better. If music impacts you as much as me, then the ripples of this project are going to move you.

No Risk, No Reward

  • I'm an entrepreneur with a go-getter personality, and I have invested my own money into the first half of this album. I was once told that if I wish to break into the music industry, I must take a risk and go into debt at some point. I'm doing my best to overcome that hurdle without a record label, and fortunately things are looking good for 2019 already. I've been accepted into a local talent booking agency in Monterey that will secure more paid gigs that allows me to invest in my budding music career. No matter what, I'm going to keep giving everything I've got into writing great songs and sharing them with listeners around the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Come to a concert! I constantly update my show schedule on my website! http://www.zackfreitas.com/ 
  • Even if you can't afford to donate to the making of this album, you can still help! Please share this campaign and help me get the word out. Maybe you have a friend out there that could wind up absolutely loving my music! That would be better than anything.
  • Use the share button, or copy and paste the URL to post on your Facebook about turning this project into a full length album!

The Project
 

Hello. My name is Zack Freitas, I'm a 26 year old singer-songwriter from Hollister, CA. I currently reside in Monterey working as a full-time musician. I've been playing music since I was 13 years old, and it's my life's purpose to write songs. I perform several nights every weekend, and you can usually find me busking (Street Performing) 3-5 days a week depending on the weather.
I have invested into a 5 song EP with my producer Dean Dichoso and members of Candlebox at EastWest Studios in Los Angeles. My goal is to get back in the studio and transform this EP into a full-length LP with 5 more songs in March. Here's the music video for the first single, "Sweet Oblivion". 


This project is so important to me because now is the perfect time for me to take a GIANT LEAP and push my music to break through to a wider audience, opening doors to be touring around the USA and EU. Here's a documentary on the recording of the first half of the record!
 

 
As an independent artist I still retain my creative rights, and I've never had quality professional recordings of this scale before.  There's potential for radio play or Commercial/Film/Spotify Playlist placement that could take my career to a whole new level. Who knows, I could be opening up for bigger artists or playing festivals within a year if I were to be so lucky. And I've been pretty lucky lately! Did I mention I met my producer on a video game?

My Goal & What You'll Get
 
My goal is $10,000. It's $1,000 per day at EastWest Studios (We need 2 days). My producer charges $7,000 for the pre-production, recording, & mixing of 5 songs. That leaves $1,000 for session musicians if I meet my goal. Any other funds leftover will go towards the session musicians, mastering the music, and touring.


I have a wide variety of neat perks to choose from. It could be a swag package of merchandise mailed to your door, a cover song of your choice on YouTube, or your very own private BBQ concert with Zack Freitas & The Hired Guns!
Even if I don't reach my entire goal, I'm going to do everything within my power to turn this into a full length record.  It's a giant stepping stone for my career to be working at this level. In any case, funds left over will be invested into the promotional tour.


The Impact
 

This album is harboring the best material I have to offer. Not only sonically, but also conceptually as my songwriting has developed over the years. Songs like "Someone Worth Saving" & "Sunny Day" speak to the heart with an honest recognition that the human condition is both beautiful & flawed. I believe people around the world will find this music redeeming and will identify with it in their own way therefore making the world a better place.
I've chosen to be a full-time musician and have been so grateful for the support that people have given me wherever I go. It never ceases to amaze me when the power of music seizes a moment in time, and the energy of the space and people around me changes for the better. If music impacts you as much as me, then the ripples of this project are going to move you.


No Risk, No Reward
I'm an entrepreneur with a go-getter personality, and I have invested my own money into the first half of this album. I was once told that if I wish to break into the music industry, I must take a risk and go into debt at some point. I'm doing my best to overcome that hurdle without a record label, and fortunately things are looking good for 2019 already. I've been accepted into a local talent booking agency in Monterey that will secure more paid gigs that allows me to invest in my budding music career. No matter what, I'm going to keep giving everything I've got into writing great songs and sharing them with listeners around the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Come to a concert! I constantly update my show schedule on my website! http://www.zackfreitas.com/ 
Even if you can't afford to donate to the making of this album, you can still help! Please share this campaign and help me get the word out. Maybe you have a friend out there that could wind up absolutely loving my music! That would be better than anything.
Use the share button, or copy and paste the URL to post on your Facebook about turning this project into a full length album!

story:
Hi there, my name is Samuel Batista. I was born in San Miguelito, Panama, where
violence and poverty came in daily doses - but also warmhearted people that gave
me a chance for a better future. People who thought me to be grateful and that music 
changes lives.

 

Running this campaign is my NUMBER ONE goal. It represents one of the most
important steps in my professional and personal life, and its accomplishment will
inspire those involved in its process to continue making music for the betterment
of people. 
 

 

 

With your contribution, we will be able to achieve our 2019 timeline. Starting with our studio recording session at Wellspring Sound Studios in Acton, MA, this album will be the first of many. The recording is being produced by the great Alain Mallet and performed by up-and-coming musicians such as Anthony Fung (Los Angeles), Eunjeong Hwang (South Korea), James Dale (Sidney, Australia), and Milagros Blade (Panama). Once the audio is recorded, a team from Mexico will come to San Miguelito, Panama to film our music video. On it we will be able to share with the world the beauty of my hometown and some of the most historical places in Panama. The final step in the list is to tour Central and South America for the very fist time. All of these and more will be possible with your contribution. ~This is just the beginning~  

 

 

The completion of this album will bring my team one step closer into developing a richer culture in Panama and the world - and we want YOU to be part of it. By helping us, you become part of the community who had fought by my side since day one. Those who believed I would be here today, using music to bring us all closer together. All collected funds will move into four different categories through out our timeline: Recording Process & Logistics, Video Production in Panama, Album Release Marketing, and THE 2019 TOUR!

 

 

 

 

 

This album is my way of showing gratitude to the people that have trusted me and supported me on this difficult journey; with each contribution YOU become part of this family. In return, we have prepared a variety of very exciting perks as a thank you for your donations. Interested in other ways to contribute with the project? No problem, visit our INDIEGOGO SHARE TOOLS at the top of the page and share with the world everything about PANAMA UNITED! Lastly, I hope this page becomes an inspiration for other musicians who work daily on making the world a better place.
