story:
"One story, one rhythm,
one pulse, one force, one vision...
One origin, one destiny,
one web, one source...
One Story"
~ from the title track of One Story

Music has played a central role in my life for as long as I can remember.  I wrote my first song at age 8, started composing songs on guitar as a young teenager, and recorded my first album on a cassette tape (yes I am actually that old!).  Since then I have produced a number of CDs as a solo artist, with my band for kids (Octopretzel), and with other musical collaborators.

This is my first crowd-funding campaign for an album of my own original music, and I am really excited to share it with you!

** To hear snippets of the new songs
and learn more about my process of writing them,
please watch the video below **


As I share in the video, music has been the lens through which I have made sense of my world, and often the channel through which I have processed my experiences, my relationships and my struggles.    

This new album, One Story, is a collection of all-new original songs I've written over the past few years.  Each song is a unique expression that stems from my personal journey, and yet ultimately reaches into the unfolding collective experience that we all share in these tumultuous yet fertile times... 

The music spans a range of musical genres, from acoustic/melodic folk to bluegrass to soulful electronica (a new musical frontier I have been exploring).  I have been blessed to work with a number of amazing musicians on this album; to learn more about them check the FAQ tab above.  I truly believe that these songs have the potential to connect with people of all ages and life stages across diverse musical preferences.


 ** To hear a couple of my full close-to-complete tracks, you can stream on Sound Cloud for a limited time HERE:

Begin
The Beckoning


......................................................................................................................................................................

Evolution, evolution
It's the spreading of our wings
the way our spirit sings
It's the natural state of things
in the absence of oppression and repression
It's the rising up of Love
~ from "Evolution" on One Story

......................................................................................................................................................................

Producing an album involves an incredible amount of focus, energy and money.  As a working musician, music teacher and mother to a young teenage daughter, resources are often limited.  My intention with this campaign is to recoup some of what I have invested in producing the album, as well as raise money for the remaining editing, mixing, mastering and printing stages.  Any additional funds will go towards a creative and inspiring video for one of these new songs, which I hope will enable this music to reach more people.

The music industry is currently going through many changes, and supporting independent artists is more important than ever to help us continue on in our craft.  Thank you so much for your support in getting this music (and the messages contained within it) out into the world!

To learn more about me and my music for people of all ages, please visit Melita Music

story:
The Dream Comes Alive

Hi! I am Jahnel Daliya, a singer songwriter based in Northern Virginia. I have  been writing original songs for the past 5 years. I had no idea how the choice to pursue music and honing my songwriting skills would change my life. It took 32 years for me to realize that being a songwriter was my passion and now I want to inspire and encourage others through the music I write. Songs that make life's heaviness a little less heavy, songs that make you want to let loose and be free. Three years ago I put together a band of talented local musicians and since then we have been performing at music clubs, festivals and music conferences sharing my story and my songs.

The passion has grown.I'm ready to dream bigger and to do that I need a your help. I've decided to put together this campaign to fund a big recording project. This will be my second time in the studio. I learned so much about the process of releasing music in 2017 when I put out a four track album. I knew that my next effort would need more funds in order to make it a successful release. I am recording eleven songs backed by a full band of some of the area's most talented musicians. The plan is to promote this album and share it beyond my hometown. Having this campaign fully funded would support the albums potential to reach a wider audience and creating more opportunities to connect with fans.

The Goal

More songs + talented musicians + an awesome and experienced recording engineer in one of the best studios in the area = one EXPENSIVE album. I am looking to raise $11,000 for this project. Contributions to this campaign will go towards:        

  • Studio Time (Recording/Mixing)- We have started recording at Tonal Park Studio in Takoma Park Maryland. 
  • Paying Musicians- Talented people deserve to be payed for their craft and I've hired some of the best to make this record.
  • Mastering- This process will have all the hard work we've put into the songs sounding their absolute best and ready for distribution.
  • Printing CD's/ Graphic Design/ PR- Got to have physical merch for everyone to enjoy. I'll need to hire a graphic designer/artist for artwork. I'm also hiring a team to help spread the word and expand the reach.This record is so precious to me I want to celebrate it in a big way by offering T-shirts, Posters designed by local artists, CD's, Buttons and more.
  • Videos- If by some amazing chance I can surpass this goal I will be putting the rest of the funding towards creating videos for songs from the album.

Your Impact

 When I started this journey I thought I was just trying to lead my family by the example of following my heart and love of music. What I found through performing were people who were really leaning in and connecting with the lyrics. I've been asked many times if a song was online or if I had any albums they could purchase and I felt like I was failing them for not having what they wanted or needed. I strive to keep it real and keep the tone positive through my lyrics while offering fun and sometimes intimate music that moves you. This is what you would be supporting to be released into the world.

Risks & Challenges

Projects like this are time consuming, stressful and expensive however my passion burns strong and this is what I love and I will be giving it my all. Since the goal is to spread the music I want to have all the tools to connect with fans. Printing merchandise will probably take time depending on turn around time and any other issues that may arise with designs. I have already begun planning the material and lining up artist, but it is important to me to deliver every perk on time. I will be sure to keep everyone updated and informed on the progress of this project. 

Other Ways You Can Help.

You can help in so many ways. Not only contributing but spreading the word. Can't contribute right now? That's ok, please share this campaign with your friends, colleagues, veterinarian, even your neighbor who borrows things from you. Indiegogo has some great tools to help you share!

Here's How You Can Spread The Word!

#1- Email those you feel would really like to support a music campaign and be sure to include what inspires you about my project. 

#2- Social Platforms. Quick and easy way to spread the love. You can make a short post to your followers about why they should contribute to an artist like me.

#3- Word of Mouth! Sometimes those one on one interactions are the perfect place to bring up things you're excited about and make you feel inspired. There is an Indiegogo App you can download to show someone who you are supporting and maybe they would like to get involved!

Your support is greatly appreciated and makes my heart feel full. Be sure to follow the campaign by clicking the "heart" link and I would love for you to connect with me on other social platforms as well.
story_txt:
The Dream Comes Alive
Hi! I am Jahnel Daliya, a singer songwriter based in Northern Virginia. I have  been writing original songs for the past 5 years. I had no idea how the choice to pursue music and honing my songwriting skills would change my life. It took 32 years for me to realize that being a songwriter was my passion and now I want to inspire and encourage others through the music I write. Songs that make life's heaviness a little less heavy, songs that make you want to let loose and be free. Three years ago I put together a band of talented local musicians and since then we have been performing at music clubs, festivals and music conferences sharing my story and my songs.
The passion has grown.I'm ready to dream bigger and to do that I need a your help. I've decided to put together this campaign to fund a big recording project. This will be my second time in the studio. I learned so much about the process of releasing music in 2017 when I put out a four track album. I knew that my next effort would need more funds in order to make it a successful release. I am recording eleven songs backed by a full band of some of the area's most talented musicians. The plan is to promote this album and share it beyond my hometown. Having this campaign fully funded would support the albums potential to reach a wider audience and creating more opportunities to connect with fans.

The Goal
More songs + talented musicians + an awesome and experienced recording engineer in one of the best studios in the area = one EXPENSIVE album. I am looking to raise $11,000 for this project. Contributions to this campaign will go towards:        


Studio Time (Recording/Mixing)- We have started recording at Tonal Park Studio in Takoma Park Maryland. 

Paying Musicians- Talented people deserve to be payed for their craft and I've hired some of the best to make this record.

Mastering- This process will have all the hard work we've put into the songs sounding their absolute best and ready for distribution.

Printing CD's/ Graphic Design/ PR- Got to have physical merch for everyone to enjoy. I'll need to hire a graphic designer/artist for artwork. I'm also hiring a team to help spread the word and expand the reach.This record is so precious to me I want to celebrate it in a big way by offering T-shirts, Posters designed by local artists, CD's, Buttons and more.

Videos- If by some amazing chance I can surpass this goal I will be putting the rest of the funding towards creating videos for songs from the album.

What I found through performing were people who were really leaning in and connecting with the lyrics. I've been asked many times if a song was online or if I had any albums they could purchase and I felt like I was failing them for not having what they wanted or needed. I strive to keep it real and keep the tone positive through my lyrics while offering fun and sometimes intimate music that moves you. This is what you would be supporting to be released into the world.

Projects like this are time consuming, stressful and expensive however my passion burns strong and this is what I love and I will be giving it my all. Since the goal is to spread the music I want to have all the tools to connect with fans. Printing merchandise will probably take time depending on turn around time and any other issues that may arise with designs. I have already begun planning the material and lining up artist, but it is important to me to deliver every perk on time. I will be sure to keep everyone updated and informed on the progress of this project.

You can help in so many ways. Not only contributing but spreading the word. Can't contribute right now? That's ok, please share this campaign with your friends, colleagues, veterinarian, even your neighbor who borrows things from you. Indiegogo has some great tools to help you share!
Here's How You Can Spread The Word!
#1- Email those you feel would really like to support a music campaign and be sure to include what inspires you about my project. 
#2- Social Platforms. Quick and easy way to spread the love. You can make a short post to your followers about why they should contribute to an artist like me.
#3- Word of Mouth! Sometimes those one on one interactions are the perfect place to bring up things you're excited about and make you feel inspired. There is an Indiegogo App you can download to show someone who you are supporting and maybe they would like to get involved!
Your support is greatly appreciated and makes my heart feel full. Be sure to follow the campaign by clicking the "heart" link and I would love for you to connect with me on other social platforms as well.

story:
Short Summary

My name's Kate Daisy Grant and I am a singer and songwriter from Brighton, UK.

I've been researching for the last few years the sounds of connection and the effect they have on us. This led me to playing folk lullabies, which in turn became an interest in how similar many of them are. Maybe it is an innate knowledge we all share in which patterns our babies will find soothing.

I began to combine the tunes as harmonies to each other and blend each tune into the next. With the playing and production skills of Nick Pynn, we began to record many layers of lullabies with piano and string arrangement. This album is the result.

Your help will be invaluable to getting the album out there to the world in the final stages of mastering and CD production. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our needs are simple at this stage - your money will ensure that we can pay an engineer to master the album (the final stage of sound processing where everything really falls into place) and will pay for the CD manufacture.

As and when any excess funds are raised, we will donate 25% of these to the charities War Child and Honor The Earth. We will also be able to direct funds to marketing the album.

If we didn't reach our goal, we will put the money towards the mastering and CD production only.

You can choose between a high quality digital download of the album for £7 (which will be emailed to you on completion with a redemption code) or a CD and download copy for £10.

We expect that download codes will be sent out before Christmas and CDs will be posted as soon as manufacturing allows.

Risks & Challenges

As the project is nearly complete, no risks are apparent at this time. Should any of the mastering or manufacturing processes take longer than expected and delay delivery time slightly, this would be communicated immediately to supporters. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help the project financially, but would like to support us in other ways, please tell your friends about it or share this campaign with your friends using the Indigogo tools - every bit of word of mouth helps!

story:
IN SEARCH OF FUTURES PAST

– Choose Your Own Adventure –

 

This album will never be heard the same way twice. Do you remember the Choose Your Own Adventure books? “If you approach the mysterious stranger, turn to page 48...If you duck into the forbidden cave to avoid him, turn to page 136,” etc. There was a thrill to the equal possibilities of adventure or capture, friendship or deception, renown or obscurity.

In Search of Futures Past: Choose Your Own Adventure is the musical equivalent – one in which your listening experience will change profoundly based on your choice at each fork in the road.

You may choose to listen chronologically, and enjoy the way each composer opens up possibilities for the next. Or you may follow one of our many playlist options, and discover that Brahms takes on a new flavor when preceded by Sam Pluta, or that Ruth Crawford Seeger's quartet from 1931 sounds just as alive as the improvisations of Charmaine Lee when heard back-to-back. Or you can choose your own adventure – close your eyes and turn to a new page – and discover that context is everything.

What awaits you is the first quartet of Johannes Brahms, a composer that Arnold Schoenberg called more cutting-edge than Wagner, and one whose voice held out against a hurricane of criticism. Then there’s Schoenberg’s own third quartet, a piece inseparable from Schubert (and Mozart and Beethoven), but that also jail-breaks the entirety of classical music composition.

And what about that quartet of Ruth Crawford Seeger? Here we have a composer cutting through the patriarchy to write one of the only quartets of its kind till maybe Elliott Carter…predating his first quartet by almost 20 years.

Listeners can tour In Search of Futures Past: Choose Your Own Adventure chronologically, but maybe you’ll leap right to George Lewis’s ecstatic String Quartet No. 1.5, “Experiments in Living.” This quartet may sound improvisatory to new ears, but on further reflection, an architecture emerges from the mist – not unlike the sometimes bewildering experience of hearing Arnold Schoenberg’s String Quartet No. 3 for the first time.

The exuberance popping off within the Lewis finds a parallel in Sam Pluta’s binary/momentary logics: flow state/joy state, which whips the players through breakneck character changes with titles as sober as “Professor Dr. Squiggly, DMA.” As both composers prove, the most challenging music on the page can also be absurd, and hilarious, and fun.

Composer Anthony Cheung provides a genre bridge with his cheekily-titled Real Book of Fake Tunes, in which whiffs of jazz harmonies infuse spontaneous-sounding licks from flutist Claire Chase and the members of our band. And finally, our fully improvised collaboration with vocalist Charmaine Lee offers the most interstellar departure from traditional classical music, fusing other-worldly reverberations of the human voice with the kaleidoscopic palette of the string quartet.

So, clearly, there’s no “single” here. Sorry, iTunes.

There are curated paths through this album, and more to come, but this is your adventure, friend. Choose wisely…

 

YOUR DONATION WILL SUPPORT:

  • The recording engineer's fee
  • Hall rentals
  • The labor-intensive mixing and mastering process
  • Promotion 
  • Pressing physical copies of the album
  • The design of captivating cover art

 

ABOUT SPEKTRAL QUARTET

Named 2017 Chicagoans of the Year by the Chicago Tribune, Spektral Quartet actively pursues a vivid conversation between exhilarating works of the traditional canon and those written this decade, this year, or this week. With the New York Times writing that “they have everything: a supreme technical command that seems to come easily, a capacity to make complicated music clear, and, most notably...an ability to cast a magic spell”, Spektral is known for creating seamless connections across centuries, drawing in the listener with charismatic deliveries, interactive concert formats, an up-close atmosphere, and bold, inquisitive programming.

story:
After over two years of relentless performing, writing and recording since our last release, our heavily anticipated third album is finally ready to be born! We feel that this music is our best yet; an arrival at a new, but instantly recognisable sound that perfectly blends the energy and vibrancy of our live show with an abundance of fresh inspiration and a new maturity.

Exploring influences ranging from Ethiopian Jazz to Bill Withers, we've been gradually honing this new sound on gigs in every corner of the UK, and we really can’t wait for you to hear it.

By simply pre-ordering the album here, or choosing from the selection of exclusive perks and merchandise, you’ll enable us to cover the costs for recording, editing, mixing, and promoting the album so we can widen our fanbase and continue making music. Without you, we would be nothing!

Words don’t begin to cover it, but we extend a massive thank you in advance from all of us here in MAMF for your continued support of our music. We really hope you enjoy this album as much as we enjoyed making it!

Big love and hugs!

Nick, Sam, Fred, Emma, James xxxxx

story:
Dave Parry is a medicine Musician working to heal the planet. Playing songs during healing ceremonies around the world. Sharing a message of peace, unity, forgiveness and joy. Originally from Wales, Dave has been part of the growing community of healers in Costa Rica, supporting deep transformational work with his songs. A multi instrumentalist working with Guitar, African Harp, Handmade artisan flutes, thumb pianos, drums, percussion and more to weave a profound healing and entertaining soundscape. He makes his own pelican feather flutes as well as many other hand crafted unique instruments. Recordings are in 432 hz to tune into the frequency of healing.

 

Ronan Harvey is a Dj, Photographer, Music producer and video maker, working to support many projects in Costa Rica. More can be seen at www.elementalism.net or https://soundcloud.com/elementalism https://www.instagram.com/elementalism/ Based in Platanio, Costa Rica, at Elementalism studios in Airikai Sanctuary of Sacred Arts, a center for the arts, wellness and healing. With a background of living in many transformational communities as a vegan chef, sound engineer retreat facilitator, DJ, performer and workshop leader. The space is available to hire to record or to book for creative and healing getaways. In his home country of England Ronan taught music production, art, Djing, video making and creative workshops for over seven years to various groups including young people at risk of offending as well as adults with learning difficulties before becoming a teacher in schools in Costa Rica.

 

The new album is a chance to consolidate the ongoing recordings that have taken place over the last year, with a view to take a deeper approach to creating a journey through sound. Original and traditional medicine songs with electronic elements fuzed to create a unique voyage. The intention always to raise frequencies and heal as well as inspire. It is also a chance to document the ongoing downloads received from universe via meditations. Dave brings a lightness to heavy work with enjoyable songs celebrating nature, the beauty of animals and the earth that bring a smile and honey to the heart. To send loving and healing vibrations, using sound therapy as a tool. You support helps ongoing healing work across the planet, people making radical shifts and deep transformation.

 

Your support will allow us to focus solely on the album for a dedicated month of recording and work, and will provide us with the finances to step out of the hustle and make magic happen.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for $4000 as a starting point.

This will allow us to:

Invest in equipment

Invest in studio time

Pay for accommodation, transport  and food

Pay guest musicians

Pay for album mastering

Pay a team to help with the project

Pay for media

Pay for chord and song sheet creation

Help with promotion of the finished album

Stretch goals will allow us to

Pay artists for additional remixes

Pay for video production

 

What you get:

Full digital album download

Optional perks:

Private concert

Wedding ceremony

Private wellness retreat here in costa rica at elementalism studios

 

 

The Impact

Your contribution will help us to have the time to focus on the album and share much needed healing with the earth.

 

Risks & Challenges

Part of the challenges we face is that due to the nature of the life we lead, much of our time is spent in service of healing work. Typically much of our work is offered as an exchange for accommodation or food. Money has never been the priority with this work, however it is required to navigate and exist in the modern world. Both Dave and Ronan have been based in Costa Rica for some time, enjoying the nature and different approach to life. Living in centers all over the country doing work in exchange for being able to take part in the workshops and events happening here or living in simple rustic wooden cabinas with less outgoings meaning we can put time into being creative.  The combination of Jungle humidity and technology is a challenging one, sound cards breaking, laptop malfunctions, mody lenses, headphone cables breaking and shorting out cameras. Sand in tripods, guitars wood damaged by weather. Technology on dusty bumpy roads leads to a situation where replacing, repairing and acquiring more gear is ongoing. This crowd funder will allow us to get the equipment we need. It will also allow us to be supported through our work so that hunting for other work not in line with the best we can offer does not take up our time. Costa rica is a beautiful and advanced country in many ways but does not have easy access to the latest technology and in fact technology that is somewhat outdated costs more than the newest gear in the US. We hope to use this platform to allow us to be in a situation where we feel support and able to be our higher selves. As well as benefiting further projects. We are hoping to manifest some transport in the shape of a car rather than hitching down roads in the rain! Maybe a trip to the dentist... simple things :)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to contribute financially that is totally fine and believe me we understand the situation! We all want to be in a position to give freely but for many of us that is not our current reality. You can support us in other ways:

Sharing our project and helping us to reach a wider audience is hugely helpful, it spreads the message and helps us grow and the more we grow the more we can support each other.

Facebook, instagram and other social media platforms are huge tools for world change when used in the right way.

We are open to Cryptocurrency, part of huge shifts on the planet. Send us a message for our codes, even a small amount of a new currency could grow into something significant so whatever you can offer is gratefully received.

You can also simply enjoy the music we have already recorded totally free! And if you feel to you can purchase some of the tracks now at:

https://daveparry.bandcamp.com/

https://elementalism.bandcamp.com/

https://soundcloud.com/elementalism

story:
The Earth Is Trembling
Dedicated to the memory of Ori Ansbacher
 
 

Hey There! Shalom and Blessings

           Since the summer Yerachmiel has been slaving away naked in the recording studio. Not literally of course because that would be just weird. But in his long awaited sixth studio album “Off The Derech”, he strips things down to the basics and it is certainly the most raw and real, and emotionally revealing one to date.

This album uniquely combines the secular with the spiritual/religious and celebrates the idea of carving ones own path. It follows a personal journey of love and loss and reclaiming core values and identity while celebrating the simple things in life.

In his own words, “It is a real blessing to birth this into the world. We are now mixing a whopping 21 song album. When most artists today have long forgotten about the art of making a full length album and instead focus on the “big hit”, to me there’s just so much more to say and share, then what a 3 minute pop song could ever possibly express. I invested my heart and soul into this creative endeavour along with every last ounce of savings I have, and now as the last drop of funds have completely run out, I need your help and support to make it to the finish line”.

Changing the world, One click at a time!Consider becoming a partner with me in this new project. Check out some of the amazing perks offered for a limited time and share this with your friends and family!!!

Two Great Emotions

Oy Gevalt Mendel is going Off The Derech!

Take a peek at the "Off The Derech" documentary Part 1

Take a peek at the "Off The Derech" documentary Part 2

Heres a little live show we did for Birthright last week

 

Here's a peek at the titles of the songs....

Great To Be Alive

You're Everything To Me

Two Great Emotions 

Meaning to words 

Game of love

All The Same

Coin

Stay true 

Love and shame 

Like a lullaby

Temple 

Shabbos Queen

Simple man

Sounds From Your Lips

Tears In a Falling Rain 

Jah Your Name Be Praise

Tiny Seed

Never Alone

7th wonder 

Vision Of You

Earth Is Trembling

This album is coming to life!!!! 

 

To the guy thats been doing graffiti of our band around the city. We appreciate the gesture, but there are more legal ways of supporting out band, namely buying a new album and contributing to the campaign! 

 

And now for a little taste of the studio

Thats C.J. Glass who arranged trumpets and played trombone, helping with the final mixes

 

Yoni Sharon on percussion

 

Yours truly doing vocals

Yours truly taking a listening break

This is me contemplating why I became a musician in the first place...

 

Click here to see some behind the scenes footage of the making of the album

 

Heres a fun little activity... All the demos of the songs, we've come a long way!

Great to be alive - https://youtu.be/IazC2A_XKkM

Your everything to me - https://youtu.be/XNqx7iFv9ks

Two great emotions - https://youtu.be/owehM8YRV1o

Meaning to words - https://www.facebook.com/yerachmiel/posts/10158...

Game of love - https://youtu.be/rQj9-Y0eFU0

Coin - https://youtu.be/fHuTMamTJBU

Stay true - https://youtu.be/iArHUIwxpDA

Love and shame - https://youtu.be/aW7amcSmh34

Like a lullaby - https://www.facebook.com/yerachmielz/videos/207...

Temple - https://www.facebook.com/ruachhakodeshband/vide...

Shabbos Queen - https://www.facebook.com/JewishStandard/videos/...

Simple man - https://youtu.be/-Dq106TEbFE 

Sounds from your lips - https://youtu.be/pGEwfzlpU4I

Tears in a falling rain - https://youtu.be/w-5Qu9iySKE

Jah Your Name Be Praise - https://youtu.be/5R0uWOtos_A

Tiny Seed - https://www.facebook.com/yerachmiel/videos/1015...

Never Alone - https://www.facebook.com/yerachmiel/posts/10160...

Some Folk, Funk, Swing, Reggae and Rock. its all there. This is a huge project. 21 all original English compositions with many varying genres and styles but put together in one comprehensive album. Albums?!!! remember those? Yea the art of creating a full album has almost completely disappeared with the focus now on "hit" singles. But how can one adequately describe the beauty or pain in our own lives or in the ever changing world that we live and breath in with just one song? I couldn't even do it in 10, which is why this album just ballooned into a massive 21 songs. This is about my journey through love and loss, changes of beliefs, learning about tolerance and patience, loving oneself, each other and seeing the world with new eyes. The documentary we are shooting will hopefully give people a fun behind the scenes look into the making of this epic album. Some really fun music videos are in the works and we really can't wait to share this music with you but in order to actually finish we need YOUR help. Grab a perk. You will absolutely love this album, It is my sincere promise to you. Thank you for being with me on this journey. I am truly and deeply grateful.

-yerachmiel

https://www.facebook.com/yerachmielz
story_txt:
The Earth Is TremblingDedicated to the memory of Ori Ansbacher  Hey There! Shalom and Blessings           Since the summer Yerachmiel has been slaving away naked in the recording studio. Not literally of course because that would be just weird. But in his long awaited sixth studio album “Off The Derech”, he strips things down to the basics and it is certainly the most raw and real, and emotionally revealing one to date.This album uniquely combines the secular with the spiritual/religious and celebrates the idea of carving ones own path. It follows a personal journey of love and loss and reclaiming core values and identity while celebrating the simple things in life.In his own words, “It is a real blessing to birth this into the world. When most artists today have long forgotten about the art of making a full length album and instead focus on the “big hit”, to me there’s just so much more to say and share, then what a 3 minute pop song could ever possibly express. story:
Summary

We are Les Paynes close friends and family. We would love to see his final album of wonderful music completed. Having heard many songs from the  work in progress we feel it's important for this work to be finalised and reach as many as possible. His story is inspirational, his music is wonderful and we all know he would love to see his final works out in the world to share with you all.

This campaign gives you the opportunity to join us on a journey of amazing music from one of the most underrated talents in the business. It was Les's wish that his music reach as many people as possible. Despite not achieving traditional "success" in the music business Les always said "I am a success because I've loved what I do for a living." We want his final projects to be completed.

Les was a brilliant singer, songwriter, musician, producer and studio engineer.

In case you didn't know:

  • David Bowie wrote a song for Les
  • Les had record of the week on Radio 1 in 1976
  • Les wrote the music for the Dave Prowse's Green Cross Code man
  • Les received an award for the most gigged musician at over 6000 gigs
  • Les had written over 500 songs

We will finalise a double album he was working on called "The Ultimate Compliment". This will have approx 12 songs on each CD and be printed in full colour with a 4 page booklet. Each song is a cover of one of Les's songs with collaborations from various artists including Martin Holland, Chris Sharley, Dzal Martin, Dave Beeson, Piers Hall, Sparkie Dalton, Crispin Payne, Steve Busby (BBZ Allstars) Jim (Splash the Cash), Ria Parslow, Suzanne Rice, Doris Brendel, Russell Leak and many more including contributions from some VERY well known artists(that we cant mention for legal reasons!).  Songs include "Be Grateful", "Love is the Key", "Gentle Man" and many more. The final list of songs and contributors may well change from the above.

We will also remaster his brilliant album "47 Summers" featuring 15 amazing original songs including "U.F.O", "I've Got to Rock and Roll" & "My Minds Like A Photograph" . Originally recorded at MARS studios and featuring great musicians such as Mark Brzezicki, Dzal Martin, Chris Sharley and many more.

What We Need & What You Get

What we need for - The Album

Mixing - The first CD is complete, finished and mixed by Les but we need to complete the mixing of the second CD of the album. We will take Les's recordings and his sons Elliot & Crispin, both musicians and producers will make the final mixes of the second CD and then we will have both CD's mastered professionally. 

Mastering

We want to finish the album with the same quality Les always finished with every CD he created. We will use MARS studios to master the album. http://marsrecording.co.uk/index.php/audio-mastering/

Art work – we would like to create high quality artwork with pictures of Les and contributors, sleeve notes and producers credits – including you if you decide to back the project.

Printing – we would like to create a folding wallet case double cd with 4 page booklet.

What You Get

What you get - The Album

You get the release before anyone else - a compilation of Les’s songs covered by amazing musicians. All the tracks were recorded and edited by Les and the remaining tracks will be selected and mixed to professional quality by Crispin Payne & Elliot Payne and MARS studios. Full colour artwork with 4 page booklet - optionally with your name in the credits!

A remastered copy of 47 Summers with basic artwork and Digital Downloads for your computer or mobile device.

Optional - Producer or Executive Producer Credits on the double "The Ultimate Compliment" album - and a chance to visit the studio to attend the Mix session of one of the songs!

If We Don’t Reach our goal

We will analyse the money we do get and look at how we can create or finalise part of the project.

Please note! - We have to pay IndieGoGO 8% of regardless of the amount we finally receive so we cannot return that - this means if you offer £30 and the final amount is not reached we would only return £27.60.

Here is our estimated costs break down:

Total Mixing time £1750

Total Mastering time £1350

Printing of Double CD x 300 + 4 page booklet £4000

Printing of Single CD x 450 plus basic artwork £1200

Additional Artwork, Typesetting & Admin  £600

IndieGoGO Fees - £750

Total: £9650

If we reach this goal we would like to add stretch goals of additional music and possibly a book that Les was working on.

The Impact

Les’s Paynes music touched everyone who heard it but not enough people heard it! His story is one of survival in a very difficult music business. Against the odds he carried on gigging and writing his music. He carried on doing what he loved to do.

With this project we hope that we can finish Les’s album and leave the ultimate legacy to a wonderful musician and a wonderful man who helped so many people and touched so many with his music. His story can inspire and create the next generation of musicians and artists who believe in their dream of expressing themselves and making the world a better place.

Risks & Challenges

The main risks and challenges in this project are:

Not having the time and the resources to complete the work

Not being able to secure the professional expertise needed to complete the project.

The team are the family and friends of Les Payne. Combined we hope that we will be able to overcome these challenges and create the work as closely as possible to Les’s vision.

Who We Are

We are the close friends and family of Les Payne. We were all constantly frustrated with Les's lack of commercial success despite his amazing talent. We want to do his last works justice by releasing them in the most fair and economical way whilst creating a lasting, high quality product. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can’t help financially but please, please, please share this project using the IndieGoGo tools so that others may be able to contribute and be part of this amazing project.  We have 60 days to reach this goal, so we greatly appreciate anything you can do to spread the word, whether it's reposting on FACEBOOK and TWITTER, creating a post on INSTAGRAM, sending an EMAIL to your friends and family, mentioning it in your BLOG, shouting out at gigs and open mics etc. We are so grateful for any help in getting the word out. Thank you so much for sharing!

Other Links, info & news stories:

http://www.bucksfreepress.co.uk/news/15277787.T...

http://fishheads.club/2017/05/02/les-payne-prod...

http://www.iwcp.co.uk/news/obituaries/les-payne...

http://www.wycombegigs.co.uk/les-payne-r-i-p-19...

story:
Hi!

We are Alex and the Dukes. Alex August is the vocalist and ukulele player. Lead guitar, Pasi Sipilä. Denis Prokopenko plays bass guitar and sings as well. The percussionists are Ioannis Peristianis and Tiki Friehs!

We make music! Big love music! We mainly focus around an acoustic reggae/indie folk vibe shedding light on themes such as unity, peace, acceptance and love with a twist of activism and social rebellion. Some songs also ask for the listener to dig deeper into their inner selves, by understanding the beauty of the human condition to unlock the core of their loving being.

We have played mainly in the Old City of Nicosia, the south and the north, taking part and performing events centralised around actively reforming unity into the currently separated communities on the island of Cyprus. Despite the serious undertone in the message, we have a very light-hearted approach in the delivery of our philosophies. It is, in the end of the day, all about having good fun and spreading good energy to bring the people together.

We are in the final stages of producing a debut 'live-ish' album which we are looking forward to releasing towards the end of this year. The project is being finalised by Pasi who is currently in Finland, working on the mix and master of the album.

It is our biggest hope to share our music, through the album, with others in order to positively affect people's lives. We believe that we need more conscious positive music in our world that encourages people to be positively aware of themselves and the world around them and by doing so, be able to help change the world, little by little, towards a state where everyone in our community is happy and in touch with themselves.

It would be so amazing and we would be so grateful if the community could help us spread this vision. With your help, we will be able to mix and master the album and share it with others, either through digital or hard copies. So far we, as a band, have done most of the work ourselves but we need some help to push this project out into the world. Our friends have helped us a lot with things such as recording locations and extra equipment. However, we would love to be able to contribute towards the hard work and efforts of all other creatives and artists who have generously involved themselves in our project. These amazing people deserve it!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are hoping to raise €2,300.

Breakdown:

  1. We have a general budget of €1000 towards the mix and master of the 10 tracks.
  2. Roughly €600 to pay all the other creatives and artists who are contributing to the project; Ediz, the website developer, Anna for the album art, Kate for the filming of the project.
  3. Around €500 towards the creation of hard copies of the album and distributing it; Spotify, YouTube, Amazon etc.,  
  4. The extra will be used for packaging and posting. 
  5. Wherever there is a surplus, the extra funds will be allocated to the creatives and artists who worked on this project.  
  • If we do not reach our goal, the priority is towards the mix and master of the album and paying Ediz, the website developer, and Anna, the artist. 

‘’I wrote these songs in a time of great exploration of my inner world and my outer world. The songs were a tool to understand and almost celebrate and be openly curious of all aspects of my being (emotional, mental, spiritual etc). The lyrics written range from politically or socially engaged to spiritually enchanting while also celebrating love, nature, humanity and the different flavours of life. Songwriting voiced my soul’s hopes and love for our world and it is my greatest wish that the album created by Alex & the Dukes will ripple the same effect to others. I would love for others to dive into our music and find their true selves in it because I believe we need more authenticity in this world and more people in touch with themselves in order to actively create some positive change in our planet in this day and age. It is also just a great gift and such fun to see smiles and be with everyone together feeling connected and happy and part of a community when we play music for people. There’s so much love that can go around.’’ – Alex

Thank you for reading and hopefully contributing!

Big love,

Alex & the Dukes x

http://alexandthedukes.com/

story:
Hello. My name is Kerry Blu. I am a singer songwriter and the founder and Production Director of the Empire State Music and Arts Festival. I moved to New York City 5 years ago, in pursuit of a music career; but stumbled into a passion for helping independent artist and young entrepreneurs build their own platforms and connect with other like minded individuals.

As an independent artist and entrepreneur I find that the world constantly tells artist to follow their dreams but rarely gives them ways to do so. The Empire State Music & arts Festival is my chance to not only produce a great show, but move art and culture in a way that will cultivate, expand and expose  the independent artistic community to the world. 

In order to do so we need funding. The world we live in is fueled by money, and most independent artist can barely afford health insurance, let alone fund a music or arts career.  Raising this capital will help us create a solid platform for artist to springboard off of; while also allowing our company an avenue in which we can compete with festivals that have high end budgets; eventually creating jobs opportunities in the independent community. 

When you give we want to make sure that you know how grateful we are. Our perks for gift range from Posters and festival t-shirts, to our festival documentary including interviews and live performances from the festival!

We know that life does not always deal us the cards we want. If for some reason we don’t garner all the support we are looking for, we will distribute funds we receive to the most essential parts of the festival; such as activities and attractions, staff and venues, and of course building the platform through marketing and merchandising. this will ensure that our artist are taken care of, and our attendees have the best experience we can provide.

Over the past 3 years our vision and movement has grown and grown, allowing us to do more and more. We know that continuing to provide these shows will give artist and startups the opportunities they need to be as successful as they want to be.  Everyone deserves their chance to be creative and shine, and by helping us reach our goal, you will be pushing all parties involved to greatness and beyond. 

there are no guarantees when it comes to putting an event like this together, and obstacles are sure to come. trying to reach our goal will be tough. People are hesitant to put their name beside something that doesn't have a guarantee of success. I have had so many artist tell me, “hit me up if you get this person to headline.” or “ you don’t have enough people for me to attend.” making sure we get the word out, and people take us seriously is of the greatest importance. People Take notice to things only after a majority believes. I know that it won’t be easy to compete with the big festivals of today, but thats not our goal. we  want to occupy our own space. we want to provide the best experience that we can for everyone that attends. 

If you can’t give, please help us spread the word! Only by working together can we actually reach our goal. Every eye that we capture can help push us to our goal!
story_txt: Hello. My name is Kerry Blu. I am a singer songwriter and the founder and Production Director of the Empire State Music and Arts Festival. I moved to New York City 5 years ago, in pursuit of a music career; but stumbled into a passion for helping independent artist and young entrepreneurs build their own platforms and connect with other like minded individuals.As an independent artist and entrepreneur I find that the world constantly tells artist to follow their dreams but rarely gives them ways to do so. The Empire State Music & arts Festival is my chance to not only produce a great show, but move art and culture in a way that will cultivate, expand and expose  the independent artistic community to the world. In order to do so we need funding. story:
Resumen

 

Después de dos largos años, he podido plasmar mis composiciones en un primer disco de siete canciones, llamado "Asking Questions".

 
  •  Mi nombre es Óscar, soy de Barcelona, tengo 32 años y soy músico. Y en las filas de Finding Answers, están: Bryan, Germán y David.
  •  Después de pasar por diversas situaciones personales, he escrito letras muy personales y sentidas con las que seguro os sentiréis identificados.
  •  La meta de Finding Answers es que nuestra música, llegue a vuestros corazones. Y cuantos más lleguemos, mejor.
  Lo que necesitamos:
 
 Sobre el presupuesto (3920€)
  • Grabación del segundo álbum "Something Else": 1500€
  • Promoción del primer álbum: 70€/mes
  • VideoClip: 600€ (Queremos hacer un videoclip para la canción "Without Me")
  • Primera impresión de camisetas: 450€ (100 camisetas, ya tenemos el diseño)
  • Impresión de CDs "Asking Questions": 650€ (1000 copias)
  • Impresión de CDs "Something Else": 650€ (1000 copias)

¿Qué pasa si no conseguís todo el dinero?

Tenemos varias metas, cómo habéis podido ver en el presupuesto.

Si conseguimos 600: Grabaremos el videoclip.

Si conseguimos 1000: Videoclip y 1000 copias físicas de nuestro primer álbum.

Si conseguimos 1500: Videoclip, CDs, y primer single del segundo álbum.

Si conseguimos 2000: Grabaremos el segundo álbum y sacaremos copias del primero.

Nuestra Música

 Desde Finding Answers, creemos que nuestra música es única y diferente.
 
  •  Queremos que nuestras letras y melodías lleguen al mundo. Queremos tocar corazones.

 

 

Riesgos y desafíos

 

Sabemos que hoy en día hay mucha competencia y más aún en el mundo de la música. Es por eso que tenemos que invertir en promoción y estamos a la espera de contactar con un Manager para empezar nuestra gira a partir de Septiembre.

 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

 

Algunas personas no pueden colaborar, pero eso no significa que no puedan ayudar:

 
  • Sabemos que muchos no podéis colaborar así que os pedimos la máxima difusión!
  • Por suerte, Indiegogo ofrece las herramientas pertinentes para difundir la campaña!
  • Habla de ello con tus amigos, familiares y compañeros de trabajo! 
 Gracias!

story:
Dear All,

Thank you for landing on this page for whatever reason, I hope it wasn't just the AWESOME pictures haha... but even then
I'm honored to be able to share a few words with you. 
If you have time I'd strongly suggest watching the video not just because it's informative but because I'm HILARIOUS!
Anyways..
IN A NUTSHELL 
As some of you know, this campaign is a fundraising or better say a more personalized way for you to buy our debut record "Where the Mermaids Are". The record is inspired by my many stories as an Iranian American woman born and raised in Iran. This album is basically a dream come true and all I ever wanted to do as an indie musician in Iran so here it is!! With all that said though the purpose of this record is much more, at least thats what I like to think.

You see as an immigrant, a generation zero immigrant or generally anybody who is living in a different location than their up bringing, you go through stories and events in your life that are indescribable. They're the most intense, beautiful , sad, happy and all and all unique things that could happen to a person. From cultural clashes to language barriers to heart break to homesickness, this record represents what it means to be a multi cultured person in the current world. I know many of you no matter what your ethnicity, have experienced some of the same things I have gone through so It's almost like somebody who was born in the other side of the world is writing songs out loud based on what YOU are feeling too and that my friend is the most beautiful connection music can make! Look, we're living in a real challenging time right now. You and I both know that the world is going towards connection! Cultures are mixing up and people from all over the world have the chance to meet each other and get to know each other as humans no matter what their RACE, GENDER or COUNTRY OF CITIZENSHIP is! And thats how it should be! if anyone ever said peace isn't a good thing, they're a BAD person and thats just common sense. Interestingly enough though thats what the world has come to, people want to mix it up but there are some BAD people that feel frightened by the idea of a unified world. It's our job to represent what we want our world to be.

 

I, personally want to eventually live in a world that when I say I was born in Iran people don't take a step back all whilst looking horrified and confused. I want to live in a world where the color of our skin isn't determining if we're worth living! I want to live in a world where I don't get "selected by chance" at the airport for extra monitoring literally EVERY TIME I'm at an airport! I want to live in a world where all of us can be who we want to be and love whom we want to love! I'm proud to say who I am. I love the fact that I'm an IRANIAN AMERICAN WOMAN! I love my Persian culture, I love my American culture and damn it I love being a WOMAN! and "Where the Mermaids Are" represents all of that and don't get me wrong there is also some silly love songs on the record! 

Stylistically this record is mystical! I grew up as a rock musician, studied jazz in college and went back to my Persian roots a few years ago so you can imagine that this album is all that mixed and balanced in the form of music, I like to call it Soul Fusion with a hint of Persian Spice! but thats not all.. the most important thing about this album is that I got to feature and work with some of my favorite human beings on this planet all of whom have different cultural backgrounds. If you want to support diversity you need to present diversity and thats what we did! We're featuring musicians from anywhere from Brazil to Greece to China to Switzerland to Iran so go figure..I'm hoping that this album opens the door to many more culturally involved projects from myself and my fellow colleagues and I also hope that you can join us in this journey and also support anybody else with similar projects and slowly together we can work towards blurring the lines of race by presenting more intercultural arts to the world.

What We Need & What You Get

Well.. we need money .. to continue..making art!

What you get is a truly unique experience or item of your choice as well as involvement in our future projects as much as you're comfortable with. This is not just about me(the creator) making something for you(the audience). It's really about you and I coming together and slowly growing the circle of unity! 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Look I know that damn college life and what it means to live with $2 in your pocket, if you can't financially contribute it doesn't mean that you can't join the journey at all! I urge you to please share this campaign with as many people as possible and I'd still love to take your hand and bring you to my world no matter how much cash you got, you're a FRIEND!Cheers to a better world; one with all colors, all spices and all love in peace!

EXCULSIVE ALBUM PREVIEW : https://soundcloud.com/maryam-mirbagheri/album-...

FEATURING:

Mixed by 3 times GRAMMY award winner Marc Urselli

Mastered by GRAMMY award winner Scott Hull (Sting, Bob Dylan, Miles Davis, Celine Dion etc)

Written and Produced by : Maryam Mirbagheri (MARYAMA)

Performers:

Maryam Mirbagheri (Vocals, Guitar, Setar)

Julian Karahalios (Vocals, Bass)

Maleke Clemmons (Piano)

Marcelo Bucater (Drums)

Michael Olinger (World Percussion)

Linnea Sablosky (Vocals, Cajon)

Nick Hon (Drums)

Sina Dehghani (Daf)

Mixed by 3 times GRAMMY award winner Marc Urselli
Mastered by GRAMMY award winner Scott Hull (Sting, Bob Dylan, Miles Davis, Celine Dion etc)
Written and Produced by : Maryam Mirbagheri (MARYAMA)

story:
My name is Domanique Grant and I am an Indie- pop Singer/ songwriter and award-winning artist from Toronto, with a bit of an uncommon story… but I’ll start with what I am asking for your help with.  This year I will be releasing my debut EP Album PLAYHOUSE in October 2017.  This long-awaited album has inspired a 5,000 square-foot interactive experience that will be featured in Nuit Blanche Toronto, so that all of my fan's can experience it.  I need the help of fans, community leaders, artists, and fellow visionaries to help this dream, 5 years in the making become a reality!

I grew up in a historical housing co-operative in downtown Toronto, surrounded by music and interactive theatre spaces that helped me get my start in writing music, but also informed a love for creating live shows and imagining music in new ways. I have always been a community leader, as I became the youngest ever president of this neighbourhood, lived in between 3 continents before the age of 22, became an ambassador for over 47 countries for Canada's largest ever sporting games, and decided to write a music album because one day I woke up and couldn't define what the meaning of "Home" was, nor could any of my friends.

My debut music album PLAYHOUSE which explores experiences that shape the meaning of home in large cities, however, I want to give my fans the opportunity to experience my music album in a completely interactive experience assessable to all! This fully interactive exhibit can be experienced through touch, sound, and stunning visual displays.  Not only is this a feast for the senses, but it also allows individuals living with vision and hearing problems to experience PLAYHOUSE. 

  • I have raised 75% of the funds needed to create my first interactive album experience and I need your help to raise the rest.
  • Funds raised by this campaign will help me to flawlessly execute this exciting interactive exhibit. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • $5,000 towards materials and equipment to build the 5,000 square-foot interactive exhibit.
  • $5,000 towards an event staff designer’s architects, and musicians working together to create and perform.
  • If this campaign surpasses our goal of $10,000 by 20%, visual elements of the exhibit will be upgraded.
  • If this campaign surpasses our goal of $10,000 by 50%, the exhibit will be upgraded to a full 360-degree experience. 
  • If this campaign surpasses our goal of $10,000 by 80%, we will be able to hire additional artists and performers to make this exhibit even more immersive!

The Impact

  • This fully interactive exhibit features my full debut album, and allows the audience to explore the concept of “Home” across different generations. 
  • This exhibit is fully interactive and fully accessible.  Diversity, inclusion, and sharing different perspectives and life experiences is very important to me.  This exhibit allows individuals living with hearing loss or blindness to experience PLAYHOUSE.
  • I’ve been working on this project for 5 years now.  To be able to complete this interactive multi-sensory experience will make the release of my debut album the spectacle that I’ve always dreamed of!

    How the money will be spent
    $5000 - Venue staffing expenses
    $2500 - Build Materials
    $2500 -Artist expenses

    If we surpass the goal
    A portion of every dollar will go to an organization linked to housing and homelessness

    Team
    Domanique Grant - Producer, Singer- songwriter
    Javid Jah - Designer
    Carol Ann Apilado- Designer
    Meredith Wolting - Props and Scenic design
    Wesley McKenzie - Lighting

story:
Hello, My Name is Chad Ray Crochet. Yes, you say that last name just like your grandmas knitting.

   I'm trying to become the first front man drummer in Country Music history!(notice the bold underline) I put the drums in the front of the stage and sing the entire show. Hard to believe but, I've been doing this for almost a decade. I've played all over the U.S. and have earned thousands of fans a lot of whom are probably reading this right now and for that I thank you!!

   Recently we've caught the attention of two major record labels. They've heard my old album and like it, but they want to hear some new material. Once they've heard that they want to see a showcase. A showcase is a private 30 minute show of your best songs. It's basically the last step in the "interview" process before a label decides to sign you or not.

  We had an investor ready to put up the money we needed and more to pull all of these things off. unfortunately because of a small contract dispute they decided not to stay on board, but not before waiting till after we had it all set up and ready to go. Now we have 2 labels, a producer,photographer,videographer, musicians, sound engineers and a venue waiting on what we said we could deliver. The money raised here, will go towards paying all of those people to get us to the next level!

  Your contributions will impact how well these things are done. $9,643 is the minimum we need to scrap by and at least give these labels something. Anything more than that would only make the quality of the product and show better! These labels have seen it all and heard it all. They are not easy to impress. My show and concept is different enough to turn heads and catch eyes, but I want to blow these people out of the water! I've never done anything half way,I go all out in everything I do. I've always said "Don't worry about what you can't control" so I focus on what I can. For the first time in professional career I can't control my fate in the music industry, only you and the record labels hold my fate in their hands,

 

Between all of my social media platforms from twitter to Facebook I have about 20K fans. Only about 5k of those are active in what I'm doing all the time. Even a donation as small as $2 from those 5,000 fans would put us at our minimum! I'm planning on rewarding the biggest donators  with some of my highly prized equipment!

 If you've ever enjoyed my music for even a second. if you believe country music needs and artist like me on its radio then please donate and share this with everyone you know and promote it as much as you can. This is an opportunity of a lifetime that I don't want to miss. 

 

Thank you all for your time!

It's basically the last step in the "interview" process before a label decides to sign you or not.  We had an investor ready to put up the money we needed and more to pull all of these things off. unfortunately because of a small contract dispute they decided not to stay on board, but not before waiting till after we had it all set up and ready to go. Now we have 2 labels, a producer,photographer,videographer, musicians, sound engineers and a venue waiting on what we said we could deliver. The money raised here, will go towards paying all of those people to get us to the next level!  Your contributions will impact how well these things are done. $9,643 is the minimum we need to scrap by and at least give these labels something. Anything more than that would only make the quality of the product and show better! These labels have seen it all and heard it all. They are not easy to impress. My show and concept is different enough to turn heads and catch eyes, but I want to blow these people out of the water! I've never done anything half way,I go all out in everything I do. I've always said "Don't worry about what you can't control" so I focus on what I can. For the first time in professional career I can't control my fate in the music industry, only you and the record labels hold my fate in their hands, Between all of my social media platforms from twitter to Facebook I have about 20K fans. Only about 5k of those are active in what I'm doing all the time. Even a donation as small as $2 from those 5,000 fans would put us at our minimum! I'm planning on rewarding the biggest donators  with some of my highly prized equipment! If you've ever enjoyed my music for even a second. if you believe country music needs and artist like me on its radio then please donate and share this with everyone you know and promote it as much as you can. This is an opportunity of a lifetime that I don't want to miss.  Thank you all for your time!

story:
Documentary part 1
 
 
Official album teaser
 
 
Album teaser 2
 

 

Short Summary

After nearly two decades in the business in various bands and projects.We have decided to take matters into our own hands and want to raise money for our new album directly from the people who have supported our bands all these years. After a somewhat long period in hibernation Essence of sorrow is finally back in business! This campaign is a way that supporters of a band can know exactly where their hard earned dollars are going. Cutting off the middlemen and keeping it between us (the band) and you our fan.

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign is a vital piece in the financing of these albums. It will be a great way for the people involved in the production to keep in touch with the audience and fans of Essence of sorrow. 

Your contribution and support will enable us to expand this amazing project by adding production value. Funds will go directly to production like recording,mixing and mastering of both albums, and printing costs. Contributions by supporters like yourself, will also have a strong effect for the remaining financing of the total production budget plus additions. (possible merchandise, video(s),vinyl) 

A great part of crowdfunding, is the possibility of giving something back immediately. We promise you frequent updates, feedback, photos and videos from the process, and last but not least; some great rewards based on your generosity! Hopefully you will find a perk appealing to you...If there´s something you´d want but are not available here. Mail us quickly with your request and we´ll see what we can do about it!

Our goal is 20 000€ (before taxes) to cover the costs for both albums. You can still choose which album you want to invest in or if you want to invest in both, with some cool bundles of course. The campaign is set as (flexible) which means if our goal is not reached we have to come up with a new strategy with the money received. 

Making a top notch record comes at a price and we´re quite confident you´ll be as excited as we are about the new material.  Stay tuned for more revealing videos along the process!

So here´s your options.

New Essence of sorrow album  (Title TBA)

Perk 1: Essence of Sorrow (new album) 10€ (Full album digital download incl. digital version of the album cover&booklet artwork)

Perk 2: Essence of Sorrow (new album) Digipak 15€ (plain and simple pre-order)

Perk 3: Essence of Sorrow (new album) Digipak 20€ Fully signed by the band members

Perk 4: Essence of sorrow new album 20€ (Limited edition vinyl)
(Minimum 300 claims. Will be canceled If not reached, money will be returned to sender)

Perk 5: Essence of sorrow new album 25€ (Limited edition vinyl signed)
(Minimum 300 claims. Will be canceled If not reached, money will be returned to sender)

NOTICE! Minimum 300 claims of both the signed and not signed all together)

Perk 6: Special bundle 50€, including: One CD fully signed by the band members, signed band photos. A digital download with hi rez EOS logo and artwork from the new album. Full album digital download incl. digital version of the album cover&booklet artwork. The new Essence of sorrow album (Instrumental version) Hear the album in detail? Get the songs without vocals, dig into the details of the recordings, solo the drums or guitars or maybe take out the leads and record your own leads. You´ll get high quality files of each song as separated stems (drums, bass, rhythm guitars, lead and melody guitars, lead and backing vocals, keys etc)

Essence of Sorrow - Reflections of the obscure (Re-recorded, re-mixed and re-mastered)

Perk 7: Reflections of the obscure 10€ (Full album digital download incl. digital version of the album cover&booklet artwork)

Perk 8: Exclusive CD Digipak 15€ (plain and simple pre-order)

Perk 9: Exclusive CD Digipak 20€ (Fully signed by the existing band members)

Perk 10: Special bundle 50€, including: One CD fully signed by the existing band members, band photos. A digital download with hi rez EOS logo and artwork. Full album digital download incl. digital version of the album cover&booklet artwork. Reflections of the obscure album (Instrumental version). Hear the album in detail? Get the songs without vocals, dig into the details of the recordings, solo the drums or guitars or maybe take out the leads and record your own leads. You´ll get high quality files of each song as separated stems (drums, bass, rhythm guitars, lead and melody guitars, lead and backing vocals, keys etc)

ULTIMATE MEGA SPECIAL BUNDLE

Perk 11: Ultimate mega special bundle: 100€ Both albums fully signed by the existing band members, band photos. A digital download with hi rez EOS logo and artwork for both albums. Digital download of both albums incl. digital version of the album cover&booklet artwork) The new EOS album and Reflections of the obscure album (Instrumental versions). Hear the albums in detail? Get the songs without vocals, dig into the details of the recordings, solo the drums or guitars or maybe take out the leads and record your own leads. You´ll get high quality files of each song as separated stems (drums, bass, rhythm guitars, lead and melody guitars, lead and backing vocals, keys etc)

Thank you!

We want to express our deepest gratitude to everyone who supports this campaign in any way! Sharing a link, liking our page on facebook, supporting financially or just checking out the content - everything helps us to promote this project. Thank you so much and we hope to see you again. 

http://www.essence-of-sorrow.com/

https://www.facebook.com/essenceofsorrow/

https://twitter.com/Essenceofsorrow

Essence of sorrow:

Jani Stefanovic Guitars & Leads (Solution .45, Miseration)

Rolf Pilve Drums (Stratovarius, Solution. 45)

Tom Gardiner Guitars & Leads (ex. Solution .45, ex. Hateform, ex. Red Eleven)

German Pascual Vocals (ex. Narnia, ex. Mind´s Eye, ex. Empire 21)

Jaakko Nikko Bass (Reversion, System Horizon)

story:
Short Summary

Black Calla is a neo-soul, R&B singer who goes by the name Lilly Smith. Lilly, a native of Jacksonville, Florida, has studied instrumental and vocal music for a total of nine years. She has mastered playing the euphonium and, also, leaned to play the trumpet, trombone, piano and tuba.

Ms. Smith began her music career in 2005 at Lavilla School for the Arts in Jacksonville, FL. During her time at Lavilla she began vocal training in 2007. After completing her studies at Lavilla, she enrolled in the Grammy award-winning Douglas Anderson School of the Arts as a double music major. She quickly realized that vocal training was her love. In the summer of 2008, she taught at the First Coast Community Music school under the direction of Jim Daniel when it first opened. Lilly, also, went to the National Conference for the American Choral Directors Association in 2010 and 2011 and sang at the Grammy Award ceremony when the school won it's Grammy for music education in 2011.

After her graduation in 2012, 
Lilly began teaching private vocal lessons, background studio recording, and provided background vocals for local talents like Mama Blue and Kia Nicole.

Black Calla has played in venues in Jacksonville like Burro Bar, The Tobacco Lounge, and Rain Dogs.

 

What We Need & What You Get

At this point in the process I'm still working to get:

  • CD's duplicated
  • Music copy written
  • Musicians
  • Global Distribution (Spotify, Pandora, CD Baby, ect)

The Impact

While creating this E.P. I have struggled severely with anxiety & depression after being raped on my birthday last year. I have used music as a way to release and heal from that trauma and in turn have worked to help the youth in our city struggling with the same traumatic situations. It is my hope that by releasing the music that saved me from suicide, I will help to save others. Music is healing & ever powerful. As musicians, we have the power to make a change. It is my goal to continue to give back to others in the only way that I know how: with music.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share this campaign!
  • Come experience a Black Calla show.
  • Support local musicians.
  • Share the album when released on July 1, 2017

And that's all there is to it.

 

Peace, light, & love.

 

Black Calla

story:
Short Summary

A Day Awaits is a Christian alternative rock band based out of Pennsylvania.  With the soaring vocals of a husband and wife duo and creative instrumentalists, A Day Awaits creates a soundscape that inspires a broad audience. Their technically tight musicianship and poetically pleasing lyrics tell a musical story about a life lived with Jesus through songs that kindle hope, love, courage, and endurance.  A Day Awaits has had the opportunity to open for top Christian artists across the country such as Newsboys, Matthew West, Seventh Time Down, Kutless, Jordan Feliz, Sanctus Real, and many more!

A Day Awaits will be recording their full-length album in Nasvhille, TN at Yackland Studios.  They are working with producer Jeff Quimby.  Through this project, A Day Awaits is hoping to reach and impact lives for Jesus with their music.  With your help, A Day Awaits hopes to use this new album as a platform to speak to people about the love of Jesus and change lives for Him!   Together, with your contributions we can make a difference in the lives of so many.  Please prayerfully consider contributing to our project.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $15,000.  

  • $12,000 for recording
    • 15 days of studio time
    • Producer
    • Engineer
    • Mixing and Mastering
    • Housing at the studio
    • Travel expenses
  • $3,000 for Distribution, Album Art, CDs (Digital and Physical)

The Impact

Music is a powerful tool for reaching hearts. We are recording this album to spread God's truths and Jesus's love to all who hear it. "It's time we pull together and radiate the light. Hope will fill the darkness. Love will rise." Your contributions can make an impact for Jesus on more lives than we'll know.  We are thankful that you are willing to partner with us on this project!  

Risks & Challenges

We realize that this is a huge goal to set, but we are trusting God's calling in our lives and believe that we are heading on the path that he has laid out for our band.  

We understand that there are risks, but we are putting all our trust in Him.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand the reality that you may not be able to give.  We would ask that you help us share our campaign to everyone you know and give us a plug and shout out.  Just a simple share can go a long way toward the success of our campaign.  Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help get the word out!  We can also use all the prayers you can offer. Thank you, from the bottoms of our hearts.

story:
What We Need From You And What You Will Get:

Each donation of $5 will get you an early release of the "Wavess" Single (with Designer Drugs Remix), and our everlasting gratitude, and can ya really put a price on that?

ANY amount helps, so if you only have a dollar and don't know what to do with it WE'LL TAKE IT! Conversely, if you've got a thousand bucks laying around just taking up space WE WILL GLADLY TAKE THAT TOO! ...and et cetera, et cetera..

Now if you are more like us and don't have ANY dollars to spare, please pass this campaign along via any social media site or email, this helps SO MUCH as well..

Any questions? Well just ask.. We would be happy to talk to ya.

story:
The Product

I wrote a two-part work of music titled, not surprisingly, "Mad Dog and Clever Cat" for female choir and piano. The duration of this 58-page composition is 27 minutes. The final sheet music product, which will now be published and available for everyone, includes also a CD-ROM disc with the same sheet music as on paper as multi-page PDF files (several paper sizes) for viewing, printing, and copying, and WAVE and MP3 format files for listening. These instrumental files are useful for getting acquainted with and rehearsing the music, which belongs to "serious" classical choir music genre and is somewhat, but not very, demanding for the performers.

The Bridge

The beauty of this project is how art can be a bridge, connecting people living today, like you and I, with these two great poets who passed away a long time ago, making their fantastic poems, their words, their thoughts, and in a way themselves, alive again. When writing this music, I almost felt their presence. I imagined them writing their lines, perhaps in darkness with a candle on their tables. I am very glad, actually HONOURED, to have made them remembered again. They deserve it.

With your kind help, your spreading the word and hopefully also your financial support, the poems of Oliver Goldsmith and Mary Hannay Foott will be sung by many fine female choirs and played by their fine pianists around the world. Thank you for helping make the voices of O. Goldsmith and M. H. Foott heard again.

The Poems

Elegy on the Death of a Mad Dog in a nutshell: In a town there was a man considered to be kind and gentle. A stray dog went mad and bit him. People swore the man would die. But the man recovered of the bite, and the dog died! (What an allegory.)

Clever Cat in a nutshell: There was a hungry cat, the poorest ever seen, who did not go a-mousing, but only played the tambourine. One day he found a female cat, a real princess, who fell in love with him and his tambourine. They started dancing and from then on, she gave him as much food as he wanted. They lived happily ever after. Now there is a cat, the fattest ever seen, who need not go a-mousing, but who only plays the tambourine.
