story:
***Please scroll down for English version.***

Davne 1991. godine, u vrijeme dok smo (Kornel i Jura) tek započeli studirati, odlučili smo naša intenzivna druženja začiniti i neobaveznim svirkama na raštimanim akustičnim gitarama. Uskoro su se te svirke pretvorile u bučne i radosne, ali ipak poprilično neartikulirane sessione. Tek kada nam se pridružio treći, malo nadareniji momak od nas po imenu Javor (koji je nažalost samo kratko ostao s nama), naši zvučni eksperimenti dobivaju glavu i rep i počinju se nazirati konture onoga što i danas nazivamo "šumski“ zvuk. Koncentrat tog zvuka činili su svi oni sastojci glazbenih utjecaja kojima smo bili inspirirani (od kraut rocka, world music-a, new wave-a, muzike iz animiranih filmova, noise-a do avangardnog popa ili neke pomaknute elektroničke glazbe), kao i zvukovi šume i razni šumovi.

Sveukupno smo snimili četiri albuma (Lov na vile 1993., Safari 1995., Baba spava 2000., Ronioci 2003.) i, u vrijeme kada se relativno malo sviralo, svirali smo na sve strane (Hrvatska, Engleska, Danska, Nizozemska, Švicarska, Belgija, Njemačka, Srbija, Slovenija, itd).

Prijatelji i kritičari za nas su govorili: "Šumski je jedan od najautentičnijih i najosobenijih hrvatskih alternativnih bendova, koji uspijeva ploviti van struje i stvarati glazbu u kojoj se susreću moderno i tradicionalno, eksperimentalno i konvencionalno. Glazbeno na prostoru od eksperimentalnog minimalizma do inovativnih pop pjesama, Šumski uvijek odišu svježinom i dobrim vibracijama."

Nismo puno marili za to, pa smo učinili ono što i najbolji bendovi učine - raspali smo se!

No nakon nekoliko godina pauze, stariji i mudriji, ponovo krećemo u akciju. Uz Kornela Šepera, Viktora Krasnića i Marina Juragu, u novoj proširenoj postavi s nama su gitarist Franjo Glušac (Peach Pit, Brujači, Franz Kafka Ensemble, Cul De Sac) i trubač Igor Pavlica (Haustor, Jinx, Cul De Sac…).

Trenutno u studiju snimamo novi materijal, po našem skromnom mišljenju najbolji do sada! Zaključujemo da je takav materijal zaslužio i ambicioznije izdanje - format vinilne ploče.

Za snimanje albuma izabrali smo odličan Sunday Studios u Svetoj Nedelji i producenta Svena Pavlovića.

Album naslova “Ostrvo ledenog kita” sastojat će se od 10 pjesama našeg prepoznatljivog “šumskog” zvuka, kao šareni kolaž već spomenutih raznorodnih glazbenih utjecaja - afro, kraut, new wave, avant-pop, prog-rock, glazba iz animiranih filmova češke proizvodnje, itd... Objavit će ga stari lisci Geenger Records i Zvuk Močvare.

Album će biti opremljen sjajnim ilustracijama mlade umjetnice Tee Jurišić, čime nastavljamo tradiciju ručno ilustriranih omota naših albuma (omote dva prethodna radio je kultni umjetnik Igor Hofbauer).

Kako nam možeš pomoći, pitaš se? Sudjelovanjem u ovoj crowdfunding kampanji! Pokrenuli smo je jer nam, unatoč dijelu sredstava koje smo uložili u produkciju albuma, nedostaje još $3500 da cijeli projekt i završimo. Zauzvrat, osigurali smo ti naš novi album na vinilu i još nekoliko nagrada pobrojanih s desne strane ovog teksta.

Slušaj taj zvuk - Šumski!

P.S. Prati nas na Facebooku za sve novosti!

 

***For you, our supporter from abroad.***

Back in 1991, just as we (Kornel and Jura) were starting our studies, we decided to spice up the time spent together with casual music sessions on out-of-tune acoustic guitars. Soon, those quiet sessions turned into loud and celebratory ones, but were still quite inarticulate. After we were joined by a third guy, Javor, who was way more gifted than us (but stayed with us for a very short period), our sound experiments became more coherent and the contours of what we now call our sound started to show.

The essence of this sound were all the musical influences that'd inspired us, from kraut rock to world music, new wave, cartoon music, noise, avant-gard pop or outsider electronic music, as well as forest  sounds and various noises.

We've recorded a total of four albums (Lov na vile 1993, Safari 1995, Baba spava 2000, Ronioci 2003) and back when the live music scene in Croatia was at an all-time-low, we played shows all over the place (Croatia, UK, Denmark, Holland, Switzerland, Belgium, Germany, Serbia, Slovenia etc).

Our friends and critics said this about us: "Šumski are one of the truest and most eccentric Croatian underground bands, managing to swim against the current and make music that combines modern and traditional, experimental and conventional elements. Covering an area from experimental minimalism to innovative pop songs, Šumski have always had an aura of freshness and good vibes around them."

We didn't really care about all that, so we did what even the best ones do – we broke up!

However, after a few years of not being a band, we decided to spring back into action, older and wiser. Alongside Kornel Šeper, Viktor Krasnić and Marin Juraga, the new, extended lineup was joined by Franjo Glušac (Peach Pit, Brujači, Franz Kafka Ensemble, Cul De Sac) on the guitar and Igor Pavlica (Haustor, Jinx, Cul De Sac…) on the trumpet.

We're currently recording new material and we think it's our best yet! Also, we concluded that such great material deserves a more ambitious release format – vinyl. We are recording in the Sunday Studio under the watchful eye of recording engineer Sven Pavlović.

The album, “Ostrvo ledenog kita” (Icy Whale Island), will contain 10 songs of our trademark "forest“ sound, a colorful mix of the aforementioned influences - afro, kraut, new wave, avant-pop, prog-rock, music from Czech cartoons and so on... It will be released by Geenger Records and Zvuk Močvare.

The record sleeve will feature awesome illustrations by Tea Jurišić, a young artist, which means that our tradition of hand-illustrated record covers lives on – the covers of our previous two records were illustrated by cult artist Igor Hofbauer.

How can one help us, you may ask? Well, by participating in this crowdfunding campaign, of course!

We started this campaign because, although we've secured a major part of the funds, we're still $3500 short to wrap this whole thing up. In return, we'll give you our new album on vinyl, as well as some other perks listed to the right of this paragraph.

Listen to that sound - Šumski!

P.S. You can follow Šumski on Facebook.

story:
Curt Hanrahan                                        Warren Hanrahan

Artistic Directors/Board of Directors

OUR BEGINNING GOALS:

  • Set up administrative functions and a marketing program.
  • Organize a Milwaukee concert series with featured artists
  • Create education projects including clinics, workshops, and seminars
​The Milwaukee Jazz Orchestra  led by saxophonist and educator Curt Hanrahan assisted by drummer/brother Warren Hanrahan.  It is an A-list roster of Milwaukee musicians who not only swing their behinds off, they have something original to say by way of performances with a perfect balance of classic and contemporary standards and originals that are swinging, soulful, traditional and cutting-edge.
​
Curt Hanrahan is the head of jazz studies at the University of Wisconsin, Milwaukee. He co-founded the Lakeshore Conservatory of Music in Racine Wisconsin, performs with the Milwaukee Symphony. He has worked with artists Tony Bennett, Rosemary Clooney, Cab Calloway, the Jimmy Dorsey Orchestra, Harry Connick Jr., Arturo Sandoval Big Band, Manhattan Transfer, Tommy Dorsey Orchestra, Doc Severinsen, Frank Sinatra Jr. and Ray Charles.

​Drummer Warren Hanrahan graduated from legendary North Texas State Univ. and performed with the renowned 1O’clock Lab Band under Neil Slater. He then moved on to tenures with The Glenn Miller Orchestra and the S.S Norway Big Band. He has performed with Tony Bennett, Paul Anka, Billy Joel, Clark Terry, Keely Smith, John Davidson, Vanessa Williams: and in the Broadway shows Chicago, Godspell, West Side Story and Ain't Misbehavin’: R&B legends: The Drifters, The Duprees, The Shirelles, and TV legends: Milton Berle, Danny Thomas, Sid Caesar, and Skitch Henderson.
​
The MJO was born out of Curt Hanrahan's involvement with the annual Woody Herman Jazz Festival about 5 years ago assembling alumni to guest at the festival every year and began putting a local big band together to perform with the soloists. After doing this for a few years he began to have composers and arrangers write new music for this band and actively seek performance opportunities outside of the Herman festival. Around this time, Curt's son Tim, a bassist, graduated from school with a Jazz studies degree and along with Curt's brother Warren on drums ]wanted to put a family band together. This became the catalyst to record new and old music using some of the finest jazz musicians in the Milwaukee area and together these musicians along with the Hanrahan family became the core of the Milwaukee Jazz Orchestra.

story:
From the Heart

On Sunday, June 25, 2017, Rochester, NY-area musicians of diverse nationalities representing the music of cultures across the world will unite. They'll perform a one-day concert to raise funds for Refugees Helping Refugees, a non-profit organization run by re-settled refugees, that provides vital services for refugees in Rochester, New York. Refugees Helping Refugees.

The United with Music Benefit Concert is helping to raise $25,000. If we can make that goal,ESL Charitable Foundation will match it so that Refugees Helping Refugees can move to a permanent center for its very important services and programs.

This will allow Refugees Helping Refugees to operate extended hours in the evenings and weekends, and offer more services to more refugees, including:

  • English as a second language classes (without knowing the English language they cannot get jobs.)
  • Job Placement
  • Vocational training; Sewing, cooking, and maintenance classes, resume writing, so they can enter the workforce and possibly open their own business
  • Nutrition and exercise classes
  • Activities to give refugees a chance to socialize and keep them from being isolated
  • Transportation to and from doctors appointments and to the immigration office, which is located in a different city. Without this service many refugees would not make their appointments.
     

How You Can Help

  • Donate! Your donation to this campaign will greatly improve the lives of many refugees. 
     
  • Buy tickets to the United Through Music concert where you can enjoy memorable music by well-loved local bands, eat great food, and meet one of the founders and Vice President of "Refugees Helping Refugees," Sadiya Omar who has won numerous awards for her humanitarian work. Tickets are available in General or VIP seating. Purchase through  www.unitedwithmusic.com
     
  • Share this campaign with as many people as you can!
     

Concert Details

We have an exciting line up of musicians and dancers that include:

  • The Mounafayni West African Percussion and Dance Ensemble
  • Irish music - The Dady Brothers
  • Country/Bluegrass singer and guitarist - Mary Ashton
  • Jewish Klezmer music - The New York Klezmer Orchestra
  • Bosnian singer - Fatima
  • Guitarist from South America - Jorge Aparicio
  • Americana music - Mike Joseph
  • Native American Flutist - Brittany Vetter

A private reception will immediately follow the concert where VIP ticket holders will get to meet the performers, enjoy refreshments, and meet some of the founders and staff of Refugees Helping Refugees.

For more information about Refugees Helping Refugees visit www.rhrroc.org  

For more details about the concert go to www.unitedwithmusic.com


What We Need

Production Costs:

  • Musicians fees - $2,000
  • Advertising, community outreach, misc.- $1,800
  • United With Music merchandise and miscellaneous - $1,200

Total Production Costs: $5,000

Fundraising Goal for Refugees: $25,000

Total: $30,000

I depend on volunteers to help organize and support this concert. I believe that generous people like you, with big hearts, will help fund this project and raise money for refugees. This project is from the heart and ALL proceeds will benefit RHR. My payment is feeling like I am doing my best to make a positive difference in peoples lives. I want to "restore people's hope" in humanity and a sense of peace and safety.

- Mary Monroe, United With Music Concert and Fundraiser Organizer

 

What You Get 

Some of the exciting perks include:

  • Digital music downloads
  • Beaded Pins handmade by the refugees
  • T-Shirts
  • Tickets to the concert
  • Surprise Swag Bags
  • The feeling that you are putting hope and peace back into peoples lives who have suffered terribly

 

"United We Stand:" The Story Behind the Concert 

On January 28th 2017, I drove nearly an hour to meet with Nina Alvarez, an editor and media outreach consultant in Rochester, NY. She was going to help me launch my first crowdsourcing campaign to raise money for an album  I had wanted to record for the last 9 years. I should have been excited, but deep down I felt so unsettled. Our country was full of political unrest and the government's first attempt at a travel ban. My plans for my album were going to be put on the "back burner" for a while. I knew the campaign was meant for something much bigger than myself.

It was devastating and paralyzing to hear stories of children being brutally murdered in the streets, families being torn apart, and forced to flee from their homes with whatever they could carry. I could not fathom how anyone can be so cruel. I wanted to jump on the next plane and rescue all the innocent people. Being a mother of two young children, I knew that was not an option. But I was compelled to find my purpose to help this situation.

Praying for inspiration and guidance from the Blessed Mother (to whom I'm devoted) I finally had the answer. In a vision I saw people of different nationalities dancing and singing with each other in a circle unified. In that moment the "United with Music Benefit Concert" was created. I knew I was meant to bring a community together with the uplifting, healing energy of music, and to have musicians of different nationalities representing cultures from around the world be the energy of unity, and an example to the world that we all can live together in peace. 

What better way for me to give back then to use my 25 years experience with multi-media productions and music performance to make the world a better place. Just like "The Little Drummer Boy," music is the gift I can give. For many years I kept hearing spirit say "Build it and they will come." I did not know what "it" was or who "they" were, then suddenly it all made sense.

On February 3, 2017 I went to a rally for refugees in Rochester, NY with my like-minded new friends Tracy Cretelle, and Nina Alvarez. It was 18 degrees Fahrenheit and my fingers were so cold I could barely feel them, but I did not care. It was not about me. In that moment I saw the beauty of camaraderie and solidarity. A sweet Muslim gentleman, who was providing tea to as many cold people as he could, handed me a cup of delicious tea. Not only did it warm my body but it warmed my soul. I saw a rainbow of people from different races, and religions gathered together to support each other.  It gave me the energy and enthusiasm I needed to start working on "United with Music."

Because a brave seven-year old girl named Bana Alabed, from Aleppo, Syria, shared her story, I was awakened to the reality of the terror, sadness, and loss she and many other children were suffering.  It just horrified me to think of my own children having to go through this.  It was then that I knew the main focus of the concert should be raising money for refugees. Bana documented her story through twitter, and captured the world's attention, while being trapped between the Syrian regime and opposition militias, and finally making her escape to Turkey with her family. Luckily they did not end up in a refugee camp. Her memoir Dear World is being published by Simon and Schuster.  I know she will inspire many more people.
 

At first I did not know what non-profit organization would benefit from this concert. I wanted the money to be able to help refugees locally.  Then I heard about "Refugees Helping Refugees" from Tracy Cretelle. When I researched RHR I discovered what a significant role they play in the lives of so many refugees. Their help is needed more than ever now that refugees only receive 30 days assistance from the government, I knew this is where the money needed to go.

It's important to acknowledge that it takes a team to accomplish great things, and the right people will arrive just when you need them. My heart is warmed by how people have shown interest and great compassion towards this project. I am grateful to my husband, Mark Shannon, for working full time and then coming home to help with household duties and care taking so I can put in the time to "United with Music" to ensure it's success. I stay motivated and energized by my friends Tracy Cretelle, and Nina Alvarez, who are volunteering their time to organize and promote the concert.

I have seen real beauty and caring in people like Pastor Doug and the staff at The Lutheran Church of the Incarnate Word, who have donated the church space for the concert, the musicians who have volunteered their time or have reduced their fee to perform, and to all the people who are and continue to volunteer, donate, attend the concert, and spread the word. 

If you'd like to volunteer we can use your help. Please contact Mary Monroe at marymonroe@unitedwithmusic.com

What better way for me to give back then to use my 25 years experience with multi-media productions and music performance to make the world a better place. Just like "The Little Drummer Boy," music is the gift I can give. For many years I kept hearing spirit say "Build it and they will come." I did not know what "it" was or who "they" were, then suddenly it all made sense.
On February 3, 2017 I went to a rally for refugees in Rochester, NY with my like-minded new friends Tracy Cretelle, and Nina Alvarez. It was 18 degrees Fahrenheit and my fingers were so cold I could barely feel them, but I did not care. It was not about me. In that moment I saw the beauty of camaraderie and solidarity. A sweet Muslim gentleman, who was providing tea to as many cold people as he could, handed me a cup of delicious tea. Not only did it warm my body but it warmed my soul. I saw a rainbow of people from different races, and religions gathered together to support each other.  It gave me the energy and enthusiasm I needed to start working on "United with Music."

Because a brave seven-year old girl named Bana Alabed, from Aleppo, Syria, shared her story, I was awakened to the reality of the terror, sadness, and loss she and many other children were suffering.  It just horrified me to think of my own children having to go through this.  It was then that I knew the main focus of the concert should be raising money for refugees. Bana documented her story through twitter, and captured the world's attention, while being trapped between the Syrian regime and opposition militias, and finally making her escape to Turkey with her family. Luckily they did not end up in a refugee camp. Her memoir Dear World is being published by Simon and Schuster.  I know she will inspire many more people.
 
At first I did not know what non-profit organization would benefit from this concert. I wanted the money to be able to help refugees locally.  Then I heard about "Refugees Helping Refugees" from Tracy Cretelle. When I researched RHR I discovered what a significant role they play in the lives of so many refugees. Their help is needed more than ever now that refugees only receive 30 days assistance from the government, I knew this is where the money needed to go.
It's important to acknowledge that it takes a team to accomplish great things, and the right people will arrive just when you need them. My heart is warmed by how people have shown interest and great compassion towards this project. I am grateful to my husband, Mark Shannon, for working full time and then coming home to help with household duties and care taking so I can put in the time to "United with Music" to ensure it's success. I stay motivated and energized by my friends Tracy Cretelle, and Nina Alvarez, who are volunteering their time to organize and promote the concert.
I have seen real beauty and caring in people like Pastor Doug and the staff at The Lutheran Church of the Incarnate Word, who have donated the church space for the concert, the musicians who have volunteered their time or have reduced their fee to perform, and to all the people who are and continue to volunteer, donate, attend the concert, and spread the word. 
If you'd like to volunteer we can use your help. Please contact Mary Monroe at marymonroe@unitedwithmusic.com

story:
Ghost Dance Band hails from Waco, TX. Members of the band come from all backgrounds but what we have in common is a love of the music.

Cody Dollins fronts the band, singing and playing acoustic guitar. He is also a professional bull rider and goes to school at Tarleton State University, we often call him the 'Golden Child'.

Weston Dodd plays lead guitar and has no idea how he ended up in a country band. He is not as accomplished as his brother Cody but somehow managed to father a beautiful little girl.

Will Prescher plays rhythm guitar and we call him 'grizzly'. Not because he is large and burly and beardy, but because he was actually raised by grizzlies. He's also a scientist. Conducts experiments with his bear hands.

Ben Bruton holds down the low end on bass guitar, you could say he brings the beef. Also, although he is the second youngest member of the band, he most definitely looks the oldest... bad genes I suppose. So it goes.

Chris Smith brings the thunder, and he plays the drums too. He keeps everyone in line and on time. We're also pretty sure he's found the fountain of youth. 

 

The way this gnarly group came together, well.. it could only be fate. The mighty gods of music thought it would be comical to throw us all in a room together and see what happens. Little did they know, our differences would come together, and like alchemy, fuse the mediocre talents of each member into one giant shining nugget of pure gold.

We want to share that nugget with the world. That's why we decided to put together a preorder campaign for our debut EP 'Rituals'. The album is done but we have so many awesome pieces of artwork and concepts that we've come up with, and because we depleted our funds on making the highest quality music we could possibly afford, we need to turn to you guys for help in getting this awesome merchandise produced.

story:
Get Down Till We Rise Up

We are surviving in trying times. As we show up again and again to resist capitalism and oppression we gotta make sure we also sustain our joy and love for our communities. 

  • HΞ∆RTILLΞRY was created in 2016 to help nourish us, and we hope as we grow this melodies can also bring more people out so we can move together.
  • With your support we can record all of the beats we've created over the last year so we can share them with everyone who has come out to dance with us!
  • Your support can help us bring these subversive verses and starry sweeps to new listeners and build connections with new creators!

Your donation makes it possible for us to share this music and passion with people everywhere! It holds space for celebration and community despite the overwhelming push towards isolation and alienation.

Asking For What We Need

  • Your funding will help us get the support we need from folks who have experience with recording, and will help us invest in microphones and synthesizers to enliven our performances!
  • We want to be able to play and mix our music live, but the equipment to do so is currently out of our price range. Your donation will help make our shows more lively!
  • To show our appreciation and so we're offering perks like stickers, T-Shirts, even live performances for folks ready to help us grow!

Other Ways You Can Help

Supporting with your $$$ is really such a gift for artists struggling to create in constricted economies, but there are so many other ways you can help us create!

  • Please share this campaign with music lovers, new lovers, and maybe your rich uncle?
  • We're looking for photographers and videographers to help us create media to get our music out into the world. If this is you, please say hi!
  • If you want to book us for a show, also feel free to reach out, as we're always excited to play gigs and benefits!

story:
What's this all about?

Hi guys. Thanks so much for your interest in my first EP.

I'm Chelsea Takami, a singer/songwriter from Long Island. I've been passionate about writing and performing music my entire life. I started on piano and flute when I was around 4 years old, but it wasn't until I picked up a guitar at the age of 14 that I felt I truly found my calling.

This EP has been a long time in the making. Some of my songs are 10 years old (some older!) and it's only now that I feel I am 100% ready to take this next step. I wanted to make sure I could produce the BEST quality album possible. And now that I'm ready, I won't be able to do this without you guys, so I'm calling on you to help me make my dreams come true!

Over the past year since I made the switch to performing full-time, I've grown in ways I never would have imagined were possible. My voice and guitar chops have become much stronger, I've gained confidence in myself, and there is a fire in my heart that drives me to succeed every day. I love waking up, I love the way my life is unfolding, and I feel like I am finally fulfilling my purpose. But why is all of this happening?

The reason is you. Your support, time, generosity, and love  has absolutely changed my life. You have truly opened my eyes to the beauty of humanity, and now I know for certain that my path and meaning in life is to create, perform, and share music to connect with you and make your lives better, just like you've done for me. Your support is everything!

 

What I Need & Why I Need It:

I need to raise $20,000 to cover the cost of the project. This money will be used to cover:

Studio Time: the producer, engineer, studio musicians, mixing, and mastering. The album is being produced at Cove City Sound Studios in Glen Cove. Cove City has worked with many successful artists, and celebrities like Mariah Carey, Celine Dion, JLo, and Jon Bellion. Richie Cannata, the owner of CCSS (the Saxophonist on Billy Joel's classic albums) has sold over 150 million albums. The quality of their work is top-tier. I visited many studios, and as soon as I set foot in CCSS and spoke with Richie, I knew this was the one I wanted to use.

Album Artwork: photographer, artist, graphic design.

Camera Crew and Video Production: I plan on making at least one official music video and also want to include behind-the-scenes footage to document and share this milestone in my career.

Production and Distribution of the EP: Creating actual physical copies of the album as well as making it available to stream and download online on iTunes, Spotify, Pandora, etc.

Marketing and PR: Hiring a publicist to facilitate coverage in music blogs, magazines, etc., social media outreach, and website design.

 

Risks & Challenges

As with any major project, there will of course be risks and challenges. I want to be transparent with you, so I'm going to go over some of these projected risks and how I plan on overcoming the obstacles.

What if I don't raise enough money? If I don't raise enough money, the project won't be the best it can be. I'd have to cut corners, it would be a mess, and I would be upset. I believe the key to preventing this is prior research on similar campaigns, excellent marketing, prepping the public, and keeping my supporters well informed. Also, offering excellent perks and "thank-you" gifts to all you amazing contributors, and making sure you know how appreciated you are and that you are a HUGE part of this entire process.

Will the album be profitable? Of course there is always a risk that any project could be a total flop, but once again I truly believe that the key to overcoming this is in the preparation. So here are some of the ways I've prepared:

Before I created this campaign, I paid for a consultation with esteemed producer Matty Amendola, who has a ton of experience in running similar successful campaigns, and he helped me tremendously with my expectations and plans on running my own.

There's a reason that almost half of the funds raised will be going towards professional marketing -- hiring the right team to reach the target audience, gain more fans, and spread the word will catapult the success rate of this EP and launch my career to the next level.

Lack of song material, organization, etc: Not an issue here, on any account. I have hours of material, which actually makes it a bit more of a challenge when it comes to choosing which songs to put on the EP. But luckily, I've hired one of the best teams in one of the best studios on Long Island to help me with picking and arranging songs, and believe me, they're doing an amazing job.

Why should you invest in my project? I've always been able to achieve success at any challenge I've put my mind to. I graduated High School top 10% in my grade (winning "Best Musician" in the yearbook superlatives - gotta prove them right!), then graduated college (Bachelor's of Art in Music Performance and Composition!) in 3 years with a GPA of 3.89 and an award in music. After making the decision to pursue a life of music, it took me less than a year to be able to fully support myself financially by only performing. I gig an average of 6 times a week and I love every moment of it. It all came through hard work and focus. I know that I have what it takes to make this album a success in every way because I am putting all of my energy and focus into doing so.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you really want to help but are unable to contribute financially, that's okay! Here's what you can do:

MAKE SOME NOISE!! Spread the word to all your friends and family and shout me out on social media! Tell the world about my project! 

I love you guys so much and I thank you, thank you, THANK YOU for your love and support!

story:
Jimmy P Brown II - Deliverance

For the first time, you as a Friend of Deliverance will hear and experience the Original Concept as it was originally intended to release:

  • The Camelot in Smithereens Story with Book Release and All Sonic Theatrics.
  • This Album's message was lost in the original release, but can now be realized for the Friends of Deliverance to Hear and Experience the story of Lindsey.
  • This campaign will fully complete the story with a Full Re Record as originally conceived.
  • The offered perks will be a limited release to the Crowd Funders for this project.

What We Need & What You Get

The Camelot Experience will give you the opportunity to participate in realizing the concept in full totality of Jimmy P Brown's vision!

  • A Minimum of $10,000 will be needed for this project to see the light of day! Unless more demand comes, ONLY 300 of these Special Exclusive Releases will be yours! Your funding will go to the following:
  • Studio Time
  • Travel for the musicians participating in the project and their time.
  • Book, DVD, CD, Posters and T-Shirt Printing
  • This ReDux will be unique in that it will NOT be released to the General Public in this format! It will ONLY be for those of you that participate in the ReDux of Camelot in Smithereens.
  • If the minimum of goal is not reached, the crowdfunders will be given a full refund if funds are not sufficient to fulfill the commitment in the entirety as presented here. NOTE: All Participants have given their blessing to move forward with the recording, whether goal is met or not.

Risks & Challenges

The Goal of this project will be in the following order:

  • Preliminary tracks have been recorded, but much more is needed to complete the project! 
  • After the Music is recorded, Voiceover Actors will be hired and recorded, along with original scored music interludes.
  • Release Date will be No Later than October 31st, 2018. For the DVD, CD, Book, Poster and T-Shirt.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you are unable to contribute, as a Friend of Deliverance, help us to get the word out and make some noise about the Camelot ReDux campaign.

story:
Help Create Rival Tides' New Album!

We have an album of material that we know in our hearts you’ll love. Are you ready to hear it?

  • We wrote and demoed a lot of new songs. We’ll then be cutting those down to leave only the best of the best. Those final songs will be recorded and arranged nicely for our first full-length album. 
  • The costs of recording an album at the production quality you’ve come to expect from us can be high. We need your help! 
  • With your support, we know this will be our biggest and best release ever. If you believe in us (thank you!), we won’t let you down!

Why Pledge?

Making music is expensive, BUT it’s an investment. We’ve already invested a lot of time, energy, ideas, creativity, and more. Your investment will allow our efforts to truly be felt. This will allow us to make the album of our dreams. That “our” is both the band’s dreams and hopefully yours. We’re creating something that we really think you’ll want to hear.

You're Guaranteed to Get Something Out of This

Every pledge you make includes some great perks.

  • Ever wanted to be in a Rival Tides video? It's one of the perks!
  • As the pledges increase, the sweet stuff increases too. We’ll be doing a lot of custom things for our supportive fans.
  • Even pledging just $1 gets you looped in on our studio updates. If everyone who’s ever listened to a Rival Tides song or “liked” us online, we’d hit this goal really fast and it would be awesome. Every little bit helps!

Exclusive T-Shirt Perk

One of the amazing pledge tiers includes an exclusive Rival Tides t-shirt. These will be made to order, only for those who pledge $40 or more. 

Where Does Your Pledge Go?

Our $10,000 goal will go toward:

  • Studio time. This is just a portion of that cost, and there will be other expenses we'll face through the production process.
  • We’ll handle the rest of the costs, but your financial support will allow us to make this recording happen.   

Help Spread the Word!

Waiting for payday, but want to help out now? You can support by telling your friends both in-person and online about Rival Tides. Share our music, share this campaign. If you need to put headphones on your friends’ heads to get them to listen, that’s great too.

The more people know about Rival Tides, the better! 

Want a Challenge? We Have Stretch Goals!

If you’re the type who puts in 110% and then asks, “What else can I do?” we have some extra goals to hit! 

  • If we make it to $14,000, we’ll release the album on sweet colored vinyl too! It’s pricey, but we want it to be an option. If we hit this goal, there’ll be an option to upgrade/swap out the CDs if you’d like. We’ll make it fair, not $50 for a record or something ridiculous.
    Plus, if we reach this goal, we’ll randomly give away a copy of the test press to one lucky backer.
  • We have another couple stretch goals in mind too. More on that later.

 

All band photography by Jamie Weiland Photography

story:
We are ABNDN. We're a pop duo of singer/songwriter, Alex Foreman and producer, Tim Evans. We've just finished producing our debut EP, "Breakaway". We've been working on it for well over 12 months, producing a sound that is unique with song that have meaning. Now that it's finished, we're super proud of how it sounds.

However, there are further things to take into account that will take this EP from the laptop in the studio into the publics hands... the long-short of it is that we need funds.

Here's where this campaign comes into play. We wanted to create a way that we could receive financial support without it being a charity. This campaign proves to do that. With each amount that you pledge, you are essentially pre-ordering the EP, as well as other merch. That way, you are investing in something that will end up in your hands.

There is a diverse range of pledge levels ranging from entry-level pledges that get a physical copy of the CD delivered to you, all the way up to high-level sponsorship pledges that get your name written into the "thank-you's" on the physical release of the CD as a contributor.

This is a dream of ours that is so close to being a reality, but the reality of the situation is that we need funds to do so. We're calling on you guys to help us make it happen and we truly value anything that you can contribute, and we know that, in turn, you will be greatly blessed by our record.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We've set our goal for $7,500. Thankfully, being a songwriter/producer duo, much of the production cost of creating a record of this standard has already been covered (i.e. studio time, mixing, mastering, ect.) What we're left with is everything else that comes along with releasing a record. This $7,500 will cover:

  • Design work
  • Photography
  • Printing
  • Shipping
  • Framework media production
  • Photography
  • Creative contributions
  • Marketing
  • Digital distribution

A large portion of the funds is directly relative to producing the physical items that you pre-order through this campaign; the remaining funds cover the other areas of production as well creating a small amount of revenue to help continue the production of future releases (which we already have some stuff in mind).

Here's an overview of some of the things you'll be able to pre-order through this campaign:

  • Physical CD
  • Posters
  • Signed copies of the CD
  • Limited 10" Transparent Vinyl
  • T-shirts
  • Sponsorship recognition

If for any reason we do not reach our goal, we will still endeavour to get what you pre-order in production. We've established a solid framework of working with "small-run" companies, so we will be able to produce what is required... but we hope to meet our goal

The Impact

We're young musicians with a dream, but we're convinced that we have the goods. What you contribute is not about us making a living, but rather, it's making dreams and passions become a reality. We know that we have many people that believe in us and believe in the content that we produce... we just want to make it real.

Risks & Challenges

Financially, as it is with many artists... it's a tough road. We both work casual jobs and odd jobs here and there to self-fund our music passions as best we can. It's what we pour our lives into, because it's what we do best. The reality is, that it's the music industry, and it's a hard industry to make it in. Although we're confident in what we can bring, the horizons of the music industry are always a bit unsure... but with this campaign, at least we've got a shot. We're in it for the long haul, no matter what it looks like.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to be able to give financially, there are definitely other ways you can help. A huge element to the success of an artist in this day and age is through social networking. Give our Facebook page a like. Follow us on Instagram. Share our pre-order campaign and encourage people to get involved. No "like" goes unnoticed. Sometimes, a "like" is enough affirmation to keep us dreaming and keep us creating.

 

Love and blessings

story:
Summary

Hello! My name is Eugene, and I am a composer and drummer based in New York City with a huge passion for jazz and original music. I'm currently finishing my Masters of Music in Jazz Studies at Queens College's Aaron Copland School of Music, one step closer to my dream of the highest musical heights after my graduation from Berklee College of Music. Over the years, I've received numerous accolades such as the "Duke Ellington" and "Benny Golson" Awards for my compositional skill and the "Steve Gadd" Award for my performance skill.

Throughout my career, I've had the honor of sharing the stage with some of the world’s most celebrated jazz musicians such as Orlando Le Fleming, Samuel Torres, and Terence Blanchard among others. I've also been lucky enough to study with musical greats such as Gary Burton, Bill Charlap, Greg Hopkins and Mark Walker.

Last year, I managed to fund and independently produce my debut album " A Blueprint for Tomorrow" with the help of my numerous backers via Indiegogo. As time passes, musicians grow and I am no different; I have so much new music to share, but once again, I really need your help to produce my new album: "Origin Story"!

I have a dream to become a world class musician and educator, and this is a starting point for me. With this album, I would be able to share not only the enjoyment I get out of music, but also my approach to drumming and composition. This album (with your help!) would potentially endure the test of time and serve to be a lasting showcase of my methodology.

What We Need & What You Get

Any musician would know that producing an album is no mean feat. The manpower and logistics involved can be staggering! Artists have to worry about musician costs, studio costs, engineer costs, artwork... the list goes on. Furthermore, as a self-produced artist with no label, the economies of scale are against me and access to the aforementioned amenities are self-sourced and usually more expensive.

A conservative estimate puts my musician costs, studio costs, engineering costs and logistical costs of releasing the album at upwards of $4000USD. I've managed to scrape together some money, but it gets hard as a full-time student to meet the full amount.

So please help me realize my dreams and contribute to this project! You may "pre-order" the album through this platform, and depending on your decision, also receive some of my other music. As an educator, I am also offering lessons in drumming, composition or arranging. Furthermore, my arranging/composition expertise is also up for grabs at a discounted price; check out the Perks for your options!

Every little bit helps! Please consider contributing as little as $10 for the digital download of my upcoming album, "Origin Story"!

The Impact

As mentioned, I have a dream of becoming a world-class musician and educator and wish to contribute to society by being as learned in the 3 main aspects of music (in my opinion) as possible: the Theoretical, the Practical and the Sociological.

However, I cannot do this alone. I need to produce music and put it out there to make a difference.

Other Ways You Can Help

And so, please contribute in whatever way you can, and I will be eternally grateful and perhaps we could both benefit from this shared endeavor.

Even if money is tight for you, I would appreciate if you use the Indiegogo share tools and get the word out - make some noise on my behalf?

Thank you so much for reading, and I hope our paths do cross and you allow me the opportunity to share my music with you!

More Info:

Website: https://eugeneseowmusic.com
Facebook Artist Page: https://www.facebook.com/eugene.seow.music/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/walksintowalls
Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/user/grimfortunecookies

story:
INTRODUCING OURSELVES

We are Fiammetta Tarli and Ivo Varbanov, and we are organising a new classical music series in the heart of London:

 

Clerkenwell International Music Series

 

Both of us are classical pianists performing all over Europe, with more than 20 commercial recordings under our belt (Hyperion, Gega New, BNR, and ICSM Records). Since 2014 we also run a small independent label, ICSM Records. This project was also partly funded via crowdfunding (on a different platform), indeed, at the time it was the best supported classical music project in the UK.

Starting in February 2018, we have planned two concerts per month, all of them held on a Wednesday evening at 7:30pm at the Priory of the Museum of the Order of St John – a mediaeval order of knights. The Priory is situated in Clerkenwell, a lively corner of London with excellent restaurants and a vibrant culture.

For the first edition of our Series we will have a total of 18 concerts, varying in theme and in style. Their programmes include classical, jazz, fusion, and improvisation: a feast for every music lover.

First of all, we want to say a huge thank you to everyone who is helping to make our new Music Series possible.

THE SERIES

Please take a look at the 2018 concert list below.

7 February 2018 –  American Dreams   – Viv McLean, piano

21 February 2018 – French Pictures – Vincent Larderet, piano

7 March 2018  – Clarinet Journey – Claudio Mansutti, clarinet - Federica Repini, piano

21 March 2018 – Romantic Soaring – Antonio Di Cristofano, piano

11 April 2018 – The Young Voice of the Violin – Elisso Gogibedaschwili, violin – Maria Meerovitch, piano

25 April 2018  – A Schumann Evening – Ofer Falk & Lana Trotovsek, violins, Roger Chase, viola, David Cohen, cello, and Fiammetta Tarli, piano

9 May 2018 – Czech Idyllic Paths – Martin Kasik, piano

16 May 2018 – The Art of the Piano – Dennis Lee & Chee Hung-Tao, piano

6 June 2018 –  Music by a Free Thinker – Boyan Vodenitcharov, piano

13 June 2018 – Motown and Magic – Antonio Forcione, guitar

4 July 2018  –  Brahms’s Inconsolable Longing – Tanya Nisonen, Ofer Falk, Ivo Varbanov

26 September 2018  – Time In Time Out – Acoustic Version, jazz Trio

3 October 2018 – Romantic Attitudes – Fiachra Garvey, piano

17 October 2018 – Artist TBC  

7 November 2018 ­– Artist TBC

21 November 2018 – The Poet Speaks – Ludmil Angelov, piano

 

What we want to do in the Clerkenwell International Music Series is to provide a platform for outstanding independent performers, some of whom are London-based, and some are guest artists who rarely perform in the UK.

The programmes proposed here are truly diversified, yet what these concerts all have in common is that the artists invited are independent and pursue excellence in every performance.

Classical music today is in need of courageous artists. First and foremost, they want to give back to music the uncompromising independence without which it solely becomes a byproduct of marketing and the “star system”. We believe that art created independently has the sparkle capable of brightening people’s life.

This is why supporting such artists and their work is so paramount today.

 

HOW YOU ARE HELPING US WITH YOUR CONTRIBUTION

If you decide to help us, your contribution will go towards paying part of the expenses related to the complicated matter of organising an international series of concerts with artists coming from all over Europe.

Nowadays it is hard to pay an artist a normal fee and organise a classical music concert which breaks even by relying on ticket sales. Without public funding for classical music, different routes need to be taken in order to maintain the professional level required and pay the artists a fair fee for their work. They deserve to be compensated not only for their exceptional playing, but also the high volume of preparation that they have undertaken before each performance. Crowdfunding, that is, YOUR support, is now more vital than ever.

Below you can see a list of expenses included in the budget (£53,050) of the series:

Artist fees (£26,400)

Artist expenses (£3,240)

Rent of the Venue (£6,732)

Piano Costs (tuning, maintenance, and transport) (£6,550)

Marketing (advertisement and brochure) (£5,278)

Administrative expenses and fees (£5,300)

 

 

 

We have planned different ways to finance the season through sponsorships, memberships for the series and, of course, ticket sales. So, even in case our goal is not reached, all the funds collected here will help us cover some of the budget areas indicated above.

SOME WORDS ABOUT THE GRAND PIANO

The instrument for the series will be a Steingraeber grand piano – something very rare in London. These instruments handcrafted in Bayreuth (Germany) have a long history of excellence behind them - they were Liszt and Wagner’s grand pianos of choice. Their exquisite palette of colours and warm sound make them among the best pianos on the planet.

 

PROMOTION

In order for the project to reach a wide audience, we are going to promote the series in the capital, in national press, in social media, so that as many people as possible are aware that a new, exciting music season is about to start.

 

 

 

WHAT YOU WILL GET IN RETURN FOR YOUR HELP

If you choose to support us, please take a look at the outline below, where we detail the special perks we have prepared for our supporters. For our faraway friends in Europe: there are perks especially for those who won't be able to attend the concerts.

Every major supporter can choose the concert and performer they like and become a patron of the concert with their name at the top of the concert evening (website, brochure, and advertisement).

Everyone can be rewarded with tickets and/or get our label’s recordings, plus other special perks, including a concert at your home, music lessons, and even…dining together with the artists of the series after the concert!

 

With your help, we are sure the series will become a success!

Thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

story:
Overview

City Worship Night is a gathering of the Church of West Michigan for an evening of worship through music. City Worship Night is hosted by Wake Robin, a 501c3 non-profit lead by Brian and Mandy Miller for the purpose of spiritual awakening and renewal.

The vision of City Worship Night is to see the Church of West Michigan come together and encounter God as we worship thorugh music.  As we experience God in times of worship, we are able to express our hearts to him and hear his heart for us. City Worship Night provides these opportunities.

Mandy is an accomplished and passionate worship leader and song-writer. You can find her music on iTunes, Spotify and anywhere good music is sold. www.mandyjoymiller.com

Brian is a seminarian studying Christian Thought at Gordon-Conwell Theological Seminary. He plays guitar and serves a local church as a Pastor.

 

How You Can Help

As with any endeavor, there are cost associated with hosting monthly City Worship Night gatherings. This is where you can help! We have some amazing percs that will allow you to help us continue City Worhip Nights in 2018.

 

The Impact

Your donation will allow us to continue to host City Worship Nights at venues located in downtown Grand Rapids. Your support is so helpful in sustaining these gatherings and keeping them free of charge.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spreading the word about our campaign and about our gatherings would be so helpful. Please take a moment to share what we are doing on your social media.

story:
At Ensworth Guitar, we are taking historic woods from personal properties such as cabins, boats, trees with both historic and sentimental value, and creating works of art to be passed down from generation to generation.  Every guitar is a completely unique, custom design and each comes with a certificate of authenticity with as much information as is available about the type, age, and source of the wood.

Beyond the history, our guitars are of superior sound and quality.  The neckthrough design allows more sustain.  Musicians know vintage woods on guitars have more tone and resonance than new guitars with a polyurethane finish.  We are literally building vintage guitars from materials that founded this country and the families that pioneered our land!  Each guitar is finished by branding our logo into the headstock with a hot iron!

We have been operating in solely in Nashville and we'd like to expand our business to the public.  This campaign is to see the scope of the demand beyond Music City, help us build up our new shop for increased production, and to acquire as much historic wood as possible before it's gone forever.

Our recommended perk is a future customer, a down payment on a low, one-time wholesale priced Ensworth Guitar.  Other perks include discounts, custom leather straps, nice clothing, hand-wound pickups, and raffle tickets!

 

    "I have been building guitars from cabin wood for the last 5 years.  Building these guitars is a labor of love. During the hours that I spend sawing, filing, carving and sanding this wood, I often find myself reflecting on the effort, pride, resolve and all the human feeling that went into felling the trees, hand hewing them into logs, cutting them to fit each other, lifting them into place, chinking and daubing the spaces between the walls, and moving into a small, safe place in a great, harsh wilderness. These buildings were used, sometimes for many generations, by pioneering families as shelter and protection for their families and livestock.  The wood these guitars are made of is truly rare and there will never be any more than exists today.

     I was encouraged by family, friends and several working professional musicians to begin making them for the general public. The cost of building the guitars is expensive. The time to build them is considerably longer than with other wood types due to termite, worm and beetle damage inside otherwise sound looking pieces, which must be removed, worked around or repaired to end up with a top quality guitar when it is finished. I can get enough wood right now to produce 4-5 years of guitars, at a rate of one guitar completed every couple of weeks.

     Pioneers used to brand their property for identification. Most people are aware of the branding of horses and livestock. They may not be aware that they used to brand many of their possessions, saddles, wagons, trunks, harnesses, etc. In the spirit of this tradition I will be branding the Ensworth name into the headstock of each guitar.

     Owners of these guitars will have, not only a truly custom guitar of exceptional quality, but one made from the rarest of woods available. The guitars are heirloom quality and will bring the owners and their heirs’ pleasure for generation after generation."

- Ed Harnage, Luthier                         

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  •  Use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
At Ensworth Guitar, we are taking historic woods from personal properties such as cabins, boats, trees with both historic and sentimental value, and creating works of art to be passed down from generation to generation.  Every guitar is a completely unique, custom design and each comes with a certificate of authenticity with as much information as is available about the type, age, and source of the wood.
Beyond the history, our guitars are of superior sound and quality.  The neckthrough design allows more sustain.  Musicians know vintage woods on guitars have more tone and resonance than new guitars with a polyurethane finish.  We are literally building vintage guitars from materials that founded this country and the families that pioneered our land!  Each guitar is finished by branding our logo into the headstock with a hot iron!

We have been operating in solely in Nashville and we'd like to expand our business to the public.  This campaign is to see the scope of the demand beyond Music City, help us build up our new shop for increased production, and to acquire as much historic wood as possible before it's gone forever.

Our recommended perk is a future customer, a down payment on a low, one-time wholesale priced Ensworth Guitar.  Other perks include discounts, custom leather straps, nice clothing, hand-wound pickups, and raffle tickets!

 
    "I have been building guitars from cabin wood for the last 5 years.  Building these guitars is a labor of love. During the hours that I spend sawing, filing, carving and sanding this wood, I often find myself reflecting on the effort, pride, resolve and all the human feeling that went into felling the trees, hand hewing them into logs, cutting them to fit each other, lifting them into place, chinking and daubing the spaces between the walls, and moving into a small, safe place in a great, harsh wilderness. These buildings were used, sometimes for many generations, by pioneering families as shelter and protection for their families and livestock.  The wood these guitars are made of is truly rare and there will never be any more than exists today.
     I was encouraged by family, friends and several working professional musicians to begin making them for the general public. The cost of building the guitars is expensive. The time to build them is considerably longer than with other wood types due to termite, worm and beetle damage inside otherwise sound looking pieces, which must be removed, worked around or repaired to end up with a top quality guitar when it is finished. I can get enough wood right now to produce 4-5 years of guitars, at a rate of one guitar completed every couple of weeks.
     Pioneers used to brand their property for identification. Most people are aware of the branding of horses and livestock. They may not be aware that they used to brand many of their possessions, saddles, wagons, trunks, harnesses, etc. In the spirit of this tradition I will be branding the Ensworth name into the headstock of each guitar.
     Owners of these guitars will have, not only a truly custom guitar of exceptional quality, but one made from the rarest of woods available. The guitars are heirloom quality and will bring the owners and their heirs’ pleasure for generation after generation."
- Ed Harnage, Luthier                         
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
 Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Summary...

Hello lovely people! Here at Tin Pigeon HQ we have been working incredibly hard and things are looking very busy and exciting for this year! We have been away writing and recording brand new tunes set for release very soon and have TWO of our biggest full UK tours across March and April taking us to play further than ever before! Things are starting to get very exciting and with all of this going on... we need your help to make it happen in order to make it to the next step!

Making music that we love, being able to play across the country and meeting amazingly supportive people honestly means the world to the four of us. We feel so honoured to have had all of your support over the years and we hope to be able to play for you all and continue to keep things moving and make even more music for you to enjoy!

UK Tour:

https://c1.iggcdn.com/indiegogo-media-prod-cld/image/upload/c_limit,w_695/v1519676491/ir9hxzsanzpm0bqu588i.png

What We Need & What You Get

We are currently looking to raise £2,500 in order to get us on the road for two full UK tours, get back into the studio to record new music, produce a music video, and fund a marketing campaign!

As a break down... this is where that money will be going...

£1,500 - studio rental, producer fees in order to record new singles.

£500 - to cover touring costs in order to get on the road for our UK tours.

£250 - PR campaign for new music.

£250 - Music Video promo for new singles.

With the help of Indie Go Go, if we do not meet this total, any money that we are able to raise will go into helping us fund the two tours!

In return for your help raising this money, we have some cracking gifts on offer! We have spent a lot of time over the last few weeks thinking of ideas and designing handmade and personalised gifts for you. 

The Impact

Over the last few years as a band we have had some amazing experiences, and down to your continued support and demand for new music, we have been able to continue doing what we love!

The music industry is a tough cookie, and we are putting everything we have into making our music and playing the best we can at our shows - because we honestly love it so much. With your help in raising this money we will be able to continue cutting our own path in the industry.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many ways you can get involved to help us out here, the biggest is just to spread the word! 

We love you and are so grateful for everything so far xxx

Big Pigeon Love,

Fraser, George, Tom and Antonio.

story:
Kratka povijest sranja

disclaimer: Odvratno sam skriboman, tak da por favor, imajte strpljenja pročitat ove pizdarije. 

Ajmo proć polako pizdarije koje su dovele do ovog projekta koji se upravo događa. Još kao klinac sam iznimno volio glazbu, što je učinilo da nakon kaj sam našao pradedinu klasičnu gitaru, poželim svirat gitaru. Skoro sam završio osnovnu muzičku za klasičnu gitaru, al onda su me starci odvukli u Đurđevac. Tamo sam kurac svirao gitaru, ali sam krajem srednje škole napravio bend imena Eto Zvuk (i dalje najbolje ime) u kojem sam svirao bubanj jer nitko drugi nije htio bit šupak na bubnju. Nakon povratka u zg sam svirao u bendu Notime Toulouse koji je fakat mogao bit jeben da svi nismo bili retardirani, pa sam snimio album sa Stampedom (Tandara Mandara 1998.), onda Massimom (Massimo 2002.), pa svirao sa Saneom, snimio live album sa Pips, Chips and Videoclips (Dokument 2004.), pa snažno gažerski svirao s Lanom Jurčević i Lukom Nižetićem (iako je bila super zajebancija) i snimio dva albuma sa Saneom (Do not cover 2012. i About Time 2014.).  Sve te godine sam malo svirao, malo pjevao, malo bio pijan ko sotona i odustajao od svega radi okolnosti ili karaktera, ne znam. 2006. sam dobio i dvije stipendije za faksove u londonu (vokal i bubanj), ali sam si mogao podanfat karu, jer nisam imao ni za kartu do Dugog Sela, a kamoli do Londona. 

Sve te godine sam nerijetko bio vrlo pijan i razočaran u činjenicu da se nemreš u hr bavit glazbom ak sa strane ne radiš neki najgluplji posao ikad i to za malo love. To je činjenica. I onda sam pijano bičao po blogu il forumu jer kaj ćeš drugo radit kad si u usranoj situaciji. Nikaj. 

 

2009., kad sam imao mrvu bolju situaciju i mogao sam sjest i počet snimat kak treba sam napisao i snimio 10 pjesama na hrvatskom u demo kvaliteti i iako sam ja mislio da su pjesme dobre, nitko od izdavača me nije jebao pol posto. Mislim da me ne bi jebali ni danas, jer će radije brijat na Festival Melodije Dijamantnog Pimpeka Ulješure u Škrbovićima, nego poslušat ikaj kaj zvuči drugačije. A kamoli izdat. U tom razdoblju se i Sane reaktivirao, pa sam prebacio sav fokus na to i radio isključivo to. I živio od mjuze, po prvi put u životu. I bio jako pijan stalno, jer smo imali besplatnu cugu na svirkama, a svirali smo puno. 2014. je Sane otišao u kurac i Dan mi je predložio da napravimo bend i sviramo moje stvari. Iako nekak radi čitave situacije nisam imao neke force to radit, napravili smo ga, al je uskoro i to otišlo u pimpek. Imali smo par koncerata, doduše, to je bilo fora. 

 

Dan me u međuvremenu nagovarao da snimimo album do kraja, al kak sam prečesto ne bio u zg, htio sam pričekat s tom idejom jer nisam imao pojma kad i kak. Snimanje albuma je ljudska i logistička noćna mora. 

2017. sam izdao solo EP naziva "Winter", dio kvadrilogije "Drawing Birds" koji sam većinom snimio sam i miksao sam i iduće kaj sam trebao izdat je bio nastavak, "Spring". Na žalost, Dan nas je sve prerano napustio i odlučio sam snimiti sve stvari na hrvatskom, jer je on već snimio sve svoje gitare za taj album. Jako se usrano osjećam kaj radim "in memoriam" album, trebali smo to dovršit skupa, kak smo i počeli. Ali život je kurvetina. 

Zapravo mi je žao kaj sve te pjesme sve ove godine sjede po kompjuteru il na youtubeu u jako lošoj kvaliteti, jer nisu loše pjesme. Neke su čak i odlične. Ne kažem da sam jeben, ali koliko užasnog najgoreg dna govna se izdaje svaki dan, blagi bože, zašto ja sumnjam u sebe imalo. Al eto, to tak ide. 

Stvarno bi htio da kupite albume. Mislim da su stvarno dobri i da se isplati dat lovu za njih. I kaj je najgluplje, samo ću si pokrit troškove. Ak ikad uspijem zaradit lovu s ovim bez izdavačke kuće, pr agencije, ikakvih veza, poslat ću raketu u svemir. Dobro, neću u svemir, al neku prskalicu ću zapalit. 

Na hrvatskom albumu mi kao Dno'k u dens pjesmi gostuje Sett iz Švestera (što ćete morat pričekat do izlaska albuma), a u najavnoj za engleski album Eeva iz Beograda koja je ubojica vokala sam takav. Svakak poslušajte, jer je stvar gotova i na youtubeu. <3

 

Kaj trebam, a kaj vi dobivate

 

  • Trebam 2 soma eura. Toliko sam spičkao na albume do sad. Morao sam kupit novi komp, a mrzim kompjutere, morao sam kupit novu gitaru jer se stara rastočila ko cigan u birtiji stajačici, kupio sam neku pizdariju koja spriječava da mi vokal zvuči ko da sam u kupaoni pa ga se onda da miksat i mislim da će me miks koštat jedno soma eura. To je dosta depresivna činjenica, da stvari koštaju, općenito.
  • Tu bi trebao reć kaj brutalno nudim, tak mi nudi ovaj template, ali zapravo nudim to kaj sam radio, 18 pjesama na 2 jezika i na 2 albuma. Kao treći perk nudim stari EP za euro, ak uzmete ova dva. Nije tak loše. 
  • Ak ne skupim 2 soma eura, i dalje ćete dobit albume jer jebeš mi mater, ovaj put izdajem albume i bit će jebeni. 

IMPAKT (prevodim template)

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Bit ću sretnija osoba, iskreno sretnija. Jebeš lovu. Al ono, da netko podržava ono kaj radim.
  • Jednom prije su me nagovorili da radim crowdfunding za knjigu koju zapravo stvarno iskreno nisam htio izdat i skupio sam nekih 600 eura, ali nisam stavio fleksibilni cilj. Pa nisam morao izdat knjigu. Više ne dopuštam ljudima da me nagovore na sranja, jer onda ja ispadam nedosljedni idiot. 
  • Dakle, svakak dobivate albume. 

Rizici i izazovi (opet prijevod) 

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Zadnja dva albuma Sanea sam uglavnom ja vodio što se organizacije tiče i uspio provest sve kaj smo trebali napravit najbolje kaj sam znao. Zapravo, na kraju smo se raspali i nismo mogli više, tak da ne znam dal su svi ljudi dobili drugi cd, jer smo sva trojica bili preumorni i od posla i jedni od drugih. Sad sve ovisi o meni, pa bar tu mogu ful bez beda preuzet svu odgovornost.  
  • Nemate rizik. Rizik je da će album izać u petom mjesecu, a ne u četvrtom i to ak miksovi ne budu gotovi na vrijeme. Al držim fige da budu. 

Kaj možete ak mi ne date lovu

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Šerajte dok ne umrete od šeranja, šaljite svima, šaljite nekoliko puta dnevno, sve, stalno. 
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Ne znam kaj su Indiegogo share tools!

Za kraj ću vam postavit dvije recenzije prošlog EP-a koje su napisali kolege koje iznimno cijenim, a koje do sad iz svima nepoznatog razloga, nikad nisam nigdje stavio. 

 

JR August

Čovjek koji iza sebe ima jedan od najbogatijih glazbenih puteva, nevjerojatan muzički talent, sviračku i pjevačku sposobnost te težnju poistovjećivanju s mnogobrojnim likovima unutar njegove osobe je Stefan Pelzreich, mnogima poznatiji kao Drito Konj, ili najnoviji one-man-band Two Hundred Million Idiots.

Drito iliti Two Hundred Million Idiots, pripadao je nekad vjerojatno najuvježbanijem i najspretnijem zagrebačkom trojcu Sane u kojem je još uz dvojicu glazbenih genijalaca, Nikolu i Seba stvarao autorsku muziku i zabavljao slušateljstvo odličnim coverima svjetskih hitova.

Danas Drito živi i radi u Berlinu pa je zbog toga i ušao u novi lik, što mu je itekako svojstveno, lik Stefana odnosno Two Hundred Million Idiots. Čak mi ova posljednja rečenica nije ni točna, jer, Stefan trenutno putuje po Dalekom istoku i uživa u životu slobodnjaka.

Zašto toliko volim glazbu ovog čovjeka, iako ga osobno ne poznajem dobro (upoznali smo se i pričali, sada već davno, u stanu Žanamari Lalić) je vrlo lako odgovoriti – zato jer, iako često mijenja stvaralačke persone – ne glumi! I to se definitivno čuje. Još jedna od stvari zbog kojeg volim to što taj čovjek radi je to što je nevjerojatno muzikalan. U svom glazbenom životu upoznao sam jako puno ljudi koji se bave muzikom. Neki ne znaju svirati, neki ne znaju pjevati, neki su slabi autori, neki slabi aranžeri, a neki su sve to ali suprotno, a opet nisu muzikalni. Po meni, Drito ima sve to i još je k tome i muzikalan, što je, ruku na srce, karakteristika koju sam vidio kod možda deset ljudi koje sam u životu upoznao.

Ovaj album je nešto o čemu ne treba pisati već ga treba slušati. Predivno aranžiran i osmišljen, a opet, prošao je mimo oka, odnosno uha domaćih kritičara. Ali, po drugoj strani, koga briga za kritičare. Oni do kojih ovaj album treba doći, - doći će.

Cijeli album nema ni jednu bezveznu pjesmu, a tekstovi su vrlo promišljeni i pametni, baš kakve ih volim! Moj favorit s albuma je zapravo i bonus track albuma koja, doduše nema tekst, ali je filmski lijepa, predivno aranžirana kompozicija koja savršeno zaokružuje ovaj album koji je toliko pitak da ga možete slušati i ujutro i popodne i navečer.

 

Mirela Priselac Remi (Elemental) 

"Two hundred million idiots" ima komplicirano ime ali jednostavnu muziku. Svi koji se bavimo muzikom znamo da je najteže napraviti nešto jednostavno. Lako se uhvatiti u pretjerivanje, overplay i nepotrebno ukrašavanje. Na kraju izgubiš poantu pjesme - zato su mi se Stjepanove note tako lako zalijepile na dušu.

Materijal je jezgrovit, taman dovoljno traje da ne zamori. Ono što bih osobito istaknula su akustične pjesme, s minimalnim aranžmanom - mislim da je to pravac koji bi trebao više slijediti jer zvuči sjajno.

Vokal je načet vremenom, poderan cigarama i cugom, ima neku patinu zbog čega povjeruješ u riječi koje pjeva. Autentično je, krvari iskrenošću, emocija nije lažna ni u jednom trenutku. Jedino što bih možda izbjegla repane pjesme - malo mi zvuči previše nedorađeno.

Akustika is the way to go, minimalizam, jednostavnost, iskrenost. Obavezno poslušati.
Favorit albuma - "Charlie". - 5 zvjezdica ;)

Morao sam kupit novi komp, a mrzim kompjutere, morao sam kupit novu gitaru jer se stara rastočila ko cigan u birtiji stajačici, kupio sam neku pizdariju koja spriječava da mi vokal zvuči ko da sam u kupaoni pa ga se onda da miksat i mislim da će me miks koštat jedno soma eura. To je dosta depresivna činjenica, da stvari koštaju, općenito.
Tu bi trebao reć kaj brutalno nudim, tak mi nudi ovaj template, ali zapravo nudim to kaj sam radio, 18 pjesama na 2 jezika i na 2 albuma. Kao treći perk nudim stari EP za euro, ak uzmete ova dva. Nije tak loše. 
Ak ne skupim 2 soma eura, i dalje ćete dobit albume jer jebeš mi mater, ovaj put izdajem albume i bit će jebeni. 


IMPAKT (prevodim template)
Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

Bit ću sretnija osoba, iskreno sretnija. Jebeš lovu. Al ono, da netko podržava ono kaj radim.
Jednom prije su me nagovorili da radim crowdfunding za knjigu koju zapravo stvarno iskreno nisam htio izdat i skupio sam nekih 600 eura, ali nisam stavio fleksibilni cilj. Pa nisam morao izdat knjigu. Više ne dopuštam ljudima da me nagovore na sranja, jer onda ja ispadam nedosljedni idiot. 
Dakle, svakak dobivate albume. 


Rizici i izazovi (opet prijevod) 
People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

Zadnja dva albuma Sanea sam uglavnom ja vodio što se organizacije tiče i uspio provest sve kaj smo trebali napravit najbolje kaj sam znao. Zapravo, na kraju smo se raspali i nismo mogli više, tak da ne znam dal su svi ljudi dobili drugi cd, jer smo sva trojica bili preumorni i od posla i jedni od drugih. Sad sve ovisi o meni, pa bar tu mogu ful bez beda preuzet svu odgovornost.  
Nemate rizik. Rizik je da će album izać u petom mjesecu, a ne u četvrtom i to ak miksovi ne budu gotovi na vrijeme. Al držim fige da budu. 


Kaj možete ak mi ne date lovu
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Šerajte dok ne umrete od šeranja, šaljite svima, šaljite nekoliko puta dnevno, sve, stalno. 
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
Ne znam kaj su Indiegogo share tools!

Za kraj ću vam postavit dvije recenzije prošlog EP-a koje su napisali kolege koje iznimno cijenim, a koje do sad iz svima nepoznatog razloga, nikad nisam nigdje stavio.  JR AugustČovjek koji iza sebe ima jedan od najbogatijih glazbenih puteva, nevjerojatan muzički talent, sviračku i pjevačku sposobnost te težnju poistovjećivanju s mnogobrojnim likovima unutar njegove osobe je Stefan Pelzreich, mnogima poznatiji kao Drito Konj, ili najnoviji one-man-band Two Hundred Million Idiots.Drito iliti Two Hundred Million Idiots, pripadao je nekad vjerojatno najuvježbanijem i najspretnijem zagrebačkom trojcu Sane u kojem je još uz dvojicu glazbenih genijalaca, Nikolu i Seba stvarao autorsku muziku i zabavljao slušateljstvo odličnim coverima svjetskih hitova.Danas Drito živi i radi u Berlinu pa je zbog toga i ušao u novi lik, što mu je itekako svojstveno, lik Stefana odnosno Two Hundred Million Idiots. Čak mi ova posljednja rečenica nije ni točna, jer, Stefan trenutno putuje po Dalekom istoku i uživa u životu slobodnjaka.Zašto toliko volim glazbu ovog čovjeka, iako ga osobno ne poznajem dobro (upoznali smo se i pričali, sada već davno, u stanu Žanamari Lalić) je vrlo lako odgovoriti – zato jer, iako često mijenja stvaralačke persone – ne glumi! I to se definitivno čuje. Još jedna od stvari zbog kojeg volim to što taj čovjek radi je to što je nevjerojatno muzikalan. U svom glazbenom životu upoznao sam jako puno ljudi koji se bave muzikom. Neki ne znaju svirati, neki ne znaju pjevati, neki su slabi autori, neki slabi aranžeri, a neki su sve to ali suprotno, a opet nisu muzikalni. Po meni, Drito ima sve to i još je k tome i muzikalan, što je, ruku na srce, karakteristika koju sam vidio kod možda deset ljudi koje sam u životu upoznao.Ovaj album je nešto o čemu ne treba pisati već ga treba slušati. Predivno aranžiran i osmišljen, a opet, prošao je mimo oka, odnosno uha domaćih kritičara. Ali, po drugoj strani, koga briga za kritičare. Oni do kojih ovaj album treba doći, - doći će.Cijeli album nema ni jednu bezveznu pjesmu, a tekstovi su vrlo promišljeni i pametni, baš kakve ih volim! Moj favorit s albuma je zapravo i bonus track albuma koja, doduše nema tekst, ali je filmski lijepa, predivno aranžirana kompozicija koja savršeno zaokružuje ovaj album koji je toliko pitak da ga možete slušati i ujutro i popodne i navečer. Mirela Priselac Remi (Elemental) "Two hundred million idiots" ima komplicirano ime ali jednostavnu muziku. Svi koji se bavimo muzikom znamo da je najteže napraviti nešto jednostavno. Lako se uhvatiti u pretjerivanje, overplay i nepotrebno ukrašavanje. Na kraju izgubiš poantu pjesme - zato su mi se Stjepanove note tako lako zalijepile na dušu.Materijal je jezgrovit, taman dovoljno traje da ne zamori. Ono što bih osobito istaknula su akustične pjesme, s minimalnim aranžmanom - mislim da je to pravac koji bi trebao više slijediti jer zvuči sjajno.Vokal je načet vremenom, poderan cigarama i cugom, ima neku patinu zbog čega povjeruješ u riječi koje pjeva. Autentično je, krvari iskrenošću, emocija nije lažna ni u jednom trenutku. Jedino što bih možda izbjegla repane pjesme - malo mi zvuči previše nedorađeno.Akustika is the way to go, minimalizam, jednostavnost, iskrenost. Obavezno poslušati.Favorit albuma - "Charlie". - 5 zvjezdica ;)

story:
Hi Everyone!! Many of you already know who I am - but for those I haven't met yet, my name is Jeff Desira and I’m a songwriter, vocalist, and muti-instrumentalist from San Francisco, Ca. My Genre is Alternative Rock, but within my music you can hear elements of Acoustic, Folk, and Americana. I’ve made many records in the past, but I’m currently working on my second solo effort entitled “Summer to Fall”.

 

My last record (“Weathervane”, 2014), produced by Scott Mickelson, was a successful solo debut achieving not only sales within the United States and abroad but gained the attention of film producer Brian DiMuccio (20th Century Fox, Outpost 31 Media) who placed 3 of my songs in a new romantic comedy titled “The Way We Weren’t”. (http://www.imdb.com/title/tt4241904/?ref_=nv_sr_4)

 

WHAT’S IN STORE:

 

My goal with “Summer to Fall” is to bring these new songs to the next level in order to maintain the caliber of material I have to present, so I’ve decided to record this new and exciting project with acclaimed musician and producer Chris Manning (Jellyfish, Guster, Third Eye Blind, Bouncing Souls, Eric Martin). “Summer to Fall” will be a 10 song record, 3 of which have already been paid for out-of-pocket. In order to ensure that each song is met with the treatment they deserve, I’m trying to raise $10,000 to help with the costs to record, mix, package, promote and ultimately tour.

 

THIS IS WHERE YOU COME IN:

 

For $10 you can get a digital download of the new record even before it’s officially released!  If you can support more than that, there are many exciting offerings as thanks for your faith and support in the album, ranging from a signed limited print of the album art with an advance physical copy of the record to your own private house concert with all the perks from the lower tiers!

 

If your wallet won't allow you to contribute to the campaign, you can still invest in great music by spreading the word about it! Independent music survives when fans share it with their friends. So jump on Twitter, Facebook, or Gmail and use the hashtag #fundjeffinSF to let people know about this chance to support your favorite local singer/songwriter. There are some helpful buttons to the right of my video at the top of this page, where it says "Back It".

 

MY PLEDGE TO YOU IN RETURN:

 

- An album of my best work to date with outstanding production.

 

- I'll stay connected throughout the production process via email and social media..

 

- You will have your pledge items delivered to you as promised.
