story:
WE HAPPY

Hello! We are the band We Happy based in Phoenix, Arizona.

We Happy is a project begun in 2015 as a female-fronted band. We call our musical style "Vibe with an Edge" as we combine different genres, such as rock, pop, indie, and alternative. Our goals are to connect with new fans, and to inspire others by spreading our message.

We have a love and passion for music! The 3 of us (Robert, Katie and Max) have been playing music together for 6 years and individually for over 10 years. We Happy are also music teachers. Email us at wehappy@wehappyband.com for info on lessons.

Robert and Katie teach at the School of Rock in Scottsdale, Arizona. Max teaches at Kirk's Studio for the Performing Arts also in Scottsdale. All members of We Happy play and teach multiple instruments. They teach 1-on-1 lessons and also direct performance programs where they help their students learn how to rock out with their class band live in concert.

We have been working very hard for the past 2+ years to reach our goal as musicians to write and record our first full length album. 

We’ve already self-funded the first half of our record, while spending time with our amazing producer, Curtis Douglas at Red Mountain Studios in Tempe. 

Curtis is known for recording bands such as The Maine, Katastro, Sunset Voodoo, and many more amazing artists. 

Have you ever popped your favorite band's CD into your car on a road trip and listened to it from front-to-back? We've always dreamt of doing this with our own full-length CD, and you can help us make that a reality!

Our campaign is important to us because we want to share with the world what we have been working on, for all ages and ears to listen to. We are thankful for the ongoing support from our fans, and without our "happy campers" we wouldn't be where we are.
We also want our music to inspire our fans to spread positivity and good vibes

Here is the first single release from our album titled "Shaggy"

 

What We Need and What You Get:

With your help and support we will be able to pay for our recordings, get our recordings mixed and mastered, and distributed. Everyone can pick the perk that they like and receive something very special that we have chosen :) Email us at wehappy@wehappyband.com if there is a perk you'd like to see!

Our perks include: 

  • $10 - Download of 10-song album 
  • $25 - 10-song album download, a signed CD + sticker
  • $45 - Black We Happy T-Shirt, a signed CD, 10-song album download + sticker
  • $45 - White We Happy T-Shirt, a signed CD, 10-song album download + sticker
  • $65 - "Happy Camper Special" Special edition We Happy T-Shirt, a signed CD, 2 tickets to album release show, 10-song album download + sticker,
  • $50 - "Crypto Camper Special" Same as the "Happy Camper Special" but $15 less if you donate using your favorite cryptocurrency (BCH, DASH, LTC, BTC, STEEM). Email us at wehappy@wehappyband.com for instructions on donating with crypto.
  • $100 - Your name designed inside CD inside cover, a signed CD, 2 Tickets to album release show, 10-song album download + sticker
  • $250 - 3 Music Lessons of your choice, a signed CD, 2 Tickets to album release show, 10-song album download + sticker
  • $500 - Private We Happy show (Arizona)

Here is another single from the album titled "Be Easy"

 

How Your Donations Will Be Spent:

The $8,000 we need will be used for:

  • Recording, mixing, mastering of 5 songs @ $1,200 = $6,000
  • T-shirts, artwork, printing, and shipping = $1,000
  • Physical CD's, duplication, album artwork, and shipping = $1,000.

Other Ways You Can Help:

We understand some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can help get the word out by sharing this page with your friends using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • We will also accept donations using your favorite cryptocurrency!  Contact us by email for special instructions on using crypto.
  • Email us at wehappy@wehappyband.com for instructions on donating with crypto using an alternate payment method.

Here are our QR Codes:

   Bitcoin Cash (BCH)                                Dash Cash                                  Litecoin (LTC)

                           

                                     Bitcoin Core (BTC)                                      STEEM

story:
About TWIK

From its' inception, The World I Knew has been about playing music and having fun. We are a group of guys who share a passion for good song-craft, fun shows and parties. But as time has progressed, this passion has turned into a movement, with our music turning into something more; an idea. The idea that we all are in the same boat, dealing with the same issues, and at the end of the day we all need a way to express the emotions that come with those issues, whether it be the pain of the daily struggle or simply wanting to forget the pain and dance the night away. TWIK represents everything.

What We Need & What You Get

In today's world a dream needs financial backing in order to materialize, lest it stay a dream forever. The fact is, bringing our music to the people we love is not as cheap as just writing the music. The music we have covered, but that is only the beginning.

  • $2000 goes to recording alone
  • $700 for the pressing of the cds
  • $700 for merchandise to go with the release, including shirts, posters, stickers and hats
  • $600 for promoting the album, including advertising on all social media platforms, as well as radio
  • $500 for artwork and design for both the album and the merchandise
  • $500 for touring expenses for the album, such as gas

While all of these expenses are budgeted generously, the fact is that bare minimum the album itself has to be recorded and pressed. So even if we do not reach our goal, just know that the first $2000 we receive will strictly go to the recording and the next $700 will go to pressing the CDs, bare minimum!

The Impact

Here at The World I Knew making music has always been our dream, and that goes for every member of our team. The idea of getting to do what we love for a living has always seemed like a pipe dream, but with each new song we write and show we play it has becomes more apparent that this dream we have, and the music we write, is meaningful and powerful to more than just us. So with that realization comes a motivation to become the most that we can be, continuing to write songs to help people and change lives, and hopefully someday write truly great songs for the ages.

In just the past year we have gone from 1,000 facebook followers to almost 3,500, with more people discovering our music everyday. We have gone from playing empty shows to only family and friends to opening for national bands with crowds of thousands, often drawing even the most reluctant of listeners at the back of the room to the stage. The evidence seems to point to the fact that we are on to something good here, and we are at the junction where we need the help and good faith of our fans to make that leap to finding out just how far this dream can go. Each and every one of you makes a difference to us! We love our music and we love making it, and we know that there are more lives out there to touch.

Other Ways You Can Help

As normal people who work day jobs and do not have a lot of money to spare, we recognize that not everyone can help us reach our goal monetarily, but that does not mean that is the only way to help us get where we need to go! Even a simple share could help us connect with the right people! So please, share this page and our band's page to all of your friends, help us keep making noise!

story:
The band

We're a rock & roll band out of Poulsbo, WA and have spent the last several years honing our sound through live shows across Western Washington. After our first album we added a fourth member (Mikey Gentry), and have been slowly developing a new sound for the sophomore album. 

 

This is where you come in

You’re basically the our record company. Because, well, we don’t have one, which is how we want to keep it! The first album I (Thys) saved up gig money and side work, and had some amazing people donate (thank you, you beautiful people who know who you are). We don't have time for that this time around. So we want your help by purchasing the album, and any of the other perks included. 

Here's a list of the types of things we need to pay for to get this album out:

  • Studio time
  • Engineer / mixer
  • Mastering of final mixes
  • Vinyl production
  • Artwork and swag
  • Streaming service setups
  • Release promo

We've done as much work on the songs as we can before we hit the studio to save recording fees, but we know we need a minimum of $10,000 to do it right. Although that's not a lot compared to other band's album costs, it's a lot to us :). But we also know it's a goal we can reach once our fans hear where our sound is going next, which is why we've paid to have one song recorded and released to say thank you to each of you who support us (you can hear a part of it in the video above).

 

What you get

Choose as many as you want!

  1. Album download (pre-release access)
  2. Album on vinyl + digital download 
  3. Ticket to House Show in our studio BEFORE Album release show
  4. Your name included on album art for above & beyond support

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • SHARE SHARE SHARE and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Do your own fundraising and tell us what you're doing - maybe we can help.
  • Promote the music. Talk to your favorite venues and bands about having us on the bill. We can't get in front of new faces all by ourselves. If you're connected in other music communinites, open a door for us.

Thank you for taking the time to be a part of this next album, and all the ways you've supported us over the years. This next album is the biggest thing we've done so far, and we wouldn't event attempt to pull it off if we didn't have all you amazing people with us.
story_txt:
The band
We're a rock & roll band out of Poulsbo, WA and have spent the last several years honing our sound through live shows across Western Washington. After our first album we added a fourth member (Mikey Gentry), and have been slowly developing a new sound for the sophomore album. 
 

This is where you come in
You’re basically the our record company. Because, well, we don’t have one, which is how we want to keep it! The first album I (Thys) saved up gig money and side work, and had some amazing people donate (thank you, you beautiful people who know who you are). We don't have time for that this time around. So we want your help by purchasing the album, and any of the other perks included. 
Here's a list of the types of things we need to pay for to get this album out:

Studio time
Engineer / mixer
Mastering of final mixes
Vinyl production
Artwork and swag
Streaming service setups
Release promo

We've done as much work on the songs as we can before we hit the studio to save recording fees, but we know we need a minimum of $10,000 to do it right. Although that's not a lot compared to other band's album costs, it's a lot to us :). But we also know it's a goal we can reach once our fans hear where our sound is going next, which is why we've paid to have one song recorded and released to say thank you to each of you who support us (you can hear a part of it in the video above).

story:
“BACKROADS”

This project is being presented by me, J Streets AKA Julien Streetman.

BACKROADS has become my passion, and my vision is to produce the album and videos to the highest artistic level possible.

 

I come from a family of musicians. My grandma Jannie Streetman was a self taught singer. She had such beautiful phrasing and authenticity to her singing whether it was gospel songs or the blues. My dad, Chic Street Man, has been a professional singer, songwriter, guitarist for almost 50 years. My uncle Dwight is the band leader and vocalist for a very successful Top 40’s band in Boston MA.

My Grandpa Sorensen was the Dean of Music at two prestigious colleges. My Uncle Karl has an award winning high school Jazz Band & Choir and Concert Band & Choir program. My mom is a classically trained violinist and has played professionally for 30 years.

I spent my childhood hearing all kinds of music, but in everyday life would hear my dad playing the blues in one room and my mom playing classical music in another. I formally studied violin for seven years and piano for three, and along the way picked up a bit guitar on my own.

When I decided to take a break from school to pursue this project, I realized music is in my blood. I am compelled to explore my own path.

 “Backroads” is my debut album, expressing my journey.

I actually wrote dozens of songs, but choose 12 to perfectly mold the project.

I have a close knit team that I work and consult with on a daily basis. They include business and artistic networking to develop the ground work for release of the project.

Original artwork for the album cover by a prominent Northwest artist is in progress and I am very grateful and excited about it.

There have been many steps along the way including writing the songs, the lyrics, and finding the right audio engineer and studio to work with.

One crucial and very exciting part of “Backroads” is the video for the first track. I will be collaborating with film directors DJ McCoy and Sam Hansen. I have known DJ since we were in kindergarten together. While I started producing music at a   young age, DJ started working in film. While in high school he won a Junior Oscar. He is in film school in Los Angeles, so I will be going down there for 12 days to film the video with DJ and his crew. We have a very full and detailed schedule mapped out for every single day.

“Backroads” is an artistic project, but there is so much more to it. The business of music has to be attended to with equal care. With that I have written a budget, a timeline, networked to lay the ground work for a successful release and managed all aspects of the project.

My main goal is to be true to my artistic vision and produce a true and authentic album and video.

Thank you for your reading this far! If you can’t contribute, I would appreciate getting the word out and making some noise!

 

 

GENERAL BUDGET

+A conscientious Plan+

 

+ Studio time (12 songs at about 4 hours each and $60 an hour)                                   $3000

+ Purchase of beats                                                                                                                  $1200

+ In the Future Live Musicians and Recording in Nashville

  • Travel                                                                                                                    $300
  • Live Musicians                                                                                                      $750

+Mix and Master                                                                                                                       $1000

+ Promotion                                                                                                                              $1000

+ Graphic design and Original Cover Art                                                                                $300

+ CD Printing/Vinyl Printing                                                                                                    $1500

+ Video for one other song                                                                                                      $800

 

+Backroads Video

  • Travel/Lodging/Food/Transportation LA 12 Days                                       $2500
  • Wardrobe                                                                                                             $300
  • Model for video                                                                                                  $500
  • Car rental for video                                                                                            $500
  • Build set                                                                                                                $800
  • Filming Permits                                                                                                    $200

 

[TOTAL COSTS:$14,650]

INDIGOGO FUNDRAISING GOAL:$10,000

 

+I am very careful to keep costs as low as possible without compromising quality.

+I have a lot of people working with me that are collaborating but not charging.

+My fundraising goal is less than my projected costs.

+I have already invested in myself this just helps me over the finish line!!

 

THANK YOU!

story:
Short Summary

I am a songwriter and musician originally from Eastern Ontario.  I have recently moved back here after over a decade of living in the Yukon.  I'm excited to be recording with James Stephens at his studio near Old Chelsea in Quebec. 

The subject matter for this album is raw and personal.  It reflects the evolution of my writing, playing and way of being since my departure from the Yukon.  

What I Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise $8,500.  This money will be used to pay the accompanying musicians and for studio fees that include engineering, mixing and mastering.  It will also be used for graphic design and reproduction.   The independent folk scene is not a lucrative one and cash flow is an on-going adventure.  

Everyone who contributes will receive a copy of the new album.  There are also exciting perks like guitar lessons, original artwork and private concerts.

Indie Go Go allows the option of 'flexible funding'.  This means that if I don't reach the targeted goal, I can still keep the money that has been contributed.  If the goal isn't reached, I will cover the remaining costs of the album personally.  

The Impact

By contributing to this project you are supporting the creation of original music that follows the tradition of oral history and political protest.  It is a tradition that places value on the strength of community and I see crowd-funding as an opportunity to build community.   

Making this new album is at the heart of my creative process and my business practice.  Time in the studio is essential to clarifying and elaborating on my musical ideas.  It builds collaborative relationships, creating strong new material to reach to a wider audience through radio airplay and CD sales. It allows me to hone my ability to translate my lived experience into story, and to connect to the folk tradition.  

Risks & Challenges

James Stephens and I are recording this album as a team at his studio.  We have been playing together for the past couple of years and have proven that we work well, bouncing musical ideas off of each other.  

While this will be my 3rd solo album, it is the 6th album I have recorded and released independently.  I have 5 albums worth of experience in organising this scope of project and while there will inevitably be hurdles to jump along the way, I know my legs are long enough to get over them.  

Financing this album is the biggest challenge I face.  I will contribute my own funds raised from playing gigs, teaching guitar lessons and guiding canoe trips.  Any amount you are able to contribute will be of great value.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to make a financial contribution you can still be a part of this project by helping to get the word out to your friends and family.  You can share this page through social media and beyond.  Lets make some noise together and make this thing happen.  Thank you for your support!

story:
Everybody always talks about supporting musicians, and here is the chance to do it for real!

I would be very happy if you could help me to cover the following direct expenses:

  • The Mastering
  • A bit of Promotion
  • Power and Heating for the Studio for a duration of 120 days at 10 hour workdays. 
  • Food for about 100 of those days.

The amount is a bare minimum and doesn't include any salary for me, equipment, rent, pension etc. If I included those things, I would need to ask for at least 10-15 times more, given the high costs of living in Switzerland.

It was only possible for me to invest 1200 hours into making this album, because I have a daytime job and was able to spread the work over several years. Which is why I only release an album once in 5-10 years.

If I was able to make a living with the music I would of course make a lot more music and that means if we exceed the campaign goal I will fully invest every cent into making more music.

More Info and the Download link is here: https://goo.gl/A3sFa2
Liking and sharing is support too! :)

Any support is welcome and there are perks to motivate you :)

story:
Who we are:

Cécile Nordegg|No-Ce & Band is a jazz combo, based in Vienna, Austria. Our very unique sound combines the art of storytelling of the French chanson with elements of rock'n roll all wrapped up in classy jazz.

Our first album "No-Ce Chansons No-Ce" was released in 2012; JAZZ PROCLAMATION is our forth album now and we are taking this program to the Edinburgh Fringe this year and hopefully to many other places.

We will be playing three shows (August 6/7/8 2018) at the AMC@UCC in Edinburgh. 

A lot of things in life we are able to achieve on our own, within our little circle with our own hard work. But then for all of us come times when we have to depend on other humans on a wider circle for help and support. This is one of those times. And what would life be without mutual support and generosity, without the respect and admiration we have for one another.

 

What we need and what you get:

To participate in the Edinburgh Fringe is quite an endeavour. To participate as a combo of four even more. Travel costs, food and lodging, venue fees, public relations, flyers; all that an more adds up to quite a bit. That is why we hope to raise 5.000 Euros with this campaign. This money would help to cover a bit more than a third of the estimated total costs.

Even if we are not going to hit our goal of 5.000 Euros every cent we generate will cover expenses related to our shows ad the Edinburgh Fringe 2018.

So - check out our perks! There are some very interesting offers to find. Some perks are related to music, the music of Cécile Nordegg|No-Ce & Band and some perks will be related to art. Jonathan Berkh is an artist, also based in Vienna. He has created the covers of all releases of Cécile Nordegg|No-Ce & Band. With the covers for JAZZ PROCLAMATION Vol. 1 & 2 and for the CD JAZZ PROCLAMATION for the first time Jonathan used his own art to create the covers. And there are some fantastic perks featuring his work.

 

The impact:

Performing at the Edinburgh Fringe this year will be our first chance to perform in the UK. The Edinburgh Fringe is an enormous and amazing festival and the best place to be seen and maybe network oneself into further opportunities. 

 

Risks and challenges

In our profession as in many others we are always taking risks, we wouldn't be doing and loving what we do if we didn't. But taking risks and facing challenges brings us to new grounds and wonderful experiences... most of the times... hopefully;)

  

Other ways you can help

Well, if you can't support financially please share this campaign  and spread the word, talk to friends, families, art- and music lovers.

love and be loved - thanks to you all

story:
Being a self made artist is both challenging and rewarding.  I love the freedom this path has offered me and I love (you) the dedicated music-lovers that have joined me on this journey.  I can't tell you how much I appreciate your support. 

Having said all that -  one thing a self made artist really needs in order to do anything (produce a great-sounding album, print merchandise, hire musicians) -- is funding. I'm hoping you'll join me in this journey to my next musical project -- that is -- a FULL-LENGTH ALBUM!

Even though this is my first solo album, I believe I have enough faithful listeners and friends that are willing to be co-contributors to a real high-quality full-length album!

I feel more inspired than ever to write better music; always pushing and challenging myself. My main inspiration for this album has been Americana with Funk and Urban undertones.  I have much material to sort through and refine, and in this process I have found that new songs keep coming to me.  I have a theme for the album content, the visualization for photography and art, as well as guest  lined up to join me. I'm very excited about where this album will take me - and you! 

Thank you so much for reading, supporting and sharing this campaign with your friends and networks. That is really the only way I'll be able to do this!

If you can only do one thing - please share with your entire social networks! 
Need some ideas?

  • Email!
  • Facebook!
  • Twitter!
  • Blogs!
  • Youtube!
  • Music forums!

Thanks a million - I can't wait to get started!!!

story:
Hi!

We are The Drew Torres Trio, 3 musicians born and raised in New York City.

Over the past 3 years, we've been hard at work in our humble home studio recording our newest full length album, "Look Back To The Passed."  We're incredibly lucky to have been able to record this album ourselves, in our own space, at our own pace, and without a deadline. The result is an album that we are thoroughly proud of. More than anything, we want to be able to press physical copies of this record for our friends and family. However, in order to do that, we're gonna need some help!

Every penny raised for this album is being put towards helping the band grow, not our pockets. We need physical copies of the album, we need shirts and other merchandise, and we need to do some work on our van so we can get out there and play our hearts out. We've done some math, and it's going to run us about $3,000 to put out high quality products, as well as get ready for the road. The prices we've set are to cover the expenses of actually pressing the merch, and (hopefully) to help out with food, gas, and motels on tour.

We want you to know that regardless of whether or not we meet our campaign goal, we are definitely going to move forward with pressing this merchandise! All 3 of us have full time jobs, but we also have families to support. By pre-ordering the merch, it will help us have a few less ramen nights in the near future. We don't expect anyone to just give us their hard earned money, and we're not asking anyone to! We'd much rather you choose a perk so you can own a little piece of our journey, whether it be in the form of a physical item or in the form of an experience. Think of each donation as a pre-order. With that said...

THE PERKS!

We've put a lot of thought and time into creating a fun list of perks for you to choose from, because we have to make sure you're getting what you pay for! There are standard album perks of either digital or physical CD, and even an awesome dual-sided USB flash drive option to toss on your keys and share our album wherever you go. On top of that, we are putting out our first t-shirt run, a limited edition poster, stickers, bracelets, pins, and you can also choose some combo perks for discounts! We're offering FREE SHIPPING on all items for anyone living in the United States. Chances are we're going to drive this stuff out to you personally anyway, so we can give you a really big hug.

Wanna know what we're really excited about though? Our live show perks...

These are going to be one of a kind, truly memorable performances, dedicated solely to whoever claims each of these perks. Check them out for more details, and if you have any questions about them, ask away! 

What we're MOST excited about, however, is our biggest perk...

Writing a song that will be featured on our next full length album that is 100% inspired by, dedicated to, and written with... YOU!

*We are also open to any and all perk suggestions!*

Other Ways You Can Help

Every penny counts in helping us achieve our goal, and you can be sure that we are beyond grateful. However, we get that not everyone who comes across our campaign may be able to financially support us at this time. It's okay if you can't. We're not gonna get mad at you, be weird with you, guilt trip you, or anything like that. After all, we're running this campaign because we're in the same boat!

If you have just a few seconds to spare however, please, share our campaign. It would honestly mean the world to us. We need all the help we can get spreading the word about us, our new record, and of course this campaign. There are even share tools right next to the "Back It" button, for a fast, easy share all over the place!

 

THANK YOU

Thank you SO much for taking the time out of your lives to hear us out and support us. This is a big step for us as a trio... on what we hope will be a long journey of sharing the stage with each other, and most importantly, with you. Our friends and family have all been so incredibly supportive of us both individually and as a group for our entire careers, and we can't thank you enough. Now we're finally hitting the ground running with an album we're all proud of, taking it on the road as far and as often as we can once it drops.  Once we get the ball rolling, we're not stopping.

We love you all, and we'll see you on the road soon...

 

Drew, Mike, and Danny

The Drew Torres Trio
story_txt: Hi!We are The Drew Torres Trio, 3 musicians born and raised in New York City.Over the past 3 years, we've been hard at work in our humble home studio recording our newest full length album, "Look Back To The Passed."  We're incredibly lucky to have been able to record this album ourselves, in our own space, at our own pace, and without a deadline. The result is an album that we are thoroughly proud of. More than anything, we want to be able to press physical copies of this record for our friends and family. However, in order to do that, we're gonna need some help!Every penny raised for this album is being put towards helping the band grow, not our pockets. We need physical copies of the album, we need shirts and other merchandise, and we need to do some work on our van so we can get out there and play our hearts out. We've done some math, and it's going to run us about $3,000 to put out high quality products, as well as get ready for the road. The prices we've set are to cover the expenses of actually pressing the merch, and (hopefully) to help out with food, gas, and motels on tour.We want you to know that regardless of whether or not we meet our campaign goal, we are definitely going to move forward with pressing this merchandise! All 3 of us have full time jobs, but we also have families to support. By pre-ordering the merch, it will help us have a few less ramen nights in the near future. We don't expect anyone to just give us their hard earned money, and we're not asking anyone to! We'd much rather you choose a perk so you can own a little piece of our journey, whether it be in the form of a physical item or in the form of an experience. Think of each donation as a pre-order. With that said...THE PERKS!We've put a lot of thought and time into creating a fun list of perks for you to choose from, because we have to make sure you're getting what you pay for! There are standard album perks of either digital or physical CD, and even an awesome dual-sided USB flash drive option to toss on your keys and share our album wherever you go. On top of that, we are putting out our first t-shirt run, a limited edition poster, stickers, bracelets, pins, and you can also choose some combo perks for discounts! We're offering FREE SHIPPING on all items for anyone living in the United States. Chances are we're going to drive this stuff out to you personally anyway, so we can give you a really big hug.Wanna know what we're really excited about though? Our live show perks...These are going to be one of a kind, truly memorable performances, dedicated solely to whoever claims each of these perks. Check them out for more details, and if you have any questions about them, ask away! What we're MOST excited about, however, is our biggest perk...Writing a song that will be featured on our next full length album that is 100% inspired by, dedicated to, and written with... YOU!*We are also open to any and all perk suggestions!*Other Ways You Can HelpEvery penny counts in helping us achieve our goal, and you can be sure that we are beyond grateful. However, we get that not everyone who comes across our campaign may be able to financially support us at this time. It's okay if you can't. We're not gonna get mad at you, be weird with you, guilt trip you, or anything like that. After all, we're running this campaign because we're in the same boat!If you have just a few seconds to spare however, please, share our campaign. It would honestly mean the world to us. We need all the help we can get spreading the word about us, our new record, and of course this campaign. There are even share tools right next to the "Back It" button, for a fast, easy share all over the place! THANK YOUThank you SO much for taking the time out of your lives to hear us out and support us. This is a big step for us as a trio... on what we hope will be a long journey of sharing the stage with each other, and most importantly, with you. Our friends and family have all been so incredibly supportive of us both individually and as a group for our entire careers, and we can't thank you enough. Now we're finally hitting the ground running with an album we're all proud of, taking it on the road as far and as often as we can once it drops.  Once we get the ball rolling, we're not stopping.We love you all, and we'll see you on the road soon... Drew, Mike, and DannyThe Drew Torres Trio

story:
This is Us....

We are parents of six flesh and blood, beautiful, hormonal, creative cyclones. They are our primary source of joy, pain, hope, and pride. Nurturing them and helping them become human beings who make a positive imprint on our world is our highest calling, most glorious adventure, and most exhausting task. We are songwriters; shaping our experiences into melody and harmony. 

Our first album, Let Fall the Fine was like giving birth to a seventh child. The songs were formed and created deep in our hearts from our own experiences living, loving, and working in central Vermont. It was a unique and precious experience working with David Goldsworthy of Little Gems Productions to record them. And our greater community helped us bring that album into the world in more ways than can be numbered. 

This new album is our eighth baby....

It is time for it to emerge into the world and once again, we need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

We began recording with Kristina Stykos of Pepperbox Studios in early spring. We decided to approach this record a little differently and more traditionally, laying down isolated instrumentation first and adding vocals later. It has been a totally new experience and one that has taken many hours. We are really excited about the end result. 

Now that everything has been recorded, we have exhausted our own resources and will need to reach out again to our community of fans to help us bring you the finished product. The tracks all need mixing and mastering and then can be sent off to be pressed! 

We are 1970s kids. We grew up on vinyl and cassette tapes and saw the emergence of the CD. To us, holding a physical album in our hands is part of the experience of listening to music. I can remember so vividly that feeling of ripping open the plastic wrap on a new album and pouring over the album art while I listened to the music for the first time. Looking at the photography and album art, reading the lyrics and hearing the stories behind the songs would always connect me deeper to a song and the artist. And, of course, it always solved the inevitable lyric pronunciation mysteries. 

We want to carry forward that experience in this generation of digital downloads and iCloud storage. While technology has many advantages, we want to give you something beautiful to hold in your hands.

The Cost Breakdown

  • We have a few tracks that we want to add some extra instrumentation to....having a guy in the band that plays five instruments is pretty handy and just too tempting to resist. We'll need to cover our studio costs to go back to Pepperbox and add a little bass here and there....$1,000
  • We will need to cover costs for the editing and mixing. $1,200-$1,500. We came to the studio prepared and have worked very hard in our sessions. We've payed for all of the studio time, but Kristina now needs to edit and mix the tracks to bring you the best possible sound. She is a gypsy stardust queen at the mixing board; an artist herself, making a living at her passion as a sound engineer and musician in Vermont. And when she's not in the studio, she's got her hands in the dirt as a landscaper.  It has been an absolute honor to work with her on this project. 
  • After the mixing is completed, Kristina will send our songs out to be mastered. $1,200-$1,500.
  • Album art: I had the pleasure and privilege of attending a private arts high school in Massachusetts for my junior and senior years of high school. Jason Goodwin, a fellow WHS alum, has agreed to provide the album art for our new record. We had a very specific vision for the album art, and he jumped right in and has created something absolutely stunning to pair with the songs on this album. We are so excited to bridge these two mediums to bring you a sensory experience of listening to our music. $500
  • Pressing the album and duplicating the CDs with a companion booklet of art, photographs, and lyrics is $2,100. We are going for it here with a global distribution package to expand our audience.

  • Indiegogo collects 5% of whatever we raise for the use of their ingenious fundraising platform. 

  • Plus, credit card and PayPal fees, perk fulfillment, and shipping.

The Impact

We are so proud of this project. We have grown over the last two years as human beings, as musicians, and as songwriters. Making music and writing songs is how we share ourselves and make an impact on the broader world and leave an imprint for our kids beyond the grave. We have faith that this new album will reflect both the pain and the joy of that growth. But most of all, we believe this album holds a special message in the midst of this violent and sometimes painfully divided culture.

Risks & Challenges

It has been somewhat of a challenge for us to approach recording a new album. Our passion is to bring you the absolute best from ourselves musically, but we are confined financially. Andy works full time as a carpenter and I am a homeschooling mother. This album has pulled a lot from us as artists and we wish we had infinite monetary resources to keep up with the artistic vision.  That is where community comes in....

Having been through this process once before, and having received such a tremendous and overwhelming amount of support for our first album, we have hope and confidence in our community of family, friends, fans, fellow artists, and musicians to help us bridge the financial gap and complete this project. When you back this new album, it is an investment in the growth of our duo, it pays local artists who are pressing through the practicalities of life to pursue their passion, AND you will receive the gift of homegrown music on a canvas of handcrafted art. It is a winning formula! 

We are choosing flexible funding again which allows us to keep whatever we raise at the end of the campaign even if we don't reach our proposed goal. We want this album to be born into the world even if it takes longer than we hoped. We will only run the campaign for 30 days. With the funds raised, we can finish this project with the care with which we began it. 

Other Ways You Can Help

It's not always about money....

Every contribution helps us reach our goal, so don't think your $10 won't make a difference and please don't be confined by the maximum limits we set. Anything over and above what we need to raise only helps us do more with our music. And if you can't make a financial contribution, please share our story, our campaign, and our music! Most of all, please come hear us play locally. Nothing is so encouraging and meaningful to us as musicians than to have an audience who wants to hear our music.

Thank you from the bottom of our hearts....walking this journey with you makes it all the more special!!

story:
Business Summary/History

The initial idea to start a label was conceived years ago by our founder/manager/beat scientist Chace Springborn. The concept for the label developed as we saw a need for upcoming artists to join a team of experienced professionals all dedicated to the same cause. These days record labels aren’t willing to take risks on unestablished artists. We saw that many of our peers had the talent to succeed in the industry but didn’t have the right team behind them. We saw artists locked into contracts that robbed them not only of their money but also their creative control. These experiences are what molded our philosophy. We are a label that provides loyalty, freedom and passionate dedication to artists that we believe have the raw talent and drive to make an impact on the culture. Later on we had the idea to not only work for the artist, but to educate artists so that they can begin to work for themselves. Education is a crucial part of our company. We’ve all been lucky enough to have the resources to learn about the industry and we feel that it is our responsibility to pay that forward. As a band, over the past year we've been striving to create the scene in Boston that we wish to thrive in. We host hip hop nights every second Thursday at the Middle East, booking local artists that we believe are making an impact on the culture. We hope that through this company and our artistic output we can put Boston on the map and set a higher bar for every other record company. 

The Impact

We genuinely believe that the vision we have for this company will change the way that the music industry values art and the artists who give so much to us. In this day in age the traditional standards that record companies operate under are quite frankly outdated and contribute negatively to the culture. Record companies would rather minimize their risk by bleeding already well established artists of their revenue and creative vision than provide loyalty and dedication to artists that can revolutionize the culture and make a difference in the world. We know that it's time for a change. Our company is not about making millions but rather about shaking up the music industry and making a positive impact on our culture in the time that we have in this world. We know that this won't be an easy road, but we believe with hard work and passion it is achievable. On a more day to day basis we hope to inspire upcoming artists by providing discounted lessons for underprivileged kids in the Boston area.  We’ve been incredibly fortune to be able to attend music schools and participate in outstanding music programs. One of our main goals is to foster creativity and technique in the next generation of artists. We hope that this will be a lasting legacy left by of our company. 

What We Need & What You Get

We know, we know, it's a lot of money! We've done a lot of planning to pin point how much money we need to make this dream a reality. Let's break it down, we need: 

$500 to register our business as an LLC in the state of Massachusetts 

$250 to set up our publishing company 

$1,200 to copyright our debut album and singles 

$250 to trademark our business 

$700+ to promote our album and business 

$500 for branding, logos, business cards and signage 

$2,000+ to begin paying rent on our studio/office space 

$250+ for our website

$500+ to start up our merchandising/fashion branch GRAMR

For all of your generous donations we've thought up some cool, unique ways to show our appreciation and love! From lighters, stickers and signed CDs to custom artwork, personalized thank you raps, and studio time/custom top shelf beats from our producers we want you all to know and see how much this means to us that you believe in and are willing to fund our vision! 

We want to thank you for any contributions to this campaign! Small or large, every dollar you donate is a sign to us that you are standing in solidarity with our vision to make a positive impact in the world. 

 

ALSO, one last thing, we have a very detailed, professional business plan for this operation that will be sent out to anyone upon request! Hit us up, we're proud of it.

story:
Familia! Friends!
It’s been a long time coming and many of you have been eagerly asking! After dedicating most my life to music, and music performance, I am finally ready to dedicate the time to record a studio album for all of you. FluteTrance has been quite the journey and now I'm moving forward with my name as just "Giselle"!

As many of you know I trained and dedicated over 20 years to classical music and then found myself wanting to create something different and unique based on fusion. 
Inspired by Miami's own electronic dance scene, as well as some other very popular conscious dance scenes, like ones in Ibiza and Bali, coupled with my personal ties to Native American/indigenous music and rituals, this album will achieve a warping balance between the haunting intimacy of underground electronic music, tribal melodies and rhythms from varying indigenous cultures, and the sweetness of lullaby music presented in an unconfined air of horizon-scanning grandeur in the choruses. 
The main melodies of this music have been composed by me with the intention of reaching your soul for healing and awakening in a mostly subliminal manner as this is primarily instrumental music without lyrics to guide your emotions. Many melodies are also coming from traditional “medicine music”; music that is for healing. 


I am, for the first time in my life, feeling brave enough to offer my music up to my community and the world as part of that bigger picture.

 

Many people close to me have been aware that I have always been involved with different types of music, and most recently this “medicine music”. Over the years, I’ve created an arsenal of original songs, and have finally realized they’re worth keeping around and developing thanks to the unyielding support and encouragement of my family and friends. This project will help introduce my music to a broader audience, as well as share the writing that has become such a big part of who I am.


All has been aligning beautifully and naturally for this project to begin and move forward. This Indiegogo campaign is the last step I need to take, and your support will help make this album real.

 

This campaign is raising funds for my first professionally recorded album with Walker Barnard, a producer, musician, and engineer with 15+ years of experience working with both established and up-and-coming musicians. He is also the mastermind behind the magical electronic "Air Festival" held on the Gili Islands. Walker is truly a weaver of sounds and a bridger of worlds, constantly reinventing and always focused on the one true path of dance floor transcendence and creation of love-infused sonic architecture. I'm super stoked to have him as my producer for this album.

Together, Walker and I are digging into my original material, revising arrangements, and adding creative ideas to bring my songs to life in a way that wouldn’t be possible without your help.

I am hoping to raise $20,000. This will cover all the costs of the recording, production and distribution of the album.

As a preview of the album, Walker and I are preparing to release a 3-song EP called "Tribal Waters" very soon exhibiting some of the sound of this upcoming album.

This album is being produced in what we call a prayerful and conscious way. Many of the tracks are inspired by music intended for healing and awakening our consciousness to our divine purpose as human beings to be love, take care of each other, and especially take care of our Mother Earth.

To create an album of this quality and involvement, studio time and producing costs add up quickly. With that said, this campaign can give us a unique opportunity to collaborate and make great art together. Your donation will cover following costs of my project:
 

1. Pre-Production: This is where everything starts. Walker and I sit down, taking original song ideas and starting to craft the arrangements for each of these songs that will eventually go on the album. Here, we take the time to create a rough sketch of each song, mapping out structure, which helps me, Walker, and any other musicians involved better envision our goals for each song before we start recording.  This ensures maximum use of studio time and a better understanding of the goals of each piece before recording.

2. Recording: This is when I enter the studio and start capturing the music and where the songs become what you'll hear on this album. Here, we can also add instruments I don’t currently play myself, but that will take my arrangements to the next level, like drums, bass, electric guitar and any other instrument that will add the perfect texture and balance to these songs. ($10,000)

3. Mixing & Mastering: Each track will get mixed to create the right balance between instruments, texture and color that make up a track. As a final step, the album will be mastered from beginning to end, so the listening experience is cohesive and carefully choreographed from start to finish.  Like editing a book, it is making sure every phrase and note is placed perfectly. ($3,500)

4. Featured Musicians: I will be inviting some other top musicians to record on this album guitar, percussion, bass, secondary vocals, and other exotic instruments and need them to be compensated. ($2000)

5. Basic PR/Marketing/Artwork: I'll be seeking press and media support in various cities where I have a following. Some will be editorial features, and interviews, as well as video promotion. I'll also need support covering the expense of the artwork. ($3000)

6. Indiegogo Fees: All amazing platforms usually have fees and Indiegogo is no exception. The remaining balance will go to supporting the fees.

 

Every show of support is meaningful to me. Here’s the chance to get something in return for your support!!

I am so appreciative and grateful for any help people can lend to this campaign. I've put together an exciting group of gifts that are available exclusively through your participation in this campaign, so that everyone can benefit from this project!

Some examples are below and a full list to the right! If any of these interest you, make sure to click on the gift link to donate and receive! 

  • Early Digital Release
  • Hard Copy of Album
  • Deluxe Hard Copy of Album
  • Album Process Package
  • "Haux Music" Tank Top signed by me
  • Custom Artwork Print
  • Acoustic Version of a couple of the songs
  • Private Music Lesson
  • Guest Producer
  • Exclusive invite to the pre-release listening party
  • Private Concert

 

It's hard to express how much this project has the ability to change my life and the way I view what I do. 

Music has this incredible ability to heal and unite people, and to express and transmit feelings that help us feel connected in fundamental human ways. For a long time, I was under the impression that I wasn’t doing enough with my music, when in truth, it was because I did not think it would be possible or that anything would come of it. Thanks to Walker Barnard and this opportunity, I have come across a renewed faith in myself and my music that can only go forward from here.  

Having the ability to make this album is something that will open many doors for me to provide the music I write and the message I want to send to those who might be able to benefit from them in the same way that I do from writing them.  

If you’d like to contribute, just click the pink "Contribute Now" button on the top right of this page. I invite you to Pre-order the album and any of the other perks that inspire you! And for those of you who feel unable to financially support in this moment know that spreading the word is a very valuable gift for me also.

You are warmly welcome to:

Direct people to my IndieGogo page. 

Share the campaign video on your FB page.

Email your friends and family around the world (this system works the best).

There are social media share buttons on this page and we all know a little can go a long way.  Part of the point of the project is simply having the confidence to share my music and this is certainly a way to do it.

Thank you so much if you have read all this and for taking the time to consider everything this campaign is truly about.

With Love,

Music by Giselle Real-d’Arbelles
Produced by Walker Barnard
story_txt:
Familia! Friends!It’s been a long time coming and many of you have been eagerly asking! After dedicating most my life to music, and music performance, I am finally ready to dedicate the time to record a studio album for all of you. FluteTrance has been quite the journey and now I'm moving forward with my name as just "Giselle"!As many of you know I trained and dedicated over 20 years to classical music and then found myself wanting to create something different and unique based on fusion. Inspired by Miami's own electronic dance scene, as well as some other very popular conscious dance scenes, like ones in Ibiza and Bali, coupled with my personal ties to Native American/indigenous music and rituals, this album will achieve a warping balance between the haunting intimacy of underground electronic music, tribal melodies and rhythms from varying indigenous cultures, and the sweetness of lullaby music presented in an unconfined air of horizon-scanning grandeur in the choruses. The main melodies of this music have been composed by me with the intention of reaching your soul for healing and awakening in a mostly subliminal manner as this is primarily instrumental music without lyrics to guide your emotions. Many melodies are also coming from traditional “medicine music”; music that is for healing. I am, for the first time in my life, feeling brave enough to offer my music up to my community and the world as part of that bigger picture. Many people close to me have been aware that I have always been involved with different types of music, and most recently this “medicine music”. Over the years, I’ve created an arsenal of original songs, and have finally realized they’re worth keeping around and developing thanks to the unyielding support and encouragement of my family and friends. This project will help introduce my music to a broader audience, as well as share the writing that has become such a big part of who I am.All has been aligning beautifully and naturally for this project to begin and move forward. This Indiegogo campaign is the last step I need to take, and your support will help make this album real. This campaign is raising funds for my first professionally recorded album with Walker Barnard, a producer, musician, and engineer with 15+ years of experience working with both established and up-and-coming musicians. He is also the mastermind behind the magical electronic "Air Festival" held on the Gili Islands. Walker is truly a weaver of sounds and a bridger of worlds, constantly reinventing and always focused on the one true path of dance floor transcendence and creation of love-infused sonic architecture. I'm super stoked to have him as my producer for this album.Together, Walker and I are digging into my original material, revising arrangements, and adding creative ideas to bring my songs to life in a way that wouldn’t be possible without your help.I am hoping to raise $20,000. This will cover all the costs of the recording, production and distribution of the album.As a preview of the album, Walker and I are preparing to release a 3-song EP called "Tribal Waters" very soon exhibiting some of the sound of this upcoming album.This album is being produced in what we call a prayerful and conscious way. Many of the tracks are inspired by music intended for healing and awakening our consciousness to our divine purpose as human beings to be love, take care of each other, and especially take care of our Mother Earth.To create an album of this quality and involvement, studio time and producing costs add up quickly. With that said, this campaign can give us a unique opportunity to collaborate and make great art together. Your donation will cover following costs of my project: 1. Pre-Production: This is where everything starts. Walker and I sit down, taking original song ideas and starting to craft the arrangements for each of these songs that will eventually go on the album. Here, we take the time to create a rough sketch of each song, mapping out structure, which helps me, Walker, and any other musicians involved better envision our goals for each song before we start recording.  This ensures maximum use of studio time and a better understanding of the goals of each piece before recording.2. Recording: This is when I enter the studio and start capturing the music and where the songs become what you'll hear on this album. Here, we can also add instruments I don’t currently play myself, but that will take my arrangements to the next level, like drums, bass, electric guitar and any other instrument that will add the perfect texture and balance to these songs. ($10,000)3. Mixing & Mastering: Each track will get mixed to create the right balance between instruments, texture and color that make up a track. As a final step, the album will be mastered from beginning to end, so the listening experience is cohesive and carefully choreographed from start to finish.  Like editing a book, it is making sure every phrase and note is placed perfectly. ($3,500)4. Featured Musicians: I will be inviting some other top musicians to record on this album guitar, percussion, bass, secondary vocals, and other exotic instruments and need them to be compensated. ($2000)5. Basic PR/Marketing/Artwork: I'll be seeking press and media support in various cities where I have a following. Some will be editorial features, and interviews, as well as video promotion. I'll also need support covering the expense of the artwork. ($3000)6. Indiegogo Fees: All amazing platforms usually have fees and Indiegogo is no exception. The remaining balance will go to supporting the fees. Every show of support is meaningful to me. Here’s the chance to get something in return for your support!!I am so appreciative and grateful for any help people can lend to this campaign. I've put together an exciting group of gifts that are available exclusively through your participation in this campaign, so that everyone can benefit from this project!Some examples are below and a full list to the right! If any of these interest you, make sure to click on the gift link to donate and receive! 
Early Digital Release
Hard Copy of Album
Deluxe Hard Copy of Album
Album Process Package
"Haux Music" Tank Top signed by me
Custom Artwork Print
Acoustic Version of a couple of the songs
Private Music Lesson
Guest Producer
Exclusive invite to the pre-release listening party
Private Concert
 It's hard to express how much this project has the ability to change my life and the way I view what I do. Music has this incredible ability to heal and unite people, and to express and transmit feelings that help us feel connected in fundamental human ways. For a long time, I was under the impression that I wasn’t doing enough with my music, when in truth, it was because I did not think it would be possible or that anything would come of it. Thanks to Walker Barnard and this opportunity, I have come across a renewed faith in myself and my music that can only go forward from here.  Having the ability to make this album is something that will open many doors for me to provide the music I write and the message I want to send to those who might be able to benefit from them in the same way that I do from writing them.  If you’d like to contribute, just click the pink "Contribute Now" button on the top right of this page. I invite you to Pre-order the album and any of the other perks that inspire you! And for those of you who feel unable to financially support in this moment know that spreading the word is a very valuable gift for me also.You are warmly welcome to:Direct people to my IndieGogo page. Share the campaign video on your FB page.Email your friends and family around the world (this system works the best).There are social media share buttons on this page and we all know a little can go a long way.  Part of the point of the project is simply having the confidence to share my music and this is certainly a way to do it.Thank you so much if you have read all this and for taking the time to consider everything this campaign is truly about.With Love,Music by Giselle Real-d’ArbellesProduced by Walker Barnard

story:
Hello everyone!

I am ASAF "XTRDNRY" Goren. I am a musician, rapper and a professional breakdancer.

I am a DREAMER. I'm creating this campaign in order to raise money for a music video for my new song "Flowers".THE SONG will influence and inspire people to go after their dreams. This song is very personal to me, it is about being betrayed, humiliated and pursuing your dream with no support from the people around you. 


Me and my team are very excited to work on this project! The cost to make this video is about $2500. I need you help! please help me make this happen! 
This one is for those who dream BIG!

Let's do it!

 

ASAF

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
We’ve been making music together since childhood

We met as young misfits at Concord Youth Theater in Massachusetts where we performed in musicals as pirates, lost boys, monkeys and kangaroos.

In 2016, after years of drifting in and out of each other’s lives, we reunited in Los Angeles as housemates. Our childhood bond over musical theater became the foundation for our new connection as career musicians. Lucas is a multi-instrumental composer and producer, Addy is a songwriter, singer, and producer.

The birthplace of Jane’s Addiction, 369 Wilton Place has a musical legacy that inspired us to revitalize our spider infested garage into a functioning production/recording studio.  Even though we were still working 40 hours a week, we spent every free moment on our project.  We began commercial operation in May 2018, providing tutoring in Ableton music production to emerging musicians.

It didn’t take long for this cozy spot behind our house to become a favorite hang-out for stray cats and a growing group of up-and-coming music and entertainment talent. The growth we’ve experienced - despite our very limited resources - has compelled us to take 369 North Studio to the next level. 

 

What sets 369 North Studio Apart?

369 North Studio is full-service recording and production studio with a unique focus on artist coaching, learning, and development. We are committed to helping artists evolve through creative anxiety, perfectionism, and fear of failure. 

We’re guided by our deep passion and curiosity for all styles of music and creative process while maintaining a fun and relaxed environment. 

We strive to facilitate multi-genre art of the highest quality to expand creative possibilities for our artists, their teams, and their fans. 

 

Why are we crowdfunding?

 

We’re fundraising $15,000 to expand our business activities, upgrade our space and services, and support our artists in taking their creative projects to market. 

Supporting our artists

Many projects curated at 369 North thus far are ready to move forward. With your support, we will be able to: 

  • Prepare and conduct pitches for sync licenses for television and film! 
  • Develop PR and market budgets to help our artists expand their audiences! 
  • Expand our network of consultants and creative professionals to help our artists build project teams and go to market! 

 

Expanding our capabilities

With your help, we’ll be able to outfit the studio with better equipment, complete the process of completing our quirky backyard space’s transition into the 21st century (while still maintaining its nostalgic 20th century charm!). We’ll do this by:

  • Conducting repairs because our floors are damaged from a pesky leak in our roof! 
  • Building storage and shelving to take the best possible care of our equipment!
  • Outfitting the space by completing the sound treatment!
  • Building a vocal isolation booth for recording industry quality vocal tracking! 
  • Improving our inventory by expanding our selection of microphones and music toys!

 

Building up our business

We’re committed to fostering a flourishing symbiotic ecosystem of independent artists, freelancers, and entrepreneurs.  

We’ve been blessed to have incredibly talented people lending us their time, ideas, and energy to bring 369 North Studio to where it is right now. With financial support, we can hire these skilled designers and consultants to finish helping us set our business up to succeed. 

 

How are we going to do that? 

By bringing you into the fold! 

We’re most excited to offer you the chance to develop your own custom song in any genre, no matter how silly or serious the topic. 

We’ll get to know you, what you are looking for, and then write, compose, produce and record the best song you never knew you needed! 

In addition to custom song package,we’ve opted out of purely traditional campaign perks and instead, designed a range of service packages and treats with both artists and art lovers in mind! 

Some of our pack

  • Professional production and engineering services with our experienced and highly capable founders! 
  • Remote and on-site lessons and tutorials in songwriting, music production, sound engineering tools, and more for you or as a gift! 
  • Professional project development services from recording and producing your EP to project planning, photoshoots, video content, and anything else you need for your project to succeed! 
  • Private concerts by 369 North’s incredibly talented artists! 
  • Access to our music catalogue for your listening pleasure! 
  • Studio and artist merchandise to show your support for independent art, small business, or just look fly! 
 

The risks and challenges of our venture

369 North Studio is not simply a dream, but is already a profitable business. Our main challenge is to attract more clients and grow the studio that today includes a few microphones, a piano, a synthesizer, 4 guitars, Ableton software, and a universal audio interface. The risk is that we will grow slow. But whatever happens, we’re going to continue our work and continue to find new ways to move forward.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

This campaign is about more than just fundraising.  We are hoping this campaign will continue to expand our artistic community and establish 369 North Studio as a place for artists of all kinds to collaborate and grow. 

If you aren't able to pledge money (we’ve been there), there are still plenty of ways to support us on this journey:

  • Share our campaign using Indiegogo’s share tools because crowdfunding requires a real crowd!
  • Talk about our artist coaching and other studio services with friends, family, and any artists who might benefit from our heavily discounted campaign service packages! 
  • Follow us on Facebook and Instagram and comment on our posts with your ideas and suggestions!
  • Tell us about your services if you’re a freelancer, entrepreneur, entertainment lawyer, consultant, or interested in collaborating with us or on our artists’ projects! 
  • Introduce us to artists, music journalists, and creatives who need a studio to call home!

story:
Hey Guys!!!!

First of all, I'm so lucky that I've been blessed that you are a member of my awesome community of supportive people who love what I'm doing on the internet. Thank you for making it possible to release my first album! The purpose of this continued campaign is in order to keep pre-orders organized, since so many people approached me to tell me that they missed the cut off for the campaign that was here: https://igg.me/at/ariellaalbum/x/21965608#/ . We nearly reached our goal there, and so if you want to join us to make this album happen, I would be so grateful to you for your support.

 

This is a continuation campaign for people who were interested in joining and felt like it was too short, or didn't get in on time. The cd is NOT going to be released to digital platforms, rather will be released as singles over the course of a year. That means that if you want the full cd, you must order it here or buy from me directly. 

Now, back to the story.

As an Orthodox Jew, I've found the violin to be a great bridge between my community and people outside the community who see me as their eyes onto Israel and Judaism - especially as I share my experiences with you guys, my tribe, on social media. Since starting this journey to finding a unique musical contribution to the world, I've experimented with rock n roll, bluegrass, jazz, folk, ethnic music, looping, singing, and Irish music.

And now, drum roll, please! 

I'm so excited to say that I'm going to be releasing my first album that blends all of this together. 

And here's where you come in.

 

I can't do this alone.

I've worked so hard to bring this music into the world- this new genre, this upbeat, inspiring music, this mix between genres, this bridge between cultures- but it's an expensive journey. It requires:

- Hours in the studio, recording, arranging, mixing, mastering.

- Producing videos

- Putting on shows and promoting the album.

I've started on my own but I need you for this next step. This is music that is deep and awesome and powerful, and has already spread internationally to dance troupes all over the world. 

 

And now, here's your part.

 

You’re the final bridge to bringing this into the world/ making this possible.

 

You can preorder the cd, I'll write a song for you, buy some swag, book a private lesson, or book me for your venue (I'll be doing a US tour in November), and if you're local, come join me at the launch party with the full band. I can't wait to see you there.

 

You have been such an amazing part of this journey and thank you so much for being part of my crew.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to make this album happen, the main thing we need funding for is the studio work.  I am working with some of the best in the industry to bring you the absolute best possible quality that we can. In order to have that happen, the cost is going to be around $12,000. That includes production, recording, mixing, arranging, and mastering. Basically-just the music. If we reach this goal, this album IS HAPPENING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  We reached that goal this week, thanks to you incredible people, and now this continued campaign is so that we can keep pre-orders organized!

This is going to affect you. This music will take you on a ride that you'll be so glad you went on. And, I just want to share with you, that despite all the challenges, I'm still working for this dream. I believe in the power of music to build bridges and I believe that I'm just a channel for the light. I believe that you can be a mother and wife and have strong values and still be professional at what you do. I believe that you can be passionate and strong and still believe in God and live a life that you want to live. I believe that anything is possible when you are committed and focused. And I need you to believe that with me if this is going to happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

This campaign is about music, and I'm here to make this music reach the world. And even if you can't contribute financially, that doesn't mean you can't be a really important contributor to this project. It would mean so much to me if you would share this campaign. Social media, email lists, tell your friends. I need YOU to help make this happen. So don't worry if you can't contribute, someone you know will be able to and will definitely want to because they love music and they love all the things we all stand for. So let's spread the news!!!!

I believe that you can be passionate and strong and still believe in God and live a life that you want to live. I believe that anything is possible when you are committed and focused. And I need you to believe that with me if this is going to happen.Other Ways You Can HelpThis campaign is about music, and I'm here to make this music reach the world. And even if you can't contribute financially, that doesn't mean you can't be a really important contributor to this project. It would mean so much to me if you would share this campaign. Social media, email lists, tell your friends. I need YOU to help make this happen. So don't worry if you can't contribute, someone you know will be able to and will definitely want to because they love music and they love all the things we all stand for. So let's spread the news!!!!

story:
Intro

 

Peace! KingNicKayla and Denise Reese, here.  We both have vast backgrounds in music and the arts, as a whole.  Music has truly helped shape who we are and we believe music can be used as a tool of healing.  We are incorporating all of our creative facets, including the various instruments we both play, into making our debut album as much of a tool of healing for the world as it has been for us. 

We both play multiple instruments.  Six plays guitar, violin, bass, percussion, and keys.  NicK plays guitar, bass, tenor sax, percussion, and piano.  We will be encompassing all of these musical elements and working with a Grammy-nominated production team to bring our debut album into the world.  Our campaign initiative is for the purposes of bringing those interested in for an intimate look at the making of our debut album and to enlist your assistance in funding this indie album.  We can bring this project into fruition much sooner with your assistance.  The message that we stand by is PURPLE Days:  People Understanding Responsibilities (for) People’s Lives Everywhere; using your skills, tools, and gifts to make a difference in your family, community, and world.©️  We have been playing our music live on street corners around the world since 2016 (making a difference in our family and community) and we are asking you to help us make a difference in our world by releasing our debut album in 2019!  

 

 

What We Need 

 

While our goal is only part of the what is needed, this funding will be a great start toward covering: 

 

Cover art, studio fees, proper recording facilities for live instrumentation, production fees, editing, mixing and mastering, marketing, limited edition vinyl presses, digital publishing, licensing, and launching fees.

 

What You Get

 

We have amazing perks for you if you are ready to take this journey with us! Those perks include:

 

Digital album pre-release (Receive the album before the rest of the world!)

 

Limited edition vinyl press of our debut album

 

Handmade booklet containing handwritten lyrics from the album

 

Incentive videos starting at the halfway mark and releasing at each $1,000 mark after that exclusively to supporters

 

Sixty Seconds of Six free-styling over your favorite song

 

Behind the scenes interviews, photos, and videos documenting the recording of the album released exclusively to supporters 

 

Virtual Jam Session

 

Guaranteed album tour stop in your town

 

Thank You track

 

Executive Producer credit

 

Possible Road Blocks

 

Since we are both experienced recording artists and performers, the risk factors for this project are low.  However, of course there are always potential road blocks on the road to doing anything worth doing. We have considered these road blocks and solutions for getting passed them in order to complete this project.  If...

 

-We are looking to include instruments that the facility which our production team operates out of is not equipped to record | We have a secondary recording facility, which specializes in recording all live instrumentation, that we know and trust and will use if necessary.

 

-We have composed arrangements that become too complicated to be recorded within the time allotted |  We have a network of experienced musicians ready to consult us and assist with issues like this.

 

We will be ready to take on any and all roadblocks that come our way along this journey, as we have handled all hurdles that have attempted to stop us up until this point.  Watch 

 

It is okay if you cannot contribute monetarily, please make your contribution by sharing our campaign with your family and friends using Indiegogo's sharing tools.

story:
Midway through last year I was burnt out from running a startup. I was asking myself a lot of important questions, one of which was -- how can I bring more joy into my life? I decided that I wanted to get back into music. This EP represents not only the culmination of the first year of my journey into music production, but the beginning of a new way of being which allows me to dare to create from my heart. By supporting it, you will be helping me birth my first born :)

What I Need & What You Get
I'm looking to raise a total of about $5k. I'm planning on pressing 100 vinyls and printing 20 t-shirts but can adjust that depending on how the campaign goes. If I don't reach my target, I will still go ahead with the project out of my own pocket. All donors will get the full album digitally for free. I can only list 3 perks per contribution level here. Please review the tiers to see the exact perks for each level of contribution. I’m targeting the end of February to have all the perks delivered.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you're unable to contribute financially, no worries! There are other ways that you could support:

  • Follow me on SoundCloud
  • Introduce me to your friends at labels :)
  • Spread the word

Thank You!
There are a number of people I want to thank for your encouragement and sincere feedback, helping motivate me and holding me to a high standard. Special shout-outs to my parents and brother, Sahill, Vicki, Danny, Usman, Hillary Jor, Brogan, Mr Bill, Clarissa, Sandeep, Mikael, Javier, Anant, Sid, Lennart, Brittany, Danny, Anja, Erica, Laurens, Christine, Antonio, Axel, Toni, Ankush, Auggie and a bunch of random folks who have listened to my unfinished tracks on Soundcloud. Thank you all SO much.

And finally, I would strongly encourage you to ask yourself the question that brought me here --  how can you bring more passion and joy into our life?

With love,
Dhaval

 

 

Icons made by Roundicons under Creative Commons:https://www.flaticon.com/authors/roundicons
